loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda S. was born in 1962 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is a hard-working and non-problem client. She trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures so she applies regularly to MicroInvest.

Mrs. Mavluda S. is engaged in commerce. She has a stall in the local bazaar where she sells garments. She is asking KIVA for a business development loan in the amount of 1600 STJ for 5 months to buy new imported seasonal goods and increase her turnover.

loans.use: buying new seasonal goods

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia T. âgée de 56 ans, est une veuve et mère de 8 enfants qui vit à Bougouni un village environnant de la ville de Ségou (préfecture de Ségou quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus par sa mère, elle exerce le commerce de pagnes wax et de fancy (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest ) il y’a de cela 8 ans. 
Etant en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans, elle a bénéficié de 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et est à son deuxième individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagnes Wax et 10 pièces de pagnes Fancy auprès des commerçants grossistes de la capitale malienne Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et souvent à crédit de façon fixe au marché journalier du village et en ambulant (les pagnes mis dans une tasse) dans les quartiers de Bougouni les petits soirs à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes et de quelques d’hommes. 
Seule à mener l’activité d’achat et de vente de pagnes dans le village de Bougouni, donc sans concurrent elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et renforcer le fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de construire une maison pour ses orphelins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokia T. is a 56 years old widow and mother of eight (8) children. She lives in Bougouni, a village on the outskirts of the city of Segou (the prefecture of Sagou is the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She was taught by her mother in the ways of earning income through different business activities. Over the past eight (8) years she has been active in the business of selling "pagne" (decorative cloth). She has been associated with the Soro Yiriwaso microbank for five (5) years and has made six (6) group loans and is now on her second personal loan. All the loans have been repaid.

Mrs. T. plans to use this loan to buy 50 pieces of Wax brand pagne and 10 pieces of Fancy brand pagne from wholesalers in the Malian capital city of Bamako. She will resell these items for cash or credit at the daily village market and also through door-to-door selling (carrying her pagne, folded neatly in a head basket) during the evenings, in the Bougouni neighborhoods, to a clientele made up mostly of women and some men.

She is the leader in the buying and selling of pagne in the village of Bougouni. Without any competition she expects to earn a profit of 90,000 francs CFA which she will spend to meet the loan payments, provide for family expenses and support her business activities. Her ambition is to build a home for orphan children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pagne (decorative cloth): Wax brand and Fancy brand

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia tiene 32 años y esta casada con el señor Reinerio Villasanti y tienen 4 hijos todos menores de edad.

Basilia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de juegos de azar por la calle y hace 5 años que logro montar su despensa con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja constructor de obras.

Vive en casa propia que heredo de sus padres.

En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus mercaderías y no seguir pagando fletes.
texts.en:
Ms. Basilia A. is 32 years of age, married to Mr. Reinerio Villasanti, and has 4 underage children.

Basilia used to sell games of chance on the street, but she managed to set up her own general store 5 years ago with the help of her husband, who works in construction.

She lives in her own home, which she inherited from her parents.

In the future, she would like to purchase a vehicle in order to transport her goods and not have to keep paying shipping costs.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods such as flour, cooking oil, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma inicio hace 3 años con el negocio porque le ayudaba a vender zapatos por catalogo a una vecina así que decidió mejor venderlos por su cuenta porque la vecina le pagaba el 10 % de cada par y vendiendo ella el porcentaje de ganancia es del 50% por lo que era un mejor negocio, ya que ya había hecho clientes y hasta la actualidad le va bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancía y tener mejores ventas ya que desea poder tener un lugar en los mercados y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Norma started the business three years ago because her neighbor was benefiting from selling shoes by catalog so she decided to sell them on her own because her neighbor was paying her 10% for each pair she sold and selling them directly she would make 50% so that was a better business. She already had her clients and up until now things have gone well. She needs a loan for $400, which she will repay in six months, to invest in merchandise and increase sales as she wants to have a place to sell in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fatou Ndiaye

texts.fr: Fatou Ndiaye S., 45 ans, mariée, 07 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce d’huile de palme, d’arachide, légumes et de tissu teinté qu’elle achète au Mali. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer au paiement de la facture d’électricité de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Ndiaye S., age 45, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group CESIRI for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business in palm oil, peanuts, vegetables, and dyed cloth, which she buys in Mali. Her income enables her to help pay the family electricity bill. She is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peantus, and dyed fabrics

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị A. năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đang làm nghề đan lưới tại gia đình. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn có một cửa hàng nhỏ kinh doA. hàng tạp hoá. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị A. đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn, hai con của chị cũng được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ hơn.
Với mức vốn  10.000.000 mong muốn được vay trong vòng vốn tới, chị A. dự định sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc kinh doA. của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi A. is 32 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 1997. Today, she and her husband work from home making nets. They also have a small storefront selling general goods. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, her family's lifestyle continues to improve each day. And they can put money towards giving her children a more complete education. With the 10,000,000 VND she hopes to borrow in this loan cycle, Mrs.A. is planning to use it to invest more into the family's retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in family's retail business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Anna A. Nyengella from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 16. Anna has been in business as a food-seller since 2004. She buys crops from farmers at a low price and sells them in the city at higher price.She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Anna currently earns about $350 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase rice, maize and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the goods.  Anna thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and beans.

loans.name: Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rukia has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $65. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business in order to save money and pay the school fees of her children.

Rukia is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 17, 16, 11, and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma S., Sabah B., Mahaji Z., and Fatma R.. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food materials for her business

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda A. sells building materials. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He is requesting a loan amount of  50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Esmeraldas" esta representado por la señora Andrea y conformada por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nicolasa y su hija Maribel  ellas cuentan con pequeños negocios propios e independientes una D. la otra. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. refrescos, comida, empanadas, cosméticos, plásticos y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir a y a la construcción D. viviendas, este último desea emprender su negocio D. venta D. material escolar. Los socios(as) luchan día a día con la competencia pero tratan D. ganar su ingreso diario para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y para emprender nuevos negocios que les den mayor ganancia y una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. La mayoría trabajo con  otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios, para otros miembros es su primer financiamiento, pero saben como trabajar y responder a sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The "Esmeraldas" group is represented by Andrea and consists of 12 members, including family relations between Nicolasa and her daughter, Maribel. Each of them has their own small business and an independent income. The majority of the members work selling soft drinks, food, empanadas, cosmetics and plastics, or making clothes and building houses. Another member wants to start a business selling school supplies. The partners fight day to day against their competition, and try to earn an income to be able to bring their families their daily bread. The loan will be used to purchase inputs, materials and tools to improve their current incomes and start new businesses that will bring in a better income and thus a better quality of living for their families. The majority have worked with other financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and know how to work and respond to their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa de José Guadalupe lña señora Juanita Rodriguez Pecina. La razón por la que el no aparece es por que no se encontraba ya que trabaja todo el día.
José Guadalupe Martínez C. con un anterior préstamo que le otorgaron, empezó la construcción de un cuarto el cual con los costos de material y pago de mano de obra no le alcanzo para poner el techo de su casa. Ahora el vuelve a recurrir con nosotros pidiendo el apoyo para poder terminar su proyecto y extenderse a la parte de enfrente de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the picture is Juanita Rodriguez Pecina, the wife of Jose Guadalupe Ina. The reason for which he is not in the picture is because he works all day. With a previous loan, Jose Guadalupe began the construction of a room. Due to the costs of labor and material, he did not have enough money to put a roof over his house. He requests further support to be able to finish his project and extend the front portion of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en la Mza. E – Lt. 5, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con su crédito de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, inició su negocio con la venta de Anticuchos (carne a la parrilla) y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio vendiendo sus asados y juanes (comida típica de la región), ubicada en la vereda de su casa, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad, amigos y vecinos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en 06 cuotas, lo invertirá ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprará más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.
Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en los actos de su vida diaria.

Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria community bank. She lives at Mza. E – Lt. 5, in the Tarapoto district, in the San Martín department. She is 36, in a common law marriage, has 2 children, 1 is still dependent upon her. With a loan of 300 PEN and her own initiative, she started her business selling Anticuchos (grilled meat). It is going well for her. She still has the same business selling grilled meat and juanes (typical regional dish), located on the path to her house. She sells to community members, friends, and neighbors. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, which she will repay in 6 payments, she will carry out and expand her business. She will buy tables, chairs, glasses, pots and supplies for daily food preparation. Generally, she makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. She now feels more independent and responsible about making her payments and in her daily life. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and for supporting other women who want to undertake their business and get ahead by themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.  To buy chairs and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Fatima Amjad Saeed Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a CD center in the market. He has 3 years of experience in this business. He buys CDs from the famous market of the city of Lahore named “Hafiz center” and sells to his native city. Fatima baji operates a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her husband’s CD center.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Qamar baji, Rafiqan baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy fruits & vegetables to sell. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy CDs for CD center

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: El Señor Oscar Martínez tiene 63 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene cinco hijos dos ya casado y tres viven con ellos. Poco a poco han ido construyendo su casa, les falta todavía una parte de la casa lo cual Don oscar solicita un préstamo de vivienda. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic que es su sexto ciclo lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, bloque para construir la pared del frente de la casa y brindarle seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Martínez is 63 years old and lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur de Managua in the capital, Managua. He is married, his wife is a housewife, they have 5 children, two married and three living with them. Little by little they have been constructing their house and don Oscar is requesting a loan to be able to finish a part of the house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, which is his sixth, he will be able to buy construction material such as cement, iron, purlins, and blocks in order to build the front wall of the house and offer security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall of a house.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es socio del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Javier es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Javier vende diferentes productos según la temporada y según la demanda, como gorras y guantes en épocas de frió, en julio sombreros y lentes, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria.
Javier necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras y bufandas.
Los sueños de Javier son comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir una tienda.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” community bank. He is 34, lives with his common-law wife and their 4 children. Javier sells different products depending on the season and the demand, for example he sells hats and gloves when it is cold and in July he sells sunglasses and summer hats as a street vendor. Javier needs a loan for 1,000 soles that he will invest in hats and scarves. Javier dreams of buying some land in the center of the city so he can build a store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hats and scarves

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn R. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City,Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling peanut butter. Jovelyn has just started this business.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients such as peanuts to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Dios Proveerá Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the communal bank “Dios Proveerá” (God Will ProviD.), whose members have been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about four months.  The majority of the women live in the Manantay district in the city of Pucallpa.  Señora Loysi P. P. is 27 and is the president of “Dios Proveerá.”

“Dios Proveerá” has 12 members who are cheerful and seem to work well together.  The group is still small and its members are optimistic about their businesses.  They are requesting a loan of 8,200 Nuevos Soles in total, which each member plans to invest her portion in her business.  This will be the group’s second loan with Manuela Ramos.  The members of “Dios Proveerá” are taking seriously their commitment to make their loan payments.  The women of this communal bank dedicate themselves to a variety of businesses including selling basic grocery goods, clothing, shoes, sheets, plantains, jewelry, soda, juice and cooked food.  

The women are grateful to Manuela Ramos for the economic support provided by the organization.  They are also happy to have the educational sessions conducted by Manuela Ramos loan officers at their monthly meetings,  as these sessions will help them to further develop their businesses.

loans.use: Various goods for sale; raw materials for preparing juices and cooked foods

loans.name: Ithalie

texts.en:
Ithalie is a 32-year-old father of two who has run a small food kiosk for the last five years. He requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to purchase additional stock of foodstuff like flour, sugar and rice. He would like to continue to expand his business, one day diversifying into wholesale foodstuff. He hopes to provide for his family, send his children to school, and purchase a plot of land on which to build a home. He describes himself as friendly, social and hardworking.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa M. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, Amani and Tabu, who are ages 19 and 22.  Jumwa lives in Shanzu, Mombasa and has been running a grocery kiosk for the last six years. 

Jumwa learned about KADET through a client in Shanzu and she is glad to be accessing her first loan to finance her kiosk. With the loan she plans to purchase more vegetables and also refurbish her business premises. Her main customers are the residents of Shanzu town.

In the future Jumwa hopes to diversify by selling other foodstuffs in her store. She also hopes to establish a better and permanent retail store for her business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Modesta Odili

texts.es: Modesta Odili M. P. tiene 35 años. Es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida en el mercado, por lo que es aquí donde obtiene a sus clientes, ya que en su mayoría todos los clientes salen a la hora del almuerzo, es en este momento en donde Modesta empieza a servir los paltos de comida para que sus clientes tengan le mejor servicio. A pesar de los problemas que enfrento como es ser madre soltera y tiene que trabajar todo el día, porque tiene 1 hija y tiene que ser madre y padre a la misma vez para que a su hija no le falten los estudios y con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante. La inversión del  financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de la comida. Modesta tiene el sueño de ser la dueña de un restaurante y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Modesta Odili M. P. is 35 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is engaged in the production and sale of food. She sells food in the market; it is there that she is able to find customers. The majority of her customers go out during the lunch hour; this is the time when Modesta begins to serve the meals for her customers in order that her customers have the best service. In spite of the problems that confront her as a single mother (having to work all day, having to be both mother and father at the same time for her daughter so that her daughter does not fall behind in her studies), with the help of God she has been able to continue to move ahead. This financing will be used to purchase raw materials for the production of food. Modesta has a dream of owning her own restaurant and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is a 52-year-old general store owner from Dasmarinas, Cavite.  She is happily living with her husband, Carlos, 53, a driver, and their two children in a government relocation site for poor families.

Rebecca’s general store is yet a baby – she opened it only last year almost simultaneous with her joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. It is situated right in front of her house. Her store has grown steadily, accommodating the basic needs of her neighbors. Thanks to the loans provided to her by CCT, she can continuously stock up on grocery items and beverages. She also offers electronic load credits for mobile phones. She now earns a net of 17,000 PHP a month.

She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her general store. She would buy more grocery items and soft drinks to sell at her store. This would be her third loan cycle with the cooperative.  She hopes to make her general store grow into a bigger grocery store to help even more her neighbors.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To re-stock on grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita C. is from the village of Makawa Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Jovita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma D. is a 42-year-old woman from San Lazaro, Tala, Caloocan City.  She lives with her husband Gualberto, 43, a jeepney driver and their six children. Two of the children are now in college, one is in high school and another two are in grade school.

Welma sells firewood, charcoal and sawdust as household kitchen fuel.  She also sells bananas.  She earns a monthly net income of P2,500.00.  She saves her profits for the education of her children.  During rainy season, her items get soaked in rainwater, affecting her sales.

Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the later part of 2008, Welma has been enjoying its many benefits for its members, who are mostly housewives.  She is now on her fourth loan cycle with CCT.  She is expecting to receive a fresh loan from the cooperative of P8,000.00 that she will use as additional capital for her business. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talent family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Angie Grace

texts.es:
La señora Angie Grace, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 18 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.
Angie Grace, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita” y lleva 01 año en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angie Grace belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. Angie Grace lives with her partner; she is 18 years old and has one child who depends on her financially.

Angie Grace decided to sell prepared food in the “La Paradita” market and has 1 year in her job and her stall is very well set up to take care of her customers. She tells us that she has a good daily income because of the delicious flavor that her food has. Most of her customers live in the city, are passersby, or are steady clients that know her and she is very well accepted by her clients.

To this day she still has the same job and is very happy with her job that she does everyday. She sells in the mornings from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. She personally takes care of her customers with the charm that she is characterized by.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy products to prepare the daily food that she sells like: rice in kilograms, sugar, oil in gallons, potato sacks, live chickens, vegetables and some utensils to give her customers better care.

She has the motivation to get ahead as she has many dreams and goals in her life like having her own grocery store that would be well stoked. At the same time, she wishes to express her gratitude to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) who contributed to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare the food to be sold.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió superior incompleta y tiene su panaderìa.
Graciela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia e instalar ahí su horno.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Graciela, 33, has been a member of the "Gran Poder" communal bank in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, for 5 years now. She is married and has 2 children. She didn't finish higher education and she has a bakery. Graciela tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She now is requesting a 500 new sol loan to buy flour, sugar, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own home and to install her oven there. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the punctuality of her fellow members at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amador Group

texts.es:
Dina del Socorro Centeno, Janeth  del Carmen F. Romero y Petrona P. García estás tres féminas trabajadoras integran al grupo Amador. La coordinadora es la señora Ramírez quien inicio hace ocho años a comercializar ropa y prendas de oro y plata. Este negocio al pasar del tiempo fue creciendo con ayuda de los préstamos y su arduo trabajo.
 
Jannet del Carmen F. Romero de 27 años hace tres años empezó a vender ropa y Petrona P. García de 63 años comercializa cosméticos de gran variedad, en este negocio recibe la ayuda de su nieta quien distribuye y trae cosméticos de Costa Rica y viceversa.
texts.en:
Dina del Socorro, Janeth del Carmen y Petrona are the three women in the Amador group. Dina del Socorro started selling clothing and gold and silver articles eight years ago. Her business grew with time due to the help from the loans and her hard work.

Janeth del Carmen is 27 years old and started selling clothing three years ago. Petrona is 63 years old and sells a wide variety of cosmetics. She receives help from her granddaughter who sells and brings cosmetics in and out of Costa Rica.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Saul Cotiens

texts.en:
Saul Cotiens O. is married to Judith O. and they have three children who are all in college. Saul is a carpenter who makes timber furniture in Bungoma town. He has been in the carpentry business for the last five years and, out of the profits he has made, he has been able to cater for all his family's needs and even pay his children's school fees.
Saul hopes to get funding through Kiva partner KADET to enable him to expand his business by buying more timber and velvet material for covering sofa sets and employing one more member of staff to enable him meet the deadlines for his customers' orders. He will also use some of the money for family upkeep.
Saul's future dream is to expand his business into wholesale and change his operations from manual to electric. He also wants to venture into the transport business and improve his children's level of education by taking them to higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: To buy more timber and velvet materials, and employ one more member of staff

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA GRACIELA  SE DEDICA A COMERCIALIZAR ROPA DE TEMPORADA Y TAMBIEN TIENE UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE VERDURAS, EN UNA DE LAS CALLES MAS TRANSITADAS DE LA CIUDADA DE LA PAZ Y ELLA LLEVA SU MERCADERIA SEGÚN LOS PEDIDOS QUE LE HACEN A CAMIRI(PROVINCIA DE SANTA CRUZ). DOÑA GRACIELA TIENE SEIS HIJOS TRES DE ELLOS ESTUDIAN EN CASAS SUPERIORES Y TRES SON TODAVIA MENORES ESTUDIAN EN ESCUELAS, ELLA  ATIENDE EN LA MANUNTENCION DE LOS NIÑOS COMO TAMBIEN A SUS OTROS HIJOS. INGRESA AL PROGRAMA KIVA POR LA SELECCION QUE SE REALIZA PARA ESTE RUBRO Y TAMBIEN POR LA NECESIDAD QUE TIENE LA SEÑORA GRACIELA.

LA SRA. GRACIELA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SATISFACER A SUS CLIENTES LLEVANDO VARIEDAD DE ROPA, YA QUE EN ESTA EPOCA EMPIEZAN LAS CLASES ESCOLARES Y LE REALIZARON MUCHOS PEDIDOS.

LA SRA. GRACIELA ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Graciela sells seasonal clothing and she also has a vegetable stand in one of La Paz's busiest streets. She sells her clothes, according to orders placed with her, in Camiri (Santa Cruz province). Graciela has six children, three of whom study higher education and three are still minors attending school. She takes care of supporting her minor children as well as the older ones. She enters Kiva's program via the selection process for this line of work and because of her need. Graciela is very hard-working and she will use the funds to buy merchandise to meet the needs of ther customers with regard to variety of clothing because this is the back-to-school season and she has many orders to fill. Graciela is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Khady

texts.en: Khady S. is a 55-year-old married mother of seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for two and a half years. She is an experienced retailer and will use her loan to buy more products which she can sell in her corner store. The revenues from this activity allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Khafifa Mukhtar Group

texts.en:
Hamida, daughter of M. H., is the group leader of Khafifa Mukhtar Group. She is 19 years old and single. Her father is dead and she lives with her whole family of nine members.

Hamida runs a tailoring business and she has been working in this business for more then two years. Now she wants to take a loan to expand her business and support the whole family economically.

When she was informed about the AFS lending program, Hamida came to AFS and requested a loan. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis O. is an industrious man who is married to Millicent, who runs a grocery store. They have three children: Veronicah, who has just finished college; Daisy, who is in grade 3 of primary school; and Elvis, who is in nursery school. 

Francis runs a business of selling shoes in Lake Market, an open air populous market in Kisumu City, a very strategic point for this type of business.  Francis has been in this business for 11 years and he learned about KADET from the staff of World Vision. He stocks men’s shoes only, and thus most of his clients are men. The loan he has applied for will be used to add more stock of men’s shoes for sale.

Francis, who believes in honesty, has a dream of opening a shop for his wife. His dream is to give his children the best education and also to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Khalifa

texts.en:
K. Khalifa, 52, is married and has four children. He lives in Djabbar Rasulov district and works with his family in the agricultural industry. Many years ago he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family. 

At the same time Khalifa raises cattle near his house. He will use the loan money to buy young cattle to raise. Khalifa has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans in order to improve his business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to raise

loans.name: 21 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth A. de 28 años, es casada y vive en la zona 21 de Octubre hace dos años, ella  tiene dos negocios uno de ellos es vender comida y otro es trensado de mantas y en esta oportunidad tiene planificado invertir en el negocio de comida el préstamo, ya que tienen mayor retorno.
Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal 21 de Octubre que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tienen negocios como el tejido de aguayos (tela colorida), venta de cosméticos, venta de alimento seco y elaboración de masitas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 28 years old, married, and living in the 21 de Octubre area for the past two years. She has two businesses, one of which is selling food and the other is the plaiting of ponchos. Currently, she plans to invest loan proceeds in her food business, given that the returns are greater. The remaining participants, members of both the 21 de Octubre Communal Association and the Centro Focal Panamericana, have businesses such as the weaving of multicolored cloth (colored fabric), cosmetics sales, dry groceries sales, and pastry making.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Baeda

texts.en: This borrower is 36 years old and married to a man who works for SOS Jeunes, an organization that helps troubled youths. Together, they have two children. She sells certain fuels and cereals from her home, and has been in business since 2005. She has requested her first microloan from Kiva partner, WAGES, for 400,000 XOF to purchase firewood, charcoal, maize, millet and beans.

loans.use: To purchase wood, charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi T. is married and has five dependants. She has been through tertiary school. She is a hairdresser at Takoradi. Her husband is a chef in a restaurant. She helps her husband take care of the family. Esi will use the loan to acquire other items like perfume, cream and hair products for her shop. With the new profits from her extended business, Esi plans to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase perfume, cream and hair products for her shop.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch E. is 49 years old and lives in Tonloab Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ny Norn, are farmers who own 4-hectares (~ 10 acres) of land on which they grow rice for a living. 

Mrs. Touch E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and to pay to rent a plowing machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Ny Norn works as a farm laborer so he can earn a small income to support his family. This couple has a child who is a student. 

Mrs. E.'s husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou F. is from the village of  Blanco , Balingsag Misamis  Oriental. She is 37 years old. Marilou is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María de 54 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene un puesto de venta de repuestos de bicicletas desde que se separo de su esposo. 

Hace 5 años atrás cuando se quedo sola, comenzó a comprar herramientas para vender de bicicletas poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio local, ahora ella tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende herramientas y también infla las llantas de las bicicletas. Trabaja de lunes a domingo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y tener mas personas a su cargo.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, and lives in Primavera de Duran (on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area that is deteriorating). Since separating from her husband, she has had a stand where she sells bicycle parts. For the last 5 years, when she has been alone, she has begun to buy bicycle tools to sell, and with struggle on her part, she was able to have her own location. She now has a small stand where she sells tools and also inflates bicycle tires. She works from Monday to Sunday. With the loan, she would like to buy tools for her business. In the future, she wants to complete construction of her house, and have more employees under her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools, tubes

loans.name: Ishdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Ishdorj is 29 years old, and lives with his wife, 5 year old daughter, and 4 month old son, in his mother's house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city.

He owns a small car, and has been running a taxi business for five years. His wife looks after the kids. Since 2001, Ishdorj’s parents have been raising cows. Currently, they have 14 cows, and 6 of them are female. Every day they milk them and sell the milk in the local market. Ishdorj’s main goal is to continue and extend his parents' business.

He is a very hard working person. His taxi and farming businesses keep him busy all day long. The reason he is asking for this loan is he wants to buy some special breed cows which give more milk, and to improve the barn, and both of these uses will increase his business profit. He will also buy some feed for the cows.

loans.use: To buy some special breed cows and fix the barn.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Adriana G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en la escuela Simeón Pereira donde tiene 22 años de laborar para dicho centro. Se le han otorgado dos créditos en ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo va invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena con el objetivo de construir un pequeño baño.
texts.en:
Adriana G. is originally from the town of El Sauce. She has worked as a primary school teacher in the Simeón Pereira school for 22 years. She has received two loans from Ceprodel to improve her home. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, and sand in order to build a small bath.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brick, cement and sand

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie L. is a married  who lives in Mantija 2, Mantija, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating an abaca weaving  business. Her husband Avilo L., who is 38 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have a 14 year old child who currently goes to school. Lorelie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009, because she aspired for something better for her family.

With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorelie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family, as well as having enough set aside to invest in other business ventures so that she can continue to improve her family's living condition. Lorelie L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela O. is from the village of Langcangan, Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Daniela is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Daniela owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling and dealing daily use products such as shampoo, soap and baby powder in the local community. Daniela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daniela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daniela is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daniela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean V. is 23 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia (Mrs. V.'s husband appears in the photo). Mrs. Hean V. is married to Nara, a 30-year-old machinery repairman. This couple has four children, and two of whom are students in school, and the other two are still not enrolled in school yet. Mrs. Hean V. is a chicken seller in the busy market. She also buys chicken in bulk at a low price from rural people and then sells them at retail in the market for a profit, earning about $5 a day. Recently, Mrs. Hean V. received orders from her customers for a large amount of chickens, but she lacks the money to purchase enough chickens to fill her customers' orders. So that Mrs. Hean V. is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for selling.

loans.name: Juan Boanerges

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Boanerges Gutiérrez García es trabajador Activo de la empresa D.G.I desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad tiene tres  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Boanerges Gutiérrez García is an employee of the firm D.G.I.  He has been working there as a security guard for 3 years.  He has taken 2 loans with CEPRODEL, and with each one he has been able to buy construction materials to expand and improve his house.  He has benefited greatly from these loans, because they have allowed him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: personal expenses

loans.name: Ibyiringiro Group

texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old and single. She sells a variety of consumable goods such as bread, juice, milk and yogurt in her shop. She has been running this business for the past two years. Silvia is the leader of a group called Ibyiringiro CB which, translated from the Kinyarwanda language, means The Hope in English. The members of this group have different kinds of businesses but are all committed to making change in their lives. Through requesting this loan, they will be able to upgrade and improve their businesses.

Silvia believes her business has improved many aspects of her life. She is in the photo at the back on the left, holding a passbook of Urwego. She is planning to purchase more merchandise and restock her inventory in the future.

loans.use: to buy more juice, bread and yogurt to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam T. is a 32-year-old man who lives in Sabirabad. He is married and has one son and two daughters. He operates his own food store that he opened in 2007. His wife helps him in his business. Teyfi will use this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more inventory for his store. This is Teyfi’s first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. Once he repays this loan he plans to apply for another loan to open another store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the store

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira M. Z. es una excelente  vendedora y ya tiene más  de 9 años de dedicarse a las ventas por catalogo con la empresa Avon
Su vocación de servicio y su liderazgo a llevado a Yadira a ser una de las  vendedoras favoritas de la  Empresa.   
Pero ella  quiere crecer aun mas y  es por eso que Doña Yadira necesita  ₡600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para la compra de mas inventario que le permita mejorar los ingresos 
Ellas es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Yadira M. Z. is an excellent saleswoman, and she has had over nine years of experience working in catalog sales with the Avon company. 

Yadira's commitment to service and her leadership qualities have allowed her to become one of the favorite sales representatives of the company. However, she wants to grow even more which is why she is seeking a loan of $1200 (600,000 CRC). She plans to use the funds to purchase additional inventory which will allow her to improve her income.

Yadira is a member of the Santa Fe Communal Credit Company, which is one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
NidA. is a 31-year-old single man from Baalbeck. He has been the owner of a hardware, painting and electricA. tools store since 2005, with 16 years of experience in this field. NidA. is improving his work day after day. This business is important in his region, since construction takes a good part in his society. 

NidA. is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business, since most of his capitA. he used for his brother’s sickness and for his mother’s funerA.. NidA. wants to expand his business more in the coming years.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
A. Inomjon is 33 years old and the father of two children who both attend the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. In order to earn a living, Inomjon owns a two-hectare field for cultivating wheat, tomatoes and corn. He also has a garden where he grows apricots. On his land, Inomjon is now unable to do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy necessary supplies. Inomjon sees this as an opportunity to obtain a better yield, which will improve his family's living conditions.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
El Señor Macario V. C., es una persona de 45 años de edad de estado civil concubino, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, tiene 4 dependientes económicos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce papa, cebada, haba y arveja, asimismo como actividad secundaria brinda los servicios de albañil en la comunidad de Rodeo Alto – Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
 En la actividad de la agricultura intervienen toda la familia la esposa y los hijos para poder incrementar su producción ya que en la actualidad disponen de mayor superficie cultivable ya que los hermanos de don Macario le cedieron su terrenos en préstamo porque ellos viven en el interior del país, por tanto necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de semilla y otros insumos principales para la producción y de esta forma incrementar su producción de los distintos productos que cultivan de tal forma poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera sus condiciones de vida. 
Para tal efecto don Macario y su familia se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para poder comprar materia prima para la producción como ser semillas agrícolas y abono de gallinaza.
texts.en: Macario V. C. is 45 years old and married.   He completed his primary schooling and lives in his own house with his 4 children whom he supports.   Macario works in agriculture, growing potatoes and other crops, and he also works as a bricklayer in the city of Rodeo Alto, which is located about 70 kilometers from Cochabamba.   Macario's entire family helps in the agriculture business, including his wife and children, as well as his brothers who loan him land to grow his crops.   Macario needs to buy more seeds, as well as materials needed to increase production and increase his income, which improves the quality of life for his family.   He is requesting a loan so that he can purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To invest in his agriculture business

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Dennys es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada y  tiene 01 hijo.  La señora estudió educación secundaria. 
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artefactos, títeres y ganados.
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar 50 kilos de lanas para su tejido de títeres, para venderlos en Acora.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Dennys is a member of the "Las Collabinas" communal bank located in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 27 years old and married, with one child.  She has a secondary school education.

For the last year she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles.  She invested the money in her business selling appliances, puppets, and livestock.

Now she is asking for a new loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles.  She will use the money to buy 50 kilos of wool for fabric for her puppets, in order to sell them in Acora.  Her husband helps her with the business.

Her dream is to grow her business more and increase her earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank are its meetings and its punctuality.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of wool for fabric for puppets

loans.name: 'christ United' Group

texts.en:
Meme W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of three borrowers called 'Christ United'. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 14 to 4 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For five years, she has been selling charcoal in the “Point Four” Community, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

She describes herself as a ‘high tempered’ woman whose dreams are to improve her business, build a shop, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jesus Joaquina

texts.es:
C. tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, los cuales una vez alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los vende y/o sacrifica para venderlo por kilos. En el caso de las vacas, entrega leche a la Municipalidad de Tambogrande para el programa de Vaso de Leche, programa benéfico para ayuda social.

C. desea adquirir alimento balanceado para la crianza de su ganado, por lo que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
C. is 44 years old, married common-law and she has 3 children. She lives in her own house with her family and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. It is situated 4 hours from Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She raises cattle, sheep, and pigs. When they have reached an ideal size and weight she sells them or she butchers them to sell by the kilo. In the case of the dairy cows, she sells the milk in the municipality of Tambogrande to the program called "Glass of Milk", a program aimed at social welfare.

C. wishes to acquire balanced feed to raise her cattle. For this reason she has requested a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Allen has a business of outside catering, which she has had for three years.

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, baking flour and charcoal for making chapattis for sale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Allen hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Allen hopes to expand her business. 

Allen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour and charcoal for making chapattis for sale.

loans.name: Nantenin

texts.fr:
Madame NANTENIN K. est une femme âgée de 46 ans qui vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à SANANKOROBA, une commune rurale de la préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
NANTENIN n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école  pour des raisons familiales, alors très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers  tels les habits, les pochettes, les chaussures, les parures etc. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, NANTENIN est à son deuxième prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 50 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes, auprès des grossistes du grand marché de BAMAKO. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison, au  marché de KANGABA et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de SANANKOROBA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame NANTENIN K. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
NANTENIN ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste en habillements et chaussures à SANANKOROBA
texts.en:
Mrs. Nantenin K. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Sanankoroba with her six children and her husband in a nuclear family. Sanankoroba is a rural village in the prefecture of Kati, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

Nantenin’s family situation did not give her the opportunity to attend school. Very early on she got involved in income generating activities such as the purchase and sale of various items, for example; clothing, small purses, shoes, fine accessories etc.

After having fully repaid her first loan, Nantenin is on her second individual loan. She is planning to use it to buy a few dozens sets of children clothing and 50 pairs of different kind of shoes from wholesalers at the Grand Market of Bamako. She sells from her home, at the Kangaba market and door-to-door in the various neighborhoods of Sanankoroba. She retails for cash and on credit to customers who are women and men.

Mrs. Nantenin K. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25, 000 Francs CFA that she will use to reimburse her loan, help her husband provide for the family’s expenses and reinvest the rest in her activity.
Nantenin’s ambition is to diversify her activity further and become a wholesaler of clothing and shoes in Sanankoroba.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to repair the rickshaw of her husband who is a driver by trade and provides transport services to his passengers. Using the loan, he will repair the engine which will help him provide better quality transport facilities to his passengers and earn better income. 

Robina has three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is hopeful that this investment will prove a good one for her family and earn her husband better profits in future. She lives with her family in Mian Channu which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 2 rooms and she has been living there for the past 15 years.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 7 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). En la actualidad ha empezado  a vender también ropa por catalogo y esto lo hace al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas de Avon. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todos los días domingo.  Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, lleva más de seis años que se dedica a las ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The communal bank “El Pedregal” meets every 15 days in the El Pedregal location in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional celebrations for San Pedro (Saint Peter) and San Pablo (Saint Paul), and for the happiness of its people.  

Here we got to know Maria.  She is 38-years-old, married, and has three children from this relationship who are 19, 16, and 7-years-old.  They study in the university, high school, and elementary school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

She is a housewife and to have her own resources she works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  Now she has begun to sell clothing as well by catalog and she does this at the same time that she makes her Avon sales.  She works four days a week; she sells her products on credit and collects payments every Sunday.  What she sells most are perfumes.  She orders products to her house.  She has worked in these sales for more than six years.

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and all kinds of clothing.  She is the member who founded the communal bank and she likes it for the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a front gate

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Père  d’un enfant, Kofi vit avec sa femme qui est revendeuse. Agé de 38 ans, il est chauffeur depuis 2007 et parallèlement fait de la peinture et tôlerie. Ce prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quelques accessoires de travail pour satisfaire  dans les meilleures conditions  sa clientèle il tient à son rôle de chef de famille et ne lésine pas sur les moyens pour satisfaire les besoins de sa maisonnée. Toute son activité d’achat et d’approvisionnement se déroule à Lomé.
texts.en: A father of one child, Kofi lives with his wife, who is a retailer. He is 38 years old and has been a driver since 2007. Concurrently, he does painting and sheet metal work. This loan he is requesting will enable him to buy a few work accessories in order to satisfy his customers with the best. He cares about his role as the head of household and spares no expense when it comes to meeting the needs at home. The purchasing and supplying for this business all occur in Lomé, the capital of Togo.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and paint

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en:
Divinah is 28 years old.  She is married to Joseph and supports a family of six. She has been running a farming business for the last 11 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,000.

With this loan for KES 30,000, her second loan from KADET, she plans to purchase wheat seeds and top dress fertilizers for her farm. This loan will enable her to buy farm inputs and hence increase her income.

In the future, she intends to continue in wheat farming and educate her children

loans.use: purchase wheat seeds and fertizers

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Luvuno has operated a clothes-selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She also operates a hairdressing business. Luvuno decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and with a loan of Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and expand horticultural farming

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, who is 36 years old, is married to a farmer named Roderick. Together, they raise their two children in their peaceful village in Cagayan Province. Sylvia wants a life that is comfortable and prosperous so with Roderick, they manage well their livelihood in farming hand in hand. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for land cultivation and to purchase the seeds, fertilizers and insecticides she needs for farming. This loan, she believes will be a great help towards a better yield.

Sylvia aspires that someday, she will able to continuously send her children to school until college. They'd be very grateful if that happens, said Sylvia.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Santa Griselda

texts.es:
Santa D. 31 años, tiene muchas aspiraciones para ser una microempresaria por eso que tiene una pequeña tienda para mejorar sus ingresos. Poco a poco ha venido incrementando L. mercadería con ayuda D. su esposo que es maestro constructor. 
Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital D. trabajo. En L. actualidad trabaja en su propia tienda vendiendo víveres D. primera necesidad como granos, bebidas, enlatados etc.  Para mejorar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc.
texts.en:
