Santa is 31 years old and has many aspirations of becoming a micro-entrepreneur. For this reason, she opened a small store in her home so that she could improve her income. Little by little, she was able to increase her inventory of merchandise with the help of her husband who is a master builder.

Santa was also able to increase her operating capital gradually. At the moment, she works in her store and sells basic necessities such as grain, beverages, canned goods, and other items. To improve her store, she wants to use this loan to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 35-year-old single lady. She has no children yet. She operates a tailoring service business at the busy Bombolulu area in Mombasa. She has been in this business for five years.

She says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy materials for making clothes to sell to her customers. She plans to get an employee and in future she plans to open another tailoring service business. She describes herself as outgoing and cheerful.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 38 years old, buys rubber for resale and earns an income of 10 USD per day. Her husband is a farmer, plants yams to sell and his income is 7 USD per day. This couple has three children; one is studying and the other two are working in the factory each earning 3.5 USD per day. Every month, she has to spend 101 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 25 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 1,000 USD to buy rubber to resell. This loan will help her family to be able to continue their careers and buy more rubber to sell when her income improves. She wants to send her children to study at the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy rubber to resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe, 55-years old, and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a caddie boy, and mother to four children. Two are already working while the other two are still studying in high school. Fe, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Fe has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices, and then sells them at a piece rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players, who are her immediate customers. Aside from this, she also earns additional income from her small variety store. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Fe hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good future, and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of golf ball products needed in her business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a married man with two school-going children. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

He has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase vegetables for his business. He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance through loan-taking.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Gulabatin

texts.en: Gulabatin is married and a mother of two children. She is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman. At first, Gulabatin and her husband only had three calves in their herd, but now their business has expanded and they have six calves. Raising and selling livestock is the main income for the family budget. This is his first loan through AqroInvest. Gulabatin requested a loan in the sum of 1,000 AZN to purchase feed for her calves and cows for the fall and winter months. She wants to buy more calves and develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for calves

loans.name: Patrick Danda

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He describes himself to be energetic, committed and determined. He operates a transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harassment by the local administration. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy new bicycles. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy additional bicycles.

loans.name: Nerguibaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Nerguibaatar, 25, is an electrician in a private company. He lives with his family in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Nerguibaatar started working as an electrician 8 years ago, after graduating from high school. He has gained a lot of experience and is a skillful worker.

Nerguibaatar wants to renovate his old house which has never been repaired or renovated since being built. It has now become very old and cold to live in during the winter. Nerguibaatar has a plan to make internal adjustments and decorations in the house before next spring. Nerguibaatar is taking a loan to purchase some necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Ma. Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, an employee, and a mother of five children. She, together with her husband and children, manage the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Agnes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of time and money to spend cooking gas and food for only one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Agnes' regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day. To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Agnes dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Sawa Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sawa SHG Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Sawa SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sawa SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina has been patiently managing her retail store for eight years. She is happily married to an OFW(Overseas Filipino Worker) and they have been blessed with two healthy children. Gina said that the generated-income from her store was utilized in their daily needs: payment for electric bills and allowances for their children. Due to increased household expenses, Gina is aiming to increase her sales and profit to be able to sustain all their daily needs. 

Gina said that having a business is quite difficult due to credit and a lean season she has experienced in her daily routine. Though she suffered from these circumstances, still, she stands firm and believes that she could overcome all these trials in life.

Gina works hard to help her husband in providing income for family. To realize her dream in life, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP30,000 which will be use to purchase stock merchandise for her retail store business. She hopes that, through her complete set of merchandise, she could improve and increase her profit. In this way, she can give her two children a good quality education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock merchandise for retail business.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua sells smoked fish at Brase near Elmina. She has done this for some years and would like to increase the quantity of fish smoked. This loan will help her expand her business by buying more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Steven M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of SLL 9,300,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Forty-two-year-old Steven is the leader of this group of teachers. Steven was born in Segbwema, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. Steven is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for thirty-eight years now.  He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – bags of cements, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc., for the construction for a house. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – bags of cements, iron corrugated zinc, nails, etc., for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and wood for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old retail shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four. She has been a shopkeeper for the past four years. Her business is doing great.

This marks her third borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom, 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a cleaner in a provincial hospital for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation business (motor taxi). He earns about USD 3 per day. Due the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Nom is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This purchase would enable her to get to work on time. In the future, she wants her husband to run a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle based taxi) instead of a motor taxi because it earns more money, and she hopes to help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 40 years old, native of Boane, province of Maputo, lives with her second husband, and has six (6) children, five (5) from a previous marriage and one (1) from the current marriage. She didn't have the opportunity to study because it was not important to her parents at that point.

She got married very early and, by necessity, with the help of her ex-husband, she started her business in 1986 in a precarious construction shack at the edge of the road that ran by her home. She gained experience as the years went by, and today, she has been able to build a stall out of conventional materials.

Through some women friends, she found out about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and approached them and requested a loan to expand her business.

Her activity has seen growth, in terms of volume of business and customers, since she diversified the products that existed before she obtained the loan. She confirmed that with the profits, she supports her family's living expenses and the expenses for her developmentally disabled child who frequently needs medical assistance.

Her work has a greater impact on the community because, in addition to self-employment, it also provides a job for her daughter, as well as bring diverse food products near to her clientele, reducing the time and cost of travel that women in her community had before she brought this service to the community.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 3, Boane, Maputo - Mozambique Cliente: Maria de Fátima João V. Sector de actividade: Comércio Montante: 25.000,00MTN (965.00US$) Aplicação: Compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade Início: 20/11/2006 Período de pagamento: 12 Meses Maria, de 40 anos de idade, natural de Boane, província de Maputo, vive com o seu segundo esposo, tem seis (6) filhos, cinco (5) do casamento anterior e um (1) no actual, não teve oportunidade de estudar porque não constituía importância para os seus pais na altura. Casou muito cedo e por necessidade e com ajuda do ex-marido iniciou o seu negócio em 1986 numa barraca de construção precária a beira da rua que passa em frente a sua casa, foi ganhando experiência com o passar dos anos, hoje em dia conseguiu construir uma barraca de material convencional.

Através de amigas teve a informação sobre a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimos para ampliar o seu negócio. A sua actividade conhece um crescimento em termos de volume de negócio e clientes pois diversificou os produtos existiam na altura antes do empréstimo. Confirmou que com os lucros suporta as despesas domesticas da sua família e do seu filho doente mental que frequentemente precisa de uma assistência médica.

A sua actividade tem maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de auto-emprego providencia também emprego para a sua filha assim como colocação de diversos produtos alimentares perto da clientela, reduzindo assim o tempo e custos de viagem que as mulheres da sua comunidade levavam antes de terem o serviço por ela prestado naquela comunidade.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Racheal Wairimu would like to buy a blow dryer and hair dryer.

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en:
Rasmiya was born in 1964 in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region. She is married and has one child. Six years ago, she started a business raising hens.
She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy 70 Indian guinea hens.

loans.use: To buy 70 Indian guinea hens

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is 48 years old and has 5 children. Her husband works on the land cultivating corn. She wants to invest her loan to buy clothing from people who bring this from Puebla, which she subsequently sells to people in her neighborhood. She belongs to the group “Flor de Tila 1”, together with Higinia Gordillo L. (who sells footwear), Mrs. Mercedes Abadia Gutierrez (who sells shoes and handmade sandals). These two plan to invest their part of the loan to buy a large amount of shoes that they sell in the city, close to the marketplace.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

ROSAURA TIENE 48 AÑOS , 5 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN EL CULTIVO DEL MAIZ, ELLA VA A INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN COMPRAR ROPA A PERSONAS QUE LA TRAEN DE PUEBLA Y POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLA CON GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO FLOR DE TILA 1 JUNTO CON HIGINIA GORDILLO L. ( VENDE CALZADO ) Y DOÑA MERCEDES ABADIA GUTIERREZ (VENTA DE CALZADO Y SANDALIAS ARTESANALES ).ELLAS DOS ESPERAN CON LA PARTE DE SU PRESTAMO INVERTIR COMPRANDO MAYOR CANTIDAD DE CALZADOS PARA TAMBIEN SALIR A VENDER A LA CIUDAD EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO .

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung C., 37 and mother of four children, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support her household, she sells various kinds of desserts to the people in her area and typically makes about $3/day of income. Her husband is both a construction worker and a motor-taxi driver, while two of her children work at construction and together earn up to $12 per day.

Mrs. Ung C. hopes this loan will help her purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to operate a business. She also plans to buy pigs to raise on her piece of land to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business and also buy pigs to raise on her piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals and legumes including: beans, rice, peas, green lentils, etc.

loans.name: Abelinda

texts.es:
Abelinda, es muy creativa y día a día se esmera en la fabricación de sus sahumerios.Todos los fines de semana se dispone a buscar los implementos y prepara con el palo santo molido y el papel reciclado, también molido, una masa, cuando está compacta los convierte en palitos, para finalmente forrarlos en papel de seda de diversos colores.Gracias a su desempeño puede sostener a su pequeño hijo, es madre soltera y anhela se convierta en un futuro en un hombre de bien muy útil a su sociedad. La rutina de trabajo de Abelinda es muy activa, después que ella elabora esos palitos para el sahumerio se va de viaje cada 15 días a la ciudad capital de su país, donde también comercializa, ollas de la abundancia, sólo por temporadas. Los artículos que desplaza, los ofrece con plazos de pago y en grandes cantidades. Hace dieciocho años por consejos de su querido hermano se inició en la comercialización de estos artículos y son los meses de Diciembre y octubre en el que tiene mayores demandas, ahora tiene que aprovechar al máximo estas solicitudes y desea seguir haciéndolo motivada por las ganancias que percibe con el fin de establecerse en un lugar céntrico para vender sus productos.Solicita un préstamo para comprar los insumos y más mercadería para esta época navideña. Abelinda recurre a vuestra ayuda para concretar cada uno de sus planes.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Abelinda, is very creative and day to day takes pains in the manufacturing of the incense she sells. Every weekend she goes off to look for the supplies and prepares the worn out wood and branches along with recycled paper. From this she makes a type of dough that eventually is turned into the small incense sticks which she then covers in silk paper of various colors. Thanks to her hard work she can support her small son, as she is a single mother and yearns for him to become a very useful and successful man in society. Abelinda’s work routine is very active. After she makes the incense, she goes away on a trip every 15 days to the capital city of her country, where also she sells, pots during certain seasons. The items she offers for sale, she does so using a lay-away and/or credit based process. Eighteen years ago, by advice of her beloved brother, she began selling these articles and December and October are the months which she has the most demand. Now she must take advantage of her high demand and wishes to continue doing so motivated by the gain that it brings in with the purpose of settling down in a central place to sell her products. She is requesting a loan to buy her inventory and more merchandise for this upcoming Christmas season. Abelinda is requesting our help to fulfill each one of her plans.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para la fabricación de sahumerios.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun C., 22, is married and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her little four children. Her husband is the one who supplement her household. He works as a construction worker earning typically about $4each day. Her mother living with her is employed as a servant in a house and makes around $35 each month. Mrs. Sun C. is humble to ask for a loan to repair her house building a solid roof and wall around to protect from the leaking dring a rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her house installing a solid roof and wall to protect from the leaking during a rainy season.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
For most of her life, Mrs. Mercedes S. devoted herself entirely to her family, living off of her husband’s income. Nevertheless, on realizing the difficulty of their family’s economic situation, she decided to take out a loan to open a beauty salon in their home, since she has skills in this area.

She began her beauty activities in her home, with her own savings and in part with those gotten through CEPRODEL. With the cash, she bought a mirror and some scissors to bring service to her customers in León, which is where she’s from.

Mrs. S. has benefited from her six credits through CEPRODEL. She says that thanks to them, her business has increased rapidly, achieving better conditions and providing her customers with better service, in addition to helping her husband with their household needs and raising their son.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Mercedes S., la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado solo a su familia viviendo de los ingresos del esposo sin embargo, al darse cuenta que la situación económica aun sigue difícil en el núcleo familiar decide realizar un préstamo para poner un salón de belleza en su hogar ya que ella presenta habilidades en este ramo.

Inicia la actividad de belleza en su casa, con ahorros propios y parte con los obtenidos en Ceprodel. Al tener el capital, compra un espejo y algunas tijeras para brindar servicio a la clientela de la ciudad de León de donde es originaria.

La señora S. ha sido beneficiada con seis créditos por lo que declara que gracias a estos préstamos en Ceprodel el negocio ha incrementado rápidamente logrando tener mejores condiciones para brindar buen servicio a su clientela, además de ayudar al esposo con la responsabilidad del hogar y la formación de su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She joined the community bank because the whole process to obtain loans and funding is easier and takes less time. Through the community bank, she has learned marketing, health improvement, and development of healthy family relationships.

Florinda works as an accountant in the mornings, and in the afternoons she runs a store out of her home. She sells mainly food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar.

Florinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more merchandise for her store.

Her dream is to own her home and her business, which are now rented.

loans.use: Florinda needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is a 45-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Amin owns a place where you can find pool, computers/internet, etc. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Amin wants to buy computers to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy computers for his business

loans.name: Almeyda

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Almeyda Mwambona. She is married and has 4 children aged between 11 and 20. In 2000, Almeyda established her grain-selling business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk . She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional groceries

loans.name: Courage

texts.en: Courage A. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and drinks.  Courage learnt this business for 2 years and she started her own business in 1992. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
53-year-old John A. has been a borrower with GHAPE in Cameroon for three years. He has invested his loans in various farming projects, including, most recently, raising pigs.

John has recently applied for a slightly increased loan to expand his farm output. He proposes to repay the money over 24 months and is confident that his experience in rearing pigs will make this venture a success.

John is married with seven children, five of whom are still living with him, including one who has been ill for many years. He says the increased profit from his business will help him take good care of them.

loans.use: Purchase pigs.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa donde ofrece diferentes productos a los clientes de la comunidad y personas que pasan a las comunidades cercanas. Con el crédito obtenido en ADIM  logró engrandecer un poco su negocio. Trabaja todos los días y hace además las labores de su casa. Piensa seguir obteniendo financiamiento para ofrecer más productos a su clientela, como ropa y adornos. Siente que con su negocio ella es más respetada dentro de su comunidad y en su familia, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos, tienen una niña que le ayuda a despachar en la pulpería que también estudia, ella quiere que su hija tenga una profesión en el futuro.
texts.en:
She has a small general store in her house where she sells various products to clients in the community and to those passing through to nearby towns. With the loan obtained in ADIM she was able to enlarge her business a little. She works every day and on top of that, works taking care of her home. She thinks she will continue obtaining financing in order to offer more products to her clients such as clothing and ornaments. She feels that with her business she is more respected within the community and in her family; her husband earns a living buying and selling bananas. They have a daughter who helps her with running the grocery store and who also studies, and she would like her daughter to have a profession in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes inicio con es negocio ya que necesitaba una actividad que le generara ingresos y que a la vez que pudiera atender sin descuidar su casa, comenzó hace 5 años vendiendo poco de mercería y actualmente ya la tiene bien surtido el negocio y también tiene venta de regalos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir la mercancía que le hace falta y darle buena atención a los clientes.
texts.en:
Mercedes started her business because she needed an activity that would earn income and also allow her to tend to her children. She opened a general store five years ago, and now she has a well-supplied store that also sells gifts. Mercedes needs a loan of $775 to supply her store with new varieties of merchandise so that she can offer good service to her clients. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 36 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD.. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro habas D. Bolivia, ella empezó con este negocio hace 15 años, viaja muy seguido a la Frontera  a comprar mercadería. Actualmente y junto a su esposo continúan con ambos negocios.

Con  el préstamo que solicitara D. S/: 1700.00 nuevos soles que pagara en  4 cuotas comprara 5 sacos D. habas.

Su deseo es seguir viajando y tener más capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Banco Comunal "Santa Cruz D. Cacorco" in the district of Copani in the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 36 years old, has 5 children and is married. Her husband buys and sells feedlot cattle. With her first loan, she received S/. 500.00 to increase her capital and buy Bolivian beans. She began with this business 15 years ago. She frequently travels to the border to buy merchandise. Presently, she and her husband work together in both businesses. She is requesting a loan of S/. 1700.00 loan, which she plans on repaying in 4 installments. With this loan, she will buy 5 sacks of beans. Her dream is to continue traveling and increase profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans wholesale

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Née en 1974 à Kpalimé, Mademoiselle D. Akua est une revendeuse adulée résident à Aného. Célibataire avec deux (02) enfants, elle fait le stockage et la vente de charbons de bois, des céréales et de la farine du manioc. Avec les difficultés socio économique qui prévaut dans le milieu, les revenus de son commerce ne couvrent plus les charges qui ne cessent d’augmenter malgré de multiples efforts consentis.
Dans le souci de réduire sa misère et celle de ses enfants, elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter son fond de commerce afin de stocker du charbon et les céréales en grande quantité. Ces stocks qu’elle revendra chers en période de pénurie afin de réaliser un profit maximum.
texts.en:
Miss Akua D. was born in Kpalimé in 1974 and is a respected retailer in Aného. Single with two children, she stores and sells charcoal, cereals and manioc flour. Due to prevailing social and economic problems, her profits no longer cover costs which continue to increase despite concerted efforts to prevent this. In an attempt to reduce the risk of poverty to herself and her children, she seeks a loan to increase her business capital in order to stock large quantities of charcoal and cereals. She will resell these stocks at a high price in periods of shortage to gain maximum profit.

Translated from French by Holly Miller, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking and selling of charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Claudia Esthela

texts.es: La Sra.: Claudia vende ropa y productos de cosméticos, gaseosa desde hace cinco años,  que comenzó  con fondos propios, haciendo ahorro cada día, para tener algo con que subsistir con su familia, como toda familia le ha tocado vivir sola ya que es madre soltera con dos hijos menores que están estudiando la primaria. Tiene 37años de edad, y habita en Hialeah en la ciudad de Managua, los productos que vende son por encargo y tiene en venta en general al contado y al crédito, para poder mantener su negocio hizo préstamo en Afodenic lo cual me ha beneficiado de mucho por que gracias a los crédito que me han brindado he podido mantener el negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual voy a invertir en la compra de ropa para niños y adultos, productos variados de cosméticos, y gaseosas para seguir ofertando a sus clientes. a futuro es poder captar mas clientes  y tener un mejor inventario, a si como ayudar a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Claudia has sold clothing, cosmetics and soft drinks for the past five years. She started the business with her own money, saving each day so that she could have something with which to support her family. Like others, she is on her own as she is a single mother with two young children who are studying in primary school. She is 37 years old and lives in the Hialeah area of Managua city. She sells product by order and also has products in stock which she sells either for cash or on credit. To keep her business going she took out a loan with Afodenic which helped her a lot and thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain the business. This is her fifth loan application and she will invest in clothing for children and adults, a variety of cosmetic products and soft drinks. In the future she would like to get more customers and improve her inventory as well as help her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for adults and children, cosmetics and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nyongo

texts.en:
Nyongo has sold bread in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 7 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. She works at her business for 12 hours every day. 

Nyongo is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread, oil and soap. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profit so that she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.  

Nyongo is 48 years old, divorced, and has seven children aged 30, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more materials (oil and soap) for her business.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Юнусов Саид проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года , женат  и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование , работает учителем в средней школе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Said U. lives in Vakhdat. He is 53 years old and is married with 4 children. He has a university diploma and works as a school teacher. He would like to get a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. He would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mme Awa O. est née le 15 décembre 1969. Elle est mariée et est mère de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de piment rouge séché. C’est un des ingrédients très utilisé et bien apprécié dans l’art culinaire chez nous. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour stocker en quantité importante du piment séché pendant la période d’abondance et le revendre en temps de soudure (saison des pluies où le ravitaillement devient très difficile). Les revenus de cette vente serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa O. was born on December 15, 1969. She is married and the mother of seven. Her main work involves selling dried red chili peppers. This is one of the much used and highly appreciated ingredients in the culinary arts where we live. She's therefore requesting financing to stock a sizable quantity of dried chilis when abundant and to resell them when scare (the rainy season, when restocking becomes difficult). The income from her sales will be used to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dried red chili peppers

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
El señor Saúl D. T. desea un préstamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo de mecánica automotriz, ya que las que tiene actualmente se las presto un familiar para que reparara los vehículos de sus clientes. 
Portal motivo solicita el crédito para poder tener su propia herramienta y así darles un mejor servicio a los automóviles de a su clientes. Ya que esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul D. T. would like a loan to purchase tools for his auto repair shop because the tools that he currently has are borrowed from a relative so that he could repair his customers' cars. His motive for requesting this loan is to be able to have his own tools so that he can provide a better service to his customers. Moreover, this business is the primary source of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah M. is a widow with 1 child and has received an education through Primary School. Hannah sells cloth at Abura, which she has done for 3 years.  Hannah uses her income to pay for clothing and feeding her child. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards expanding her business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru:
Собир Сайдалиев 1964 года рождения, проживает в городе Истаравшане, женат, отец 2 детей.
 Собир занимается торговлей. В ассортимент его товара входят полотенце, носки и нижнее белье.
 Стаж его деятельности 10 лет. Торговля на рынке, приносит ему основной доход в его семью. Кроме этого он подрабатывает банщиком.
 Жена Собира Мухаббат, тоже вкладывает свои усилия для содержания семьи. Она умеет красиво вышивать.
 Мухаббат вышивает национальные головные уборы, тюбитейки на заказ.
  Собир запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев. Полученный займ планирует потратить для своего товарооборота.
texts.en:
Born in 1964, Sobir S. is married, has 2 children and lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is involved in sales. His merchandise includes towels, socks and undergarments. Sobir has 10 years of experience in this business. Sales is the main source of income for his family. In addition, he works as a bathhouse attendant. Sobir’s wife, Muhabbot, also adds her effort to support the family. She is a talented embroiderer and embroiders traditional hats, tubeteiki. Sobir is requesting a 6-month loan in the sum of 1200 somoni. He plans to use the loan for his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Goods turnover

loans.name: Nestor Jose

texts.es: Nestor Jose está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ( Hecharle la ceramica a la casa), trabaja como  contador en la corte suprema de Justicia  desde hace 2 años y ocho meses,   tiene una hija de 9 años de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educacion primaria y el hijo mayor de 15 años de edad estudia su 5to año de educacion secundaria, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos,  don Nestor se caracteriza por ser honesto, trabajador, de buenas costumbres, sociable y  muy responsable en su centro de trabajo y en sus compromisos adquiridos, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que sus hijos  estudian, no les falte nada y tener estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Nestor Jose is requesting his first credit to invest in home improvements (to tile his house). He has worked as an accountant for the Supreme Court for the past 2 years and 8 months. He has one daughter who is 9 years old and is in 5th grade in primary school, and an older son who is 15 years old and is in his 5th year of secondary school. His wife is in charge of the household and is also in charge of caring for their children. Nestor characterizes himself as honest, hard working, well-mannered, sociable, and very responsible when it comes to his job and commitments. His dreams are to finish building his home and in that way enjoy the best living conditions, that his children study, that they lack nothing, and that he have job stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile his home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F. is fifty-three years old. She is married and has four children, two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Her husband is retired. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells ‘banku’, a local dish from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells at the market square in the mornings. Mary wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for over ten years. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea M., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sorphea Srun, 37, were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokkea and her husband have been raising pigs since 1996.  Besides raising pigs, they grow vegetables as well. Now she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
TeofiL. es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
TeofiL. es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, TeofiL. compra y venD. lana D. oveja, actividad que realiza D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central, además TeofiL. venD. quesos D. casa en casa.
TeofiL. necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. lana.
Los sueños D. TeofiL. son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
TeolfiL. is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 58 years old, married, and has 7 children. She buys and sells wool as a traveling merchant in the central market. TeofiL. also sells cheese door-to-door.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase more wool. TeofiL. dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es: La señora Juana Adilia de 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, soltera, su negocio es una comideria que desde hace nueve años administra el cual inicio con fondos que su exposo dio y ahorros que tenia, con el préstamo comprara zinc para cambiar el techo donde tiene el comedor y poder estar en las mejores condiciones con su familia y buena atención a sus clientes, ya que se le pasa con las lluvias que caen en este invierno, a futuro es poder invertir mas en la comideria. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios alcanzados en hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Adilia, 39, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is single. She operates a restaurant in her house that she started nine years ago with her own savings and funds provided by her former husband. She will use the loan to repair the roof over the dining area, work that will improve conditions for both her customers and her family during the heavy rains this winter. She would like to invest more in the business in the future. She is grateful to Afodenic for making it possible to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for roof repair.

loans.name: Inez

texts.en:
Inez Q. is a single woman from Hacienda Sandra, Bato, Brgy. Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She just turned 60.

In 1998, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she needed capital to sustain her farm. When she received her first loan of PHP 3,000, she used some of it to buy fertilizer and the balance she used to buy milled rice to resell, which enabled her to have a cash flow to pay for her weekly dues. 

On her third loan, she bought a breeding sow and farmed out the piglets to her neighbors to raise, splitting the profits with them. Now she has five breeding sows and her arrangement with her neighbors has proven to be a lucrative venture for all involved. Over the years, she expanded her farming venture and her rice business continues to flourish. Inez is such a dedicated member that she has won the best member award several times. 

Now on her 14th loan, Inez is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy seeds to grow on her farm.

As a single woman, Inez is working hard while she is able so that she will be financially secure and independent in her golden years.

In the picture, Inez is shown standing on the drying platform of newly harvested rice, which is usually sun-dried before it is sent to the rice mill.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Seeds to grow on her farm

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nueva Jerusalén” esta representado por la señora Elvira y conformada por 14 miembros las cuales van cursando juntas ya su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, hamburguesas, abarrotes, cosméticos y productos D. limpieza. La competencia dentro del rubro D. venta D. es alta pero las socias saben bien como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su mercadería y mullirse D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a realizar mejor su trabajo para generar mayores ingresos que servirán para brindar a sus hogares una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya llevan cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando ganas D. salir y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Jerusalén” (New Jerusalem) group is led by Sra. Elvira and composed of 14 members who are starting their third loan cycle together. They have demonstrated responsibility and honesty with the payments on their previous loans. Most of the members are involved retail businesses selling products such as clothing, hamburgers, groceries, cosmetics, and cleaning supplies. Competition in the sales business is high, but the members know what they need to do to get ahead because their families’ livelihoods depend on their success.

Their loan will be used to increase their inventories, purchase supplies, and acquire tools that will help them do a better job of generating more revenue. As a result, they can achieve a better quality of life. Regarding their credit experience, it was mentioned previously that they are starting their third loan cycle and have been successful and responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
Rosmary D. L. O., mujer D. 35 años cuenta que recientemente se animó a ingresar a este grupo Walisuma por invitación D. una vecina. ElL. ya trabajaba con Pro Mujer en otro grupo aproximadamente 7 años, tomo un descanso, pero ahora  ha regresado para sacar nuevamente un préstamo, porque le gusta L. forma D. trabajo, además valora mucho L. atención en salud, sobre todo las compañas D. fluorización para los niños.

Rosmery venD. comida especializándose en pollos a L. broaster, tiene su lugar D. venta en L. 16 D. Julio y le va bien, ahora quiere adquirir nuevos muebles para su tienda.
Sus compañeras D. grupo tienen diferentes actividades económicas como L. venta D. huevo, detergentes, ropa, frutas y alimentos y desean hacer crecer sus negocios teniendo un poco más D. capital con el cual operar.
texts.en:
Rosmary D. L. O. is 35 years old and recently joined Walisuma group with a neighbor’s invitation. She worked with Pro Mujer in another group for about 7 years. She took a break and is back for a loan because she likes her work, and pays more attention to health issues, especially the fluoridation campaigns for children. Rosmary sells food, specializing in broaster (baked) chicken. She has her store in 16 D. Julio (a street fair) and she does well, and now wants to get new furniture for her store. Her fellow group members have different economic activities like selling eggs, detergents, clothing, fruits and food. They wish their businesses to grow by having a bit more capital with which to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fixed assets and merchandise.

loans.name: Ibiduni

texts.en: Ibiduni sells cooked foods like àmàlà and soup. Àmàlà is made from yam or plantain. Ibiduni is 47 years old and married with four children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more plantain to make àmàlà to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain to cook more àmàlà to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. is from the village of Buyog Banlag, Valencia City. She is 45 years old. Marissa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hassan, a 39-year-old married man with four children, has been working in construction since 1998 to provide better living conditions for his family. Demand for his services is great, so he is requesting a loan to buy wood scaffolding for his business in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy wood scaffolding for his business

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado B. is from the village of Cabisera 27. He is 43 years old. Diosdado is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdado  grows and sells rice. In 2007, Diosdado joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdado has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI, which he used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be Diosdado's fourth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Dominga no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ovejas, gallinas y porcinos.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2,000.00 nuevos con los que comprarà una vaca lechera.
Su deseo para el futuro es vivir tranquila sin tantas preocupaciones.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y la puntualidad que hay en cada reunión.
texts.en:
Sra. Dominga is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children. Dominga did not attend school, but she does engage in buying and selling animals.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles and was used to purchase sheep, chickens, and pigs. Dominga now requests a loan of 2000 soles to buy a dairy cow.

Her desire for the future is to live peacefully with few worries. What she likes most about the Manuela Ramos organization are the savings account and the timeliness of each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Gloria tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Gloria es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y almuerzo para sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a las 7 de la mañana al “Mercado Central de Urubamba” a tender su pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, leche, fideos, aceites y más productos pues en esta época de fin de año es donde se vende más.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old, married, and she has five children. She is a native of Urubamba (Department of Cuzco) and is a member of the José Carlos Mariátegui Communal Bank (Arariwa Association). A hard-working enterprising woman, Gloria gets up early to do household chores, such as making breakfast and lunch for her children. At 7 a.m., she then goes to the Urubamba Central Market to run her small business (food sales). She needs a loan to buy more food, such as rice, milk, pasta, oils, and other commodities. This is the time of the year when sales are greatest. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means, and commits to repay the loan on schedule. In the heart of Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley), Urubamba is 78 km. from Cuzco, about one and a half hours travel. In pre-Hispanic times, it was a large agricultural center.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan to buy more food, such as rice, mild, pasta, oils, and other products.

loans.name: Jovinsol's Group

texts.en:
Jovinsol C. is from the village of Bonfal East in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Jovinsol is the leader of a 10-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jovinsol is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovinsol owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jovinsol has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jovinsol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovinsol is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jovinsol's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the One Way group. They are small scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 per member to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and earn more profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and schooling. 

Fatmata S. is the leader of this group. She is 40 years of age, born in Makeni City. Fatmata is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an architect and her children attend primary and secondary school. Fatmata sells vegetables, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and vegetable oil. She has been in this business for 20 years. With her share of the loan, she will buy vegetables wholesale and gallons of palm and vegetable oils to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy vegetables wholesale and gallons of palm and vegetable oils to expand her business

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.es:
Rose Mary R. G.  es una señora de 52 años de edad, que vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Doña Rose Mary tiene una finca en la cual se da el ganado para engorde. Comenta que inició su proyecto con una novilla y que poco a poco ha visto como su negocio crece día a día. Además dice que se siente muy orgullosa como microempresaria ya que se ha ido superando en muchas áreas de su vida tanto profesionalmente como personalmente.
 
Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Rose Mary  es un micro crédito de ¢664,000 (seiscientos sesenta y cuatro mil colones), para comprar más novillos ya que así podrá  mejorar su negocio y hacerlo crecer más. Dice que gracias a esto podrá tener un mayor  ingreso y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Doña Rose Mary es cliente de la Asociación de Productores El General una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica este es su segundo crédito y destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Rose Mary R. G. is a 52-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and son in a Costa Rican community called General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; this community is located in the Valle del General. Her chief businesses are ranching, farming, and sales of her products. Her sales have grown a great deal and thus have opened up new opportunities for expansion. Doña Rose Mary has a farm on which she fattens livestock. She says she began ranching with one heifer and has seen her business grow slowly, day by day. She also says she is very proud to be a small businesswoman. She has progressed in many areas, professionally and personally. Doña Rose Mary is now requesting a small loan of $1,200 (664,000, six hundred sixty-four thousand colones) to buy more heifers. In this way, she will be able to improve and expand her business. She says that thanks to this loan she will be able to have a higher income and to give a better quality of life to her family. Doña Rose Mary is a customer of the Asociación de Productores El General, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her second loan. She emphasizes that thanks to these organizations and their means of securing credit she can devote more time to productive activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Heifers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
58 year-old Lolita T. feels sad that her previous business, her “sari-sari” (variety) store, failed. Although, it was just small, its income was the only source of income to support her daily needs, as well as of some of her children's and grand-children's needs. She is already a widow and all of her three children have their own families now. Because her children are poor, in economic terms, Lolita as a mother couldn’t do anything but support them in her own little way. Unforntanely, while busying herself supporting them she lost control of her business. Despite that failure, she still feels happy that her business has helped her children and their families. Moreover, she was able to pay back the whole loan she received from ASHI for that business and now she is able to request another loan to begin a new business, which is hog/pig fattening.

For Lolita, hog fattening is sort of like saving money in a pig. Indeed after four months of fattening, the pig will be sold (either slaughtered or alive) and by then her capital will have produced a small profit. Once she raises more pigs and sells more, her profits will be doubled along with her capital. With that, Lolita is hopeful that someday she can afford to support the higher education of her grand-children.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah N. is a forty-five-year-old mother of three children aged 12, 11 and 8 years. The children are all in primary school at a local village school. Lydiah is married to Matthews Alusiola, a farmer. They live in Shinyalu area of Kakamega town.

Lydiah sells cereals in Shibuye, an open air populous market in the outskirts of Kakamega town. She went into this type of business five years ago and this is her third loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to purchase more stock of beans, maize, and other cereals. She hopes to get support from Kiva lenders through KADET Ltd to enable her to expand her business. 

She aspires to buy a plot of land and construct a permanent residential home as a way of improving her living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals; Maize and Beans.

loans.name: Kyabyakwaga Tukore Of  Kyenjojo District Group

texts.en:
In a certain small Kyenjojo town called Kyabyakwaga is a flourishingly retail shop operated by a 39-year-old go-getter businesswoman who goes by the name of T. Edisa. This stickler for hard work, and also the mother of four, has basked in the checkered career graces of her business for the last eleven years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her retail business.

In a month Edisa’s business generates her 25,000 shillings. This, to all intents and purposes, is a low figure. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. As it is now, she is taking a long view with the aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells fish for an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fish to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fish to expand the current business

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris Del Socorro es una mujer muy emprendedora. Tiene 35 años y siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 5 años actualmente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, además de tener este medio de ingreso ella imparte clases en donde trabaja todos los días diariamente ella transporta sus productos a su trabajo para mostrárselos a sus compañeros y los fines de semana sale a ofrecerlos a sus amigos y vecinos. El financiamiento es para la compra de cremas, colonias, perfumes, ropa interior y pinturas de todo tipo. Sueña con establecer una tienda en su vivienda y formar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris Del Socorro is a very enterprising woman. She is 35 years old, and she has always been concerned about improving her income. She has been selling cosmetics for over five years. She currently has two children under her care. In addition to having this means of income, she also gives classes where she works everyday. She takes her products to work everyday to show them to her colleagues. On the week-ends she goes to sell them to her friends and neighbors. The loan is to buy creams, colognes, perfumes, underwear, and all types of makeup. She dreams of establishing a store in her house and educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
Carmen Marina V. I. tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus 5 hijos: Lourdes (26 años), Verónica (24), Edith (19), Mauricio (17) y Jessica (16). Ellos viven en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Carmen es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Carmen se dedica a la agricultura y cultiva maíz, fréjol, habas y trigo. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de San Miguel cada 2 semanas. Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos. Piensa que si lo invertirá bien, tendría más dinero. Su sueño es comprar una casa y crecer más el negocio. Enfrenta desafió con la salud.
Le gusta salir a caminar, cocinar, bailar y cantar canciones antiguas. Carmen trabaja 7 días por semana.
texts.en:
Carmen Marina is 45 years old. She is single and lives with her five children; Lourdes (26), Verónica (24), Edith (19), Mauricio (17), and Jessica (16). They live in the hamlet of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. Carmen belongs to the “Lotan Bajo Rural Window,” located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are a total of 13 members, most of who are dedicated to agriculture. Carmen raises corn, beans, peas, and wheat. She buys and sells in the San Miguel marketplace every two weeks. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer. She believes that she will have more money if she invests it well and dreams of growing her business and buying a house. She has some problems with her health, but likes to take strolls, cook, dance, and sing old songs. Carmen works seven days a week.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 62 años,  es casado y vive con el menor de sus 6 hijos, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace más de 20 años, se dedica a la agricultura, antes se dedicaba a enseñar pues su profesión es la de profesor, pero tras sus años de haberse jubilado, busco un oficio mas tranquilo. En la actualidad es mas intensa su dedicación por las tareas de campo, y generalmente invierte su dinero en sembrar alfalfa y maíz. Después  arrienda sus tierras a sus clientes, que son comerciantes de alfalfa, es así que sus ganancias le permiten seguir sosteniendo su economía y además  tiene planes de mejorar y ampliar  sus cultivos.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  y promete que será muy responsable con sus pagos, y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Antonio tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 62, is married and lives with the youngest of their six children. They live in their own house. He has been a farmer for over 20 years. He taught before that; he is a teacher by profession. In his retirement he looked for a more tranquil job. His job is now more intense because of the field work. He generally invests his money in planting alfalfa and corn. He later rents his fields to his customers, who are alfalfa merchants. That is the way that his earnings allow him to keep supporting his family. He also has plans to improve and expand his crops. This is his first loan with MFP. He pledges to be very responsible with his payments. He is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. It will be very useful to the progress of his business. Antonio plans to use the requested money to buy several sacks of fertilizer that his crops need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun S. is 58 years old and a villager who lives in Tuol Svay village, Takeo province. She is a widow with three children; one is a farmer, one is a motorcycle repairer and the last one is a student in the local school.  

Mrs. Hun S. is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Hun S. is requesting a loan to dig a well to support her crop and with the rest of the loan, she wants to buy motorcycle supplies to support her child's motorbike repair business.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy motorcycle repair supplies

loans.name: Wolale Marakaso 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE MARAKASO 1 constitué de 8 femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la  préfecture  de SAN (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mal). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles,  ont en moyenne 37  ans, au moins  5 enfants et  cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année, d’où leur premier prêt de campagne. 
KADIA S. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est  stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de son produit agricole, un bénéfice de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wolale Marakaso 1 group is made up of eight married women from the village of Cinzara in the prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They live in traditional families, average 27 years of age, have at least five children each and cultivate exclusively sesame. With a view to making their agricultural operations profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program this year, taking out their first farming loan. Kadia S. is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds, as well as small machinery and agricultural intrants, at the market in San. After the winter season, her crop is stocked for a certain period of time in order to gain value before it is sold at the large market in San, on a retail basis (but also often wholesale) for cash to a customer base made up of retailers. She expects that once she has sold all her agricultural produce, she will make a profit of 70,000FCFA which will be used for the repayment of interest on the loan and for her family's running costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants, seeds and small machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four tires for his public transportation vehicle

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S., age 48, is a silk fabric seller. Her husband, Mr. Soeurn Kong (pictured here with his wife), is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support the family. The family lives in Doung Khpos village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Ny S.'s problem is that the soil in her husband’s rice field has become infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Ny Sen is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy a number of piglets and pig food in order to start a new beeding business. 

She is the mother of three children. One is an iron welder, one is employed in a private company, and the youngest attends school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to buy piglets and pig food to start a breeding business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 56 años, es separada, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus 4 hijos, a quienes trata de darle lo mejor de su trabajo. Tras haberse separado del padre de sus hijos, llego al comedor popular del estado buscando ayuda, con el pasar de los años fue ganándose la confianza, hasta que hoy en día es la cocinera oficial de este comedor popular. Es así que todas las mañanas junto a otra vecina trabajan en esta enorme labor y a cambio de sus servicios es recompensado con 5 porciones de comida, siendo de mucha ayuda para alimentar a su familia. Pero, desde hace 10 años, empezó a vender caldo de gallina y otros platillos criollas, durante los fines de semana. Como mujer muy trabajadora que es, ha adicionado a su trabajo la elaboración de salchipapa (papa y pollo fritos), en la puerta de su casa. Durante estos años hizo de mucha clientela, quienes gustan de su sazón y de su buen trato, por lo que ha logrado la preferencia de todos. Rosa se siente muy feliz por el negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, es por ello que en adelante desea colocar losetas al lugar donde realiza su negocio. Este es su 33avo crédito con MFP, se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como lo venia haciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mesas y sillas, para brindar dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 56, is separated and lives in her own house with her 4 children to whom she tries to give the best of her work. After separating from the father of her children she sought help from the state-run soup kitchen. As years went by she gained their confidence and now is the official cook of that institution. So, every morning alongside a neighbor she works in this huge effort. In exchange for their work they are given five food servings which are of great help to feed their families.
