Ten years ago, however, she started to sell chicken soup and other typical Peruvian dishes on weekends; being the hard working woman that she is, she now makes and sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried chicken) at her doorstep. During all these years she acquired a large number of customers that like the flavor of her dishes and her good service and prefer her to others. Rosa is very happy with her business because it’s quite profitable. She, therefore, wants to install a tile floor where she carries it out. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion like she’s been doing so far. She will use the requested loan to buy tables and chairs to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her food stand.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Sibonga, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food-vending business. Her husband, Armando P., is 42 years old and works as a family driver to earn a living. He also helps in his wife's businesses. Evangeline has four children who are aged between 13 and 20 years old.
Evangeline joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP and improved the family's standard of living.
This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock to sell so that she is able to continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Evangeline is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Flordelez

texts.en:
Flordelez A. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Flordelez is separated from her spouse and has three grown children. To make a living, Flordelez owns and operates a business providing pedicure and manicure services. Flordelez has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flordelez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Flordelez is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her pedicure and manicure services. This will be the first loan Flordelez has taken  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase pedicure and manicure supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for five years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans and milk, all of which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of clothes to the local market. Her primary challenges in farming are the lack of enough funds to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, the lack of a ready market for her products and diseases which affect her farm products and animals.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees of her children and improve the livelihood of her family. In the future, she would like to buy a lorry to transport her products to the market. She also plans to buy more land and increase the number of her dairy cows to five.

Florence is 49 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children who are all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
La Señora Santos Paula M. R., inicia a elaborar su tortilla desde las 2:00 am. Hasta las 9:00 am. Posteriormente se traslada su Hija al mercado Santos Bárcenas para realizar su venta.

 Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de productos para elaboración de tortillas tales como: maíz, leña, cal. 

La Señora M.  R., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su negocio y así ha  realizado la construcción de su casa a pesar que ella es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Mrs Santos Paula M. R. starts making her tortillas at 2.00am.  She finishes at 9.00am then takes her daughter to Santos Bárcenas market to sell them.

This loan will be used to buy products for making tortillas such as corn, firewood and lime.

Mrs M. R., through the loans which CEPRODEL has offered her, feels very happy that she has managed to increase her business and thereby build her house in spite of being a single mother.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood and lime

loans.name: Rene Prosper

texts.fr:
Il a de l’expérience dans la vente d’habits pour hommes, il a débuté dans ce commerce depuis 19ans et veut réaliser son rêve : devenir grossiste d’habits.

Le prêt passé  a contribué de beaucoup dans la manière de gérer son  stock et il a fait plus de bénéfices.ses recettes sont passé de 10000f/20000f à 60000f jour.
Le prêt suivant va plus le motivé à diversifier ses articles  en s’appuyant sur les vêtements à la mode tels que : les pantalons jeans, chemises, singlet, pantalons tissus cravate, chaussures, sandales classiques et des baskets. 
Son étalage aussi a subit des petites aménénagements et veut  l’agrandir.
Il a placé les enfants dans des écoles privés et veut les soutenir pour parvenir a faire des longues etudes
texts.en:
Rene has experience in men's clothing sales, he started in this business 19 years ago and wants to realize his dream: to become a clothing wholesaler. 

His last loan contributed greatly to the ways in which he managed the inventory and he made more profits.  His sales went from 10,000f/20,000f to 60,000f per day.

The next loan will motivate him even more to diversify his merchandise by adding fashionable clothing such as:  jeans, shirts, singlets, dress pants, ties, shoes, sandals and sneakers. His shop display window had some repairs done and he wants to enlarge it.  He has enrolled his children in private schools and wants to support them so they can go on to receive a higher education.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, ties, polos, t-shirts and socks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For property management: wire and fencing posts.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. José; el tiene 19 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a la agricultura el siembra verdura, maíz entre otros, para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes como por ejemplo en el mercado de Ollantaytambo, Urubamba y Cusco, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como fertilizantes, maíz, semillas entre otros

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Señor José is 19 years old, single and belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Natividad"  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  He works in agriculture growing vegetables, corn and other things.  He sells to his customers in the markets in Ollantaytambo, Urubamba and Cusco.  This is his only job at the moment.  He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, corn, seeds and other things.  He feels fortunate to receive the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, corn and seeds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos, en la actualidad sigue estudiando.

Trabaja desde hace 03 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual incrementó a su capital, la que invirtió en su oficina de capacitación personal para mayores, tiene oficina de abogados, tiene proyectos como  Institución de seguridad vial y poner un colegio CEBA en Ilave.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en propagandas en radios, publicidad con los volantes en el distrito de Juli, Ilave, para que  la sociedad adulta participe en los servicios que les brinda.

Su visión es sacar el colegio adelante y también con el Instituto.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “12 de Agosto” (August 12th) communal bank in Puno district, Puno province of Puno department.  She is 42, in a common law marriage, and she has 2 children who are in school.

She has worked for the last 3 years with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan was for  500 new sols.  She used it to increase her capital  for a personal training office for adults.  She has a law office and she has different projects like the Institution of Road and Traffic Safety, and to set up a CEBA school in Ilave.

She will use the new loan of 3000 new sols for radio ads, and flyers to put around the Juli, Ilave district so that the adults in the community can participate in the services that she offers.

Her goal is to help the school and the Institute develop.

What she most likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of its members.

loans.use: To invest in advertisement on the radio, with flyers, and by other means

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is married with three children. She runs a pharmaceutical business. She owns one small pharmaceutical kiosk and sells medications to retail clients. She launched this business eight years ago. 

Marhabo is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to purchase assorted pharmaceuticals for the cold season, when viruses, cold and flu lead to increased spending on medications. 

Her business is the main source of income for the family and her husband is also actively involved in the business. She is hoping to continue to develop her business one day by opening several more pharmaceutical kiosks.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more medications for expanding the business

loans.name: Bessy Tatiana

texts.es:
La Senora Bessy G., es originaria de la Ciudad de Esteli, donde actualmente reside; tiene 24 anos de edad, casada desde hace 6 anos, y tiene 3 hijos (sus hijos tienen 6, 5 y 4 anos de edad).
A pesar de que las condiciones economicas en su familia no eran tan favorables, ella con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, logro llegar hasta el 4to ano de secundaria.
Dona Bessy, se dedica al comercio, ella vende mercaderia en general ambulante desde hace 2 anos; desde hace unos 4 meses, esta trabajando en una Fabrica de Tabacos "PLACENCIA", en donde aprovecha al maximo, pues ofrece sus productos a todos sus companeros de trabajo, y segun ella le ha ido muy bien.
Acutalmente con el capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cubrir la demanda de sus productos, es por esta razon que ella esta solicitando este credito.
Ella espera aumentar sus oportunidades de tener mayores y mejores ganancias.
Tiene muchos suenos y metas, pero las mas deseadas, son poder establecer un negocio en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bessy G. is from the city of Esteli where she currently lives.  She is 24 years old, married for six years and has three children, ages 6, 5 and 4.

Despite the fact that she comes from a very humble family, with a lot of effort and sacrifice she was able to finish her 4th year of secondary education.

Doña Bessy has been conducting door-to-door sales of general merchandise for two years.  For four months she has been working at the "PLACENCIA" tobacco factory where she takes full advantage of her situation to sell items to co-workers.  And she has been successful at it.

At this time she does not have sufficient working capital to cover the demand for her products and therefore is requesting this loan.  She hopes to increase her opportunity to earn more and more.

She has many dreams and goals, but the most significant one is to set up her own business out of her home.

loans.use: General retail sales

loans.name: Marggi

texts.es:
Marggi R. vive en Malambo con su conyuge y su hijo de 18 años, en este municipio perteneciente al àrea metropolitana de Barranquilla, Maggi tiene su propio negocio llamado “Miscelanea y Panaderia Jorgito”, que comenzò a funcionar hace 7 años,  con la venta de cosmèticos por catàlogo, a la que fue agregando mercancias variadas que sus clientes le ivan sugiriendo y con su primer financiamiento en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo logrò comprar una vitrina dandole el esquema de punto de venta, tal como ella lo habia planeado pues comprò vitrinas y las surtiò de articulos de papelerìa , teniendo como su principal mercado a las madres de los niños que ella cuida  en un hogar comunitario, o   asignaciòn que ofrece el estado nacional a mujeres que capacita previamente,  para que apoyen la alimentaciòn y el cuidado de los niños pequeños de la comunidad , con el fin de que   sus familiares  pueda trabajar y ellos esten bien cuidados , educados y alimentados nutritivamente y que en el caso de Maggui tiene 14 años de ser una “madre comunitaria”, actividad que le ha representado muchas oportunidades, pues ha conocido proveedores  de alimentos  de los mismos hogares comunitarios, con los que ha realizado contratos, como el que ahora tiene de proveer a 512 hogares de bienestar de alimentos derivados de la harina de trigo. Por eso desde el principio siendo consciente de esta oportunidad compró equipos básicos  de panadería como la sobadora, el horno, contrató un panadero, y alquiló un local con muchos implementos de panadería con los que resolvió su problema inicial de capacidad productiva de la que hoy goza y por la cual recibe también ingresos y la oportunidad del contrato ya mencionado. 
Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un credikiva para comprar materias primas para su panadería, refrescos, dulces, implementos de aseo , para responder efectivamente a este contrato, porque su  gran desafío es justamente lograr sostener esta relación, ofreciendo la calidad que amerita los productos que son consumidos por infantes, los cuales debes ser procesados con las normas higiénicas y nutricionales de calidad y con la oportunidad que requiere la provisión diaria de estos a cada hogar de bienestar.
texts.en:
Marggi Ramírez lives in Malambo with her spouse and 18-year-old son.  This municipality is part of Barranquilla’s metropolitan area.  Marggi has her own business called: “Miscelánea y Panadería Jorgito,” which opened for business 7 years ago selling catalogue cosmetics.  Gradually she added other merchandise according to what her customers suggested and with her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan she bought a display case giving the appearance of a sales point just like she’d planned because she bought display cases and stocked them with stationery items since her main market were mothers of the children she cares for in a group home, or placement that the national government offers to women who have been previously trained, to support the nourishment and care of small children in the community so that their parents can work and the children will be well cared for, educated and fed nutritionally.  

In Marggi’s case, she’s been a “community mother” for 14 years, an activity that has provided many opportunities because she’s met suppliers of food to the group homes with whom she’s negotiated contracts like the one she now has to supply 512 welfare homes with foods derived from wheat flour.  Because of this, aware from the beginning of this opportunity, she bought basic bakery equipment like a kneader and an oven, she hired a baker and leased a locale with many bakery tools which solved her initial problem of productive capacity which she now enjoys and through which she earns income and the opportunity of the previously mentioned contract.

This is the second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’s applying for a Kiva loan to buy raw materials for her bakery, soft drinks, candy and cleaning supplies to respond effectively to this contract because her great challenge is precisely to maintain this relationship offering quality that the food the infants consume demands which must be processed following hygienic and nutritional norms of quality and with the opportunity that the daily provision to each wellbeing home entails.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her bakery, soft drinks, candy and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca Nduku

texts.en:
Rebecca Nduku M. , a hardworking lady who practices dairy farming in Kangundo town, has been in this business for 14 years and earns a monthly profit of KES.25,000. She is 64 years old, married to Benjamin, and they are blessed with four children.

Rebecca, who has never borrowed from any other MFI, is applying for her first loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer, and plans to use the entire loan amount to buy animal feed. She will use the anticipated profit to buy food and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and in future practice large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 58 años de edad y es casado con mayores hijos ya independientes. Vive con su esposa en casa propia, la cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco, en el distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su moto. Necesita mantenerla en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo que solicita de los prestamistas de Kiva, espera aumentar sus ingresos. Junto con los ingresos de su esposa que trabaja como comerciante, pueden solventar sus gastos familiares y seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 58 years old and married with adult children who are already independent.  He lives with his wife in his own house, which he has been constructing little by little, in the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than 15 years he has been transporting passengers on his 'mototaxi,' a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin to carry people in its interior.  Gilberto plans to use the loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle.  He needs to keep it in good condition so he can continue offering good service to his customers.  With the help of the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders, he hopes to increase his income.  Combined with the income of his wife, who works as a merchant, this will cover family costs and he can continue constructing his house.

loans.use: TO REPAIR HIS MOTORCYLE-TAXI

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.en: Manuchehr lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. From childhood he was interested in the farming business. He has worked in his farming business for 5 years and is very happy with the support of his friendly family. In his business, he gets help from his father, mother, brother and his sister. Manuchehr has been advised to use agricultural supplies such as fertilizers. This has lead to better results, which makes him very happy. He requests a loan of 12,000 Somoni. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Grece Lorena

texts.es: Grece Lorena C. es una joven de 22 años, propietaria de la “Miscelanea Grece” que iniciò cuando decidió convertir  el primer dormitorio de su vivienda, en un pequeño almacen de variedades, aprovechando la ubicaciòn de su casa, que se encuentra en un corredor muy concurrido del Municipio de Puerto Colombia, donde vive con su esposo, empleado de una farmacia del municipio  y su hijo menor que hoy tiene 2 años de edad.  Grace iniiciò vendiendo solamente ropa para damas e infantil, pero  gradualmente amplió su surtido agregandole útiles escolares y detalles que solicitaban sus clientes en otros lugares y que le dieron a ella la idea, de ofrecerlos tambien para comodidad de sus compradores y porque le significarian mayores ventas como hasta el momento ha logrado; asi fuè como avanzó y hoy tiene en su surtido ademàs de ropa femenina, la lìnea infantil de vestidos, utiles educativos, accesorios para damas, y articulos de modistería. Con sus credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, comprarà mercancia variada especialmente ropa y accesorios femeninos, pues su meta es surtir su negocio para aprovechar el dia de la madre que se avecina y dirigirà todos sus esfuerzos a aumentar su venta, aprovechando ese mes que es una de las temporadas, que impacta el incremento de sus ventas. Mientras tando continua aumentando sus capital de trabajo y manejando una rotaciòn de inventarios no menor de 25 dias y una rentabilidad promedia de 30%; y aunque su mayor desafio es la competencia la combate con precios y con servicios efectivos, que logra mediante la compra de contado de mercancias y la atenciòn personalizada de sus clientes al mismo tiempo.
texts.en: Grece Lorena C., 22, is the owner of a store called “Miscelanea Grece” that she started when she decided to make her biggest bedroom in her house into a small variety store.  She took advantage of the location of the house on a busy street in Puerto Colombia.  There she lives with her husband who works in a town pharmacy and her son who is 2.  Grece started selling only women and children's clothing but gradually she widened her assortment of merchandise to include school supplies and articles that her customers asked for from other stores and they gave her the idea.  This made it easier for the buyers and because it meant larger sales for her, and she has succeeded.  That is how she got ahead and now she has a selection of  women's clothing, children's clothing, school supplies and articles, women's accessories and sewing supplies.  With her Kiva loan that is her first financing from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy assorted merchandise, especially women's clothing and accessories, since her goal for the business is to be stocked for Mother's Day that is approaching and this season should mean an increase in sales.  She will also continue increasing her working capital and handling inventory turnover of no less that 25 days and an average profitability of 30%.  And although her biggest problem is competition with prices and services, she succeeds by  purchasing on credit and giving personalized attention to her customers.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, especially clothing and accessories for women

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en:
Acquilina R. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Acquilina is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Acquilina owns & operates a business providing new clothing to local community members. Acquilina is just starting this business.

In 2010, Acquilina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Acquilina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Acquilina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ready to wear clothes and supplies for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Acquilina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ready to wear clothes and supplies for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Rita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es:
Ciceli participa hace cuatro anos en la ALCOM “Mi Banquito” y hace ocho meses ejerce el cargo de presidenta, a sus  33 anos y con dos hijos dependientes afronta la vida  siendo madre soltera. Ciceli crecio en medio de una familia de agricultores que siembran, cosechan y comercializan tuberculos como: papa, habas y alfalfa. Actualmente ella se dedica  a la siembra y venta de flores; asi ha  logrado tener estabilidad economica y dar estudios a sus menores hijos. Ciceli desea utilizar una mejor tecnologia de riego para su agricultura y lograr adquirir un mejor sistema de riego para tener mejores resultados y asi mayores ganancias con su produccion, el prestamo obtenido sera utilizado en semillas y abonos para sus sembrios.
 La Alcancia Comunal “Mi Banquito” esta conformada por diez integrantes que participan hace cuatro anos con el sistema comunal y estan agradecidos por el prestamo recibido en esta nueva oportunidad para su capital de trabajo. 

*** En la fotografia estan ausentes por motivos particulares de cruze con su horario de trabajo la sra victoria elena y rosa, quienes llegaron con retraso a la reunion.
texts.en:
Ciceli has been a member of the communal bank "Mi Banquito", meaning "My Little Bank" for the past four years. Eight months ago she became the president of the group. At her 33 years of age and with her two dependent children, she faces life as a single mother. Ciceli grew up in a family of agriculturists who plant, harvest, and sell produce, such as: potatoes, fava beans, and alfalfa. She currently plants and sells flowers and this is how she has reached financial stability and how she has been able to give her young children an education. Ciceli wants to use a better irrigation technology in her agriculture projects in order to acquire a better system of irrigation to obtain better results. This will translate into better earnings from her production. The loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her plantations.

The communal bank "Mi Banquito" is made up of 10 members who have been in the communal system for four years. They are thankful for the loan received, a new opportunity to use as working capital. Month after month they work hard to make their payments on time. Victoria Elena and Rosa are absent from the photograph for work schedule conflicts, arriving late to the meeting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her plantations.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been a farmer in Litein in South Rift Kenya for the last 30 years, employing 4 farmhands and producing tea and milk for the local market. He gets additional income from his building blocks sales.

Richard has requested for a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from dairy will help in educating his children, who are numbering 8 and all in school. He remains optimistic that his business will continue to grow.

Richard, however, mentions droughts and poor markets as the business challenges for the local farmers.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 37 years old, a widow, and has four children.

Hakima is a tailor; she has been making and repairing women’s clothing since 2000. She has good experience and a good reputation and she has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to her clients.

She is requesting a $1200 loan to buy a diesel generator and to purchase additional inventory such as cloth, buttons, etc. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator and purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Marie Agnes

texts.en:
Marie Agnes is 32 years old and is married, with 2 children between 4 and 7 years old. She sells avocados, bananas, vegetables, etc., in her boutique. Her business is well-organized.  Marie Agnes has two years experience in her business and she works from 8.30am until 9pm every day. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more bananas, avocados, vegetables, etc., for sale.  With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits, such as bananas, avocados, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer and a resident of Muranga, Central Kenya. She has been in farming for five years producing milk and chicken hens that she sells in the local market. She also employs casual farmhands on her farm. She is married with two children who are seven and three years old.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry for her poultry farming business. She says the expansion of the business will increase her income and enable her to raise her children's living standards. She hopes to expand the business to produce both layers and broilers.

Elizabeth sees diseases as the main challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch, 52, is a married woman who now lives in the Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she plants different kinds of crop on her own land.  Mrs. Duch always tries all her best to feed all the children to live in a proper life as the other villagers. Her husband is also a rice farmer. The couple earns about $6 per day from their business. They have given birth to six children in response. But now two of them are married and stay in separately house. Mrs. Duch and her husband would like to loan in amounts of $1,100 in order to purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Ginger Alcira

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ginger, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer profesional y trabaja en un bus de la ciudad. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ganarse algo y con esto contribuir a los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ropa interior de damas de la marca Leonisa. Ella también realiza trabajos de arreglo y pintado de uñas, trabajo que realiza al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas ya que estos los hace a domicilio. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana.Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos y esto porque ella también los utiliza en sus trabajos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia pues alquila donde vive.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Empresarias con Futuro", meaning "Entrepreneurs with a Future", meets every 15 days in the district of Palmar of the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very well-visited throughout the entire year. It is a beautiful city without compare and it has many tourist attractions. 

Here we meet Ginger. She is 28 years old and she is married common-law. She has three children, aged 10, 7, and 2 years old. The two eldest of her children are in school. Her husband is a professional driver and he works with the city bus lines. She has been with her communal bank for two years and she appreciates it for the benefits provided by the institution.

Our friend's goal is to earn an income for herself and to contribute to the household expenses. She is a merchant who sells Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories), and she also sells Leonisa brand ladies' undergarments. She also provides manicure treatments, work that she realizes at the same time as she carries out her sales, especially because everything is done from her home. She completes her sales on credit and she collects payments every week. She has been in business for two years and it has done very well. Her best sellers are cosmetics, especially because she also uses these products in the services she provides. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and undergarments.

Her dream is to have a house of her own. She currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, skin lotions, cosmetics, and undergarments.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 28 years old and a single mother of a three year old. She operates a pharmacy and a grocery shop and has been in these businesses for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of KES 16,400.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. This is her second loan. She intends to use the money to purchase medicine for the pharmacy  and the remaining money to buy vegetables, fruits, potatoes and green maize for resale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and to provide their upkeep. She dreams of prospering in business and owning a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for the pharmacy and also buy vegetables, fruits, potatoes and green maize for grocery business to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 26 years old and single.  For three years, he has been using his bicycle to supply wire mesh, sand papers, paint brushes and tape measures.  He joined a group in Faulu Kenya where he is able to save his money, share business ideas and access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  This has helped him to become more business oriented. Alexander hopes to open a hardware shop in five years.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy brushes, wire mesh and tape measures.

loans.use: To buy brushes, wire mesh and tape measures.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa manages a variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income and help pay for daily needs. She is now 55 years old and has four adult children. Felisa and her husband aimed to improve their standard of living to give their children a better future. Despite the hardships of life, she pursue the business for she believes that hardships and difficulties are the stepping stone towards success. 
Felisa wants to increase the product offerings in her store to satisfy her customers' needs but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She hopes that this loan will do much to help make her business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 2 children aged 15 and 10. 

In 2008, Kadiatu established her house decoration business. She began her business because she wanted to be self employed and have a reliable means of helping her husband provide livelihood for their family. She takes care of decorations for houses. This business attracts a lot of customers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to move to a concrete shop in the city centre and educate her children on to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more decorations to sell

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong, age 45, operates an Internet shop in front of her house. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working for an electricity company. 

Luong has been engaged in her current business for three years.  She would like to request a loan to improve her business by upgrading some old computers and buying more games to attract more customers. She is confident that these additions will help her to run her business smoothly and earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: upgrade computers for her Internet shop

loans.name: Association "dental  15" Group

texts.fr: L'Association"Dental 15" qui se compose de cinq femmes toutes mariées, est issue d'une tontine de quartier.Les femmes pratiquent le commerce de tissus et d'articles de merceirie.Elles tirent des revenus modestes de cette activité mais arrivent tout de même à satisfaire  l'essentiel de leurs besoins.Le chef du groupe (a gauche avec le papier) est mère de 5 enfants dont trois sont à l'école.Elle prend  en charge les dépenses d'habillement de ses enfants et participent souvent aussi à celles d'alimentation et de santé avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce.Pour augmenter leur capacité, le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter diverses tissus et  articles de mercerie.Les femmes ambitionnent d'implanter chacune une cantine devant chez elle.
texts.en:
Association "Dental 15" is a group made up of five married women, who belongs to the same "tontine". They sell fabrics and notions. They make a modest earning from their businesses, but manage nonetheless to provide for most of their needs.

The group's leader (on the left in the photograph, holding a paper) is the mother of five children, out of whom three attend school. With the profits of her business, she takes care of her children's clothing expenses, and also often helps with the food and healthcare expenses.

To bolster their businesses, the members of the group are seeking a loan of XOF 250'000, in order to buy various fabrics and notions. The women all ambition to set up a small shop in front of their home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is married with one child. She lives in her own home with her family in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Jovelyn is operating a fishing business to make a living and has had this business for more than two years. Each month, she earns Php 1,500 doing this type of work. 

Jovelyn has seen her business grow and she wants to expand her business by buying more fish for her daily sales in the market. She has requested a loan Php 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

Jovelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, with her income receipts, she will be able to pay for her family needs. Jovelyn is hard working and responsible for her business and her aim is to offer a better education to her only child with her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown son. She lives in Zaporozhye, where she sells women’s clothing such as robes, nightgowns, tank tops, and shorts in one of the local markets called a “Krytyi” (which means "covered"). Galina owns a vending kiosk which helps her minimize rental costs. She has been in this business for about 11 years. 

Currently, Galina has about 35,000 Grivnyas (UAH) worth of merchandise. Her net income amounts to 2,500 to 3,500 Grivnya a month. Galina is seeking a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal winter merchandise. She always sorts out good quality items for re-sale in her kiosk. Her merchandise is not the cheapest, but she has a loyal clientele. Galina is hoping the current loan will allow her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and make additional profits. She is going to use the profits to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal winter merchandise.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 25 years old and is married with three children, aged between 2 and 6 years old. Moussa also takes care of four relatives.  He owns a business selling various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoe etc. His business is well organized. 

The hours of his business are from 6 am until 7 pm every day and he has three years of experience.  Moussa currently employs one person to help him. 

Moussa has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoes etc for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, rice, sugar, plastic shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Ana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: For sometime now Abena has been in the production of Fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is a common dish popularly known in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Abena helps her husband to take care of the home. Abena will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans on reinvesting back into the business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize to make kenkey  for sale.

loans.name: Rimaa

texts.en:
Rimaa, a 36-year-old housewife, lives with her husband who is an employee at the Ministry of Work, in addition to their three kids. Rimaa has an incredible talent for preparing food and she makes lots of kinds of pickles from different vegetables such as cucumbers, olives, thyme, eggplants and she even makes cheese, preparing the foods at home and selling them to her neighbors, friends, and relatives.

As her products have proven to be delicious and of really good quality, demand has increased in such a way that she can't serve the customers at her home due to their big numbers and her being unable to display all her products.

Therefore, Rimaa would love to get the loan so she can rent a store and make it her own independent place where she can display her products and be able to sell her products to all her clients.

loans.use: to rent a store where she can display her products.

loans.name: Abdulqader

texts.en:
Abdulqader runs a telecommunications shop where he introduces phones services to his clients. He has been in the business for 12 years and he employs two persons. His shop is located in a crowded place with many English and Computer institutes and, because of that, almost all of his clients are students who are attracted to his business during the summer season. Recently, most of his clients (students) study in schools and universities, so Abdulqader's business faces a financial challenge leading to a decrease in his profit. As well, the current bad situation in Yemen also leads to his business being closed. So, Abdulqader took out a loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AML in order to expand his business and open it again, by buying telecommunication accessories for the return of his clients. In the future, he would like to purchase another shop for a bookshop in order to meet his clients' needs, particularly the students who are studying in the different institutes.

Abdulqader is 32 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His educational background is Bachelor from Sana'a University.

loans.use: to expand and buy accessories to introduce customer services for his business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Agée de 47 ans, Awa est veuve et mère de 2 enfants résidant avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Awa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente des poissons frais et l’oignons en provenance de Dakar (République du Sénégal). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre  ans. Elle est actuellement à son neuvième prêt  individuel  et les huit prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce neuvième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 50 cartons de poissons frais et 25 sacs d’Oignons avant de les revendre en détail et en gros aux commerçantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Pour acheter des poissons frais et oignons

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis de 61 años de edad tiene una miscelánea, cuyos principales productos son las artesanías, como mecedores, sillas,  la papelería y accesorios femeninos y domésticos. Sus 20 años de experiencia le indican cada día lo que tiene que hacer en sus ventas, ya que su negocio lo inició desde el año 1992, cuando aprendió de su cuñado la actividad comercial en la que hoy trabaja.  Con su negocio genera el sustento de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos, hoy en las edades de 16, 17 y 35 años. En su local vende principalmente de contado y trabaja de lunes a domingo en un horario extendido, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde; Luis realiza sus compras de contado en fábricas  especializadas y vende en diversas comunidades de la ciudad, además del barrio donde habita y tiene su negocio.  Su meta es ampliar el surtido pues cada vez mas, crece su clientela y en épocas como el último trimestre del año, es aun mas amplio el pedido de mercancías, porque sus clientes compran en esta temporada, debido a que tienen dinero reunido producto de su trabajo, de bonificaciones y primas laborales y esto hace que aumente la frecuencia de sus compras varias veces a la semana. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, pues desea comprar en mayor volumen y disminuir esta frecuencia, para generar menos gastos de transporte y mejores posibilidades de obtener descuentos. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito al solicitar el presente credikiva, con el cual comprará mecedoras y sillas tejidas, productos de misceláneas y papelería navideña. Su meta mas adelante es lograr hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda, para que su bienestar sea aun mayor y brindarle a su familia un ambiente confortable en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luis, 61 years old, has a general store. His main products include arts and crafts, such as rocking chairs, normal chairs, paper products, feminine products, and domestic accessories. His 20 years of experience allows him to know what he should sell every day, since his business started in 1992. He learned from an early age the activities that he now does for a living.

With his business, he sustains his family, made up of his spouse and their three kids, today of ages 16, 17, and 35 years. In his location, he principally does business in cash, and works from Monday to Sunday with a schedule that extends from 7am to 6pm. Luis makes his sales in cash for specialized fabrics and sells in various communities of the city, in addition to the neighborhood that he lives in and where he has his business. His goal is to increase his assortment of goods and his customer base more and more. In times such as the final trimester of the year, the demand for goods is even higher, because his customers buy more at this time. This is due to the fact that they have money to buy products from his store, from bonuses and work premiums, and this causes him to make purchases more frequently throughout the week.

This is the reason for which he is asking for a loan from Kiva, because he wants to buy a larger volume and reduce the frequency with which he has to restock, in order to generate less expenses from transport and higher possibility to obtain discounts. This is the exact reason for the success of his present loan, with which he will purchase rocking chairs, woven chairs, miscellaneous products and wrapping paper (for Christmas). His goal for the future is to earn a better life, so that his well-being will be better and he can bring his family a comfortable living situation in their own house.

loans.use: to buy rocking chairs, woven chairs, miscellaneous products and wrapping paper for his general store.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a male Ugandan, aged 58. He is married to Immaculate, with whom he has six children between the ages of 30 and 18; two of them attend school.

Edward is a businessman, and he sells phone accessories, but he also has additional income from agriculture.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy phone accessories that he sells to Kagadi residents. He says the major challenge that he faces is competition from other business people who deal in the same products.

His dream for the future is to generate more capital and expand his business. He thanks UGAFODE for the services, even to the rural poor, and is committed to pay well so that he can get future loans. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Damuni

texts.en:
Damuni is a 41-year-old widow woman living in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha, India with two children. She is mother of two son who is 12 years and 14 years old and a daughter who is 8 years old. Her children are in a school near her house. Damuni is engaged in a tailoring business and it is the only source of income for her. She earns 3,500 INR per month. Her current income is not sufficient for her family's expenses. She wants to increase her income by producing more tailoring output to save some money for her children's education costs. 

Damuni has requested this loan to purchase a sewing machine and thread to increase her output. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread to increase her output

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Dédé A. was born in 1970 at Tsévié. After the o’level, she was launched in the ladies shoes and bags selling in the city of Tsévié. Widowed for 5 years, she got two (02) children who are actually at her dependency. Having attended the class of form 3, she has succeeded to manage her businesses thanks to the training acquired from the management of activity and credit. The two credits obtained have been totally repaid. She is a woman of character and having the sense of respect of the other properties. This has been shown through the good management made from her three first credits repaid without incident and increases her credibility. Madam Dédé A. requests today a credit of $850 which will help her to supply ladies shoes and bags to the wholesalers in Lomé to resell them at Tsévié and its suburbs. The implementation of this project will allow her to increase her activities, incomes to improve her children living conditions.

Madame A. Dédé est née en 1970 à Tsévié. Après le BEPC, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des chaussure et sacs pour dame dans la ville de Tsévié. Divorcée depuis 5 ans, elle a eu deux (02) enfants qui sont actuellement à sa charge. Ayant fait la classe de 4ème, elle a su gérer ses affaires grâce à la formation reçue sur la gestion de l’activité et du crédit. Les deux crédits obtenus ont été totalement remboursés. Elle est une femme de caractère et ayant le sens du respect du bien d’autrui. Ceci s’est illustré par la bonne gestion faite de ses trois premiers crédits remboursés sans incident et augmente sa crédibilité. Madame A. sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’aller s’approvisionner des chaussure et sacs pour dame chez les grossistes à Lomé pour les revendre à Tsévié et ses environs. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses activités et de facto, ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: to supply ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai is an MBK member who has requested her third loan of $150. Ai and her husband own a chicken farm and also do field farming. From her loan from MBK, some will be used to purchase chicken feeds and to buy additional chickens while the rest will be used to buy fertilizer and chemical for farming. The chickens were sold once a month, at a price of IDR 8,000 per kilogram.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds and to buy additional chickens

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.en: Hola Mi nombre el Hilda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa, ubicada en la plaza de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cumplir con los gastos familiares  y de estudio de mis hijas ya que soy madre soltera

loans.use: Compra de Ropa  interior, pantalones de tela Jeans, camisas de baron, bluma de dama y otros

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 36-year-old single mother of two. In order to survive, she put up a convenience store in her house, and on the weekends she prepares typical regional dishes and sells them in her neighborhood. Maria belongs to a collective with Mercedes Hernandez, who runs a cyber cafe, and Eligia L. Gomez, who makes and sells candles. With the loan, they plan to buy necessary materials so their sales can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA , TIENE 36 AÑOS , ES MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS , ELLA PARA SOBREVIVIR INSTALO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA PREPARA ALIMENTOS TIPICOS DE SU REGION PARA VENDERLOS ENTRE LOS HABITANTES DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO REMEDIOS 5 JUNTO CON MERCEDES HERNANDEZ HERNANDEZ ( CIBERT-CAFÉ ) Y DOÑA ELIGIA L. GOMEZ (CONFECCIONA Y VENDE VELAS ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN IMPLEMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS CON MAS MATERIALES QUE AUMENTEN SUS INGRESOS.

loans.use: Purchase materials for convenience store, cyber cafe and candle-making.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat I. has been selling perfumes and household goods since 1997 in Atushbazzar, Khujand. She started her business in an open-air market. Gradually she increased her working capital and rented a shop for her business. She has 4 children, who are all at school.

Shahodat's business partner is her husband who helps her to brings goods from the wholesale market in Panjshanbe, Khujand, two times a week. She also receives some goods from distributors of firms such as P&G, Pamiss, Oriflame, and Dove.

Today her business is going well but Shahodat would like to increase her inventory so as to offer a greater variety of goods. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200.

loans.use: purchase a more varied inventory for her stall

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia U.'s business is selling food items and provisions. She would like to receive a loan in the amount of $475 to enable her to buy more food items & provisions to sell. She started this business in 1985, which she learned from her mother. She has been a client of LAPO for 4 years. She is 58 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy food Items, provisions & drinks to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia works diligently to insure her family’s wellbeing and also to teach her six-year-old daughter by her example that each and every one of her dreams can be achieved through working hard. For that reason, she decided to open an Internet café in her home. Everyday she offers her services so that she will be able to support her family. Her and her husband work together in the business. The business has now outgrown the space in her home. Now she would like to open up another Internet café. Doing so will allow her to further increase her income and to continue to specializing in the type of business that she is so passionate about. Claudia is asking for a loan so that she will be able to invest in the maintenance of her computers and to buy new keyboards and mouses that she needs. With the earnings that she makes off of this equipment she will be able to continue her successful business and make sure that her family prospers. Support Claudia so that she will be able to reach her dreams of establishing another Internet café in the downtown area of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Claudia, trabaja diligentemente para cultivar en su familia bienestar y también para enseñar con el ejemplo de vida a su pequeña de seis años que todos y cada uno de sus anhelos se pueden conseguir con trabajo y es por ello que decidió aperturar en su casa una cabina de Internet, en el que otorga sus servicios diariamente para llevar el sustento diario a su familia; ella turna sus actividades con su esposo que también trabaja en su compañía.La cogida de este pequeño espacio se ha ido incrementando y ahora desean aperturar una sucursal a fin de incrementar sus ingresos para seguir con la especialización respecto a este tema que los apasiona.Claudia solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de sus computadoras y la compra de un teclado y mouse que le falta a una de ellas. Con las ganancias seguirá adelante para que la familia siga progresando, apoya a Claudia a seguir progresando y a alcanzar sus anhelos de establecer una sucursal en el centro de su ciudad.

loans.use: Maintenance of the computers and purchasing keyboards and mice for a few of them.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mr. N. Vanny has been married since 1987 and has five children, two sons and three daughters. He is currently weaving silk at home. He learned to weave silk from his wife and started his silk production in 1993. He used to serve the army during the civil war. His wife has been a silk weaver since 1980. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor.  Now Vanny and his wife have trained their eldest daughter to weave as well.  
 
He has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now he is requesting another loan of the amount of $500. He will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms, and to set up another loom for his daughter.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the looms. 
And to set up another loom for his daughter.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
There was a period of time where Lucinda's husband did not have a job and her parents had came to live with them in their house. As this happened, she needed to have a higher income. Fortunately, someone she knew offered her a job selling cosmetics. Lucinda, who had already been a vendor, accepted the job. Little by little her client's increased. Now, seh has various clients that want to buy cosmetics from her.

Still, she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. For this reason she asks for a loan of $250 that she will pay back in 3 months. Se will be able to buy merchandise to offer her clients with this. With your help, she will be able to give a better life to her kids and her parents.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Hubo una temporada en que el esposo de Lucinda se quedó sin trabajo, y los papás de ella se fueron a vivir a su casa. Fue así como la necesidad de tener ingresos incrementó. Afortunadamente una conocida le ofreció trabajar como vendedora de cosméticos y Lucinda quien ya había trabajado como vendedora aceptó. Poco a poco fue incrementando su cartera de clientes. Actualmente ya tiene varias clientas que le piden los cosméticos a ella.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Lucinda podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Lucinda podrá darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y a sus papás.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Ma. Antonieta Martin

texts.es:
I have been in the grocery business for more than three years now. It is the main source of income for my family. My husband and I  are both working and would like to invest more in the business without bankrupting ourselves. We are requesting a loan of $1,200 so that we can buy more merchandise for the grocery store.

 Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer 


Tengo ya mas de 3 años con un negocio de abarrotes este  negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertirle más al negocio sin descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a forty nine year old mother of four children. She has been operating a small food stand in the town of Obuasi for over ten years. She prepares and sells rice balls, fufu, and banku. Fufu and banku are traditional Ghanaian dishes. Fufu is made of cassava, plantain, and cocoa yams, while banku is made from maize. The proceeds of this loan will allow Georgina to buy rice in larger quantities to guard against price hikes. Georgina hopes the savings from her business will help her build a new structure for her stand and to buy plastic tables and chairs.

Georgina is a member of the trust group David. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice in larger quantities

loans.name: Mtumwa's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa, 42, is divorced and has seven children (ages 8, 11, 13, 22, 25, 26, 27) and three other dependents that she is caring for. She runs a jewelry and charcoal business, where she sells these items from 7am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started 4 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $95.

Mtumwa is requesting a loan to purchase more jewelry materials and charcoal. She will share this loan with Utesi, as they are both members of the loan group Msimamo. Loan group members are mutually responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry and charcoal

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel J. sells clothes and is also a fashion designer, a skill that she acquired over four years. She has been in this business since 1998. She is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives at Ilogbo Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is soliciting for the loan amount of $425 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Mrs Hilda is a partner in the Communal Bank "The Springtime", and live sin the department of San Martin, in the province and district of Moyabamba. Her activity is to raise and sell pigs, the same that are sold live and by weight in kilos. Her farm is located in her house in the AA. HH. La primavera Mz E Lt 7

She began this business thanks to the perseverance of her Mother who longed for her daughter move forward and not be frustrated by being a single mother despite the lack of economic support from the father of her children for food and education needs. With the thanks of God everything is going well and she is proud.

With this loan of S/700.00 ($250.00), to be repaid in 4 months, she would purchase rice, ground corn and bags of salt, rope to transport animals as she needs to bring them outside of the city in order to sell them.

She is 30 years old, has three children, and thanks to this activity is able to provide education and push her children forward and contribute to the expenses of her family. She is always characterized as being strong and a fighter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “LA PRIMAVERA”, vive en el Departamento San Martín, Provincia de Moyabamba y Distrito de Moyabamba tiene por actividad la crianza y venta de cerdos, los mismos que vende vivos y por kilos. Su criadero se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa en el AA. HH. La primavera Mz E Lt 7. Se inicio en el negocio gracias a la perseverancia de su Mamá de querer que su hija salga a delante y no se frustre por ser madre soltera ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos tanto en la alimentación y educación, agradece a DIOS porque le va muy bien de las cuales se siente orgullosa. Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00, que será pagado en 4 meses comprará: polvillo de arroz , maíz molido y sal por sacos, sogas para el traslado de dichos animales ya que ella los tiene que comprar fuera de la ciudad. Tiene 30 años de edad, 03 hijos , siente que gracias a esta actividad podrá educar y sacar adelante a sus hijos y contribuir con los gastos de su familia siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte y luchadora.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of feed for pigs. Purchasing rope.

loans.name: Titanic Group

texts.en:
Sera has owned a shop selling juice, biscuits, and milk in Arusha for five years. She is 42 years old, single, and has two children, ages 23 and 18. She works daily from 8:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $500. She is requesting a loan so that she may increase her inventory and sell more products.

Sera will share this loan with her group member, Dena, who owns a business in Arusha selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more materials to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large quantity of ingredients to keep producing food.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Esta joven madre inició su negocio comprando y vendiendo plátanos en la comunidad y también trasladándolos a Managua al mercado Mayoreo; y los fines de semanas realiza la actividad de venta de fritanga en su casa donde vive con su mamá, tiene bastante clientela de la comunidad, es conocida por la calidad de su comida; ella piensa invertir más en el negocio para obtener más ganancias y poder construir su pequeña casa en un terreno heredado de su mamá. 

Ella vive con su esposo y su hijo pequeño, quien se entiende directamente en el negocio es solamente ella. Piensa obtener más créditos para salir adelante y poder realizar lo que sueña.
texts.en:
This young mother started her own business buying and selling bananas in the community, as well as transporting them to Managua to the Wholesale market. On weekends, she sells fried food in her home, where she lives with her mother. She has a large clientele in the community, and she is known for her quality foods. She plans on investing more money into the business so that she can yield greater profits and be able to build her small house on a plot of land that she inherited from her mother.

She lives with her husband and young son. She is the only one who deals directly with the business. She plans on obtaining more loans so that she can get ahead and be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Delfina Fausta

texts.es:
Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, es socia del Banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en el Jr. Acobamba s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual empezó con muy pocos productos y vendiendo en el mercado campo ferial de Yungay. Con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos y con su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y su mayor sueño es que junto a sus dos hijos puedan hacer grande el negocio. Su esposo se dedica a movilizar a las personas mediante una moto taxi y también la ayuda en el negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará 10 sacos de arroz, 10 sacos de azúcar, 5 cajas de atún y 5 cajas de aceite. Con esta inversión podrá mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old, member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” in Yungay and she lives at Jr. Acobamba s/n, Yungay district and province, Ancash Department. She has a business selling groceries, which she began with very few products and selling them in the country market of Yungay. With the help of Manuela Ramos and with her effort she has grown her business and her greatest dream is that together with her two children they can make the business great. Her husband is a motortaxi driver, providing public transportation, and also helps in the business. With this loan for S/. 800, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 10 sacks of rice, 10 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of tuna and 5 boxes of oil. With this investment she will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, tuna and oil.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily tiene 38 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es docente de profesión, pero diariamente, en sus tiempos libres, generalmente en las tardes, ella y su cuñada elaboran yogurt de diferentes sabores, en su misma casa han implementado un espacio para la preparación de estos con los estándares exigidos en cuanto a higiene se refiere. Los fines de semana se dirigen a las  principales ferias comerciales para vender  los yogurt, lo más difícil es cuando existe mucha competencia, ya que existen muchos comerciantes del mismo producto, pero Lily está pendiente siempre de ver las mejoras de su producto para que  su consumo sea más aceptado. Es la tercera vez que solicita este préstamo con MFP, en los cuales se ha portado de manera responsable. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de los insumos y materiales necesarios para la elaboración del yogurt, como los envases e ingredientes como los saborizantes  y leche.
texts.en:
Lily, 38, lives with her husand and their 2 children. She's a teacher by profession, but in her spare time--afternoons, generally--during the week, she and her sister-in-law make different kinds of yogurt for sale. They have set up a space in Lily's house to make the yogurt which is processed to the standards of hygiene that yogurt requires. At weekends, they go to the principal fairs in the area to sell the yogurt. The main challenge is competition because there are lots of vendors selling the same product, but Lily is committed to ensuring that her product is the best because she wants to draw in as many customers as possible. This is her third MFP loan and she's demonstrated a responsible manner in the past. This loan will be used to buy the supplies and materials necessary to make yogurt: bottles, for example, and ingredients such as flavoring and milk.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and materials for yogurt business.

loans.name: Mumtaz M.shahbaz Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Baji resides in a city of shrines named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  She owns a two-room brick house in this city and has been living in it for the past 30 years.  Her husband's name is M., and he runs a tea stall.  He has 4 years of experience in this business.  He is a very devoted and hardworking person. 

Mumtaz Baji has been involved in a clothes selling business for the past 4 years.  She buys clothes from a famous city named Multan and resells in her own city to earn a profit.  

She is the mother of two daughters.  Her elder daughter reads in the 7th standard, and her younger daughter reads in kindergarten.  Mumtaz Baji and her husband work really hard for their daughter’s good future.  She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothes selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few more women in her community.  Musarat Shaheen Baji and Zahida Parveen Baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  Sharifan Baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.  Shahana Basher Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.  Parveen A. Baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro Deciderio Velásquez  tiene la edad de  46 años  , habita en el barrio el rodeo ubicado en San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos de la casa ; ellos no tiene  a su cargo ningún hijo ya que estos son mayores de edad y viven en su propia casa . Los planes hacia su familia de don Genaro es mejorar económicamente para tener una vida mejor junto a su esposa .El hace dieciséis años trabaja como agricultor y la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento. Inicio con sus propios esfuerzos el cultivo pero este carece de insumos lo cual necesita el apoyo de la institución para poder ser efectiva dicha aplicación. Con esta solicitud va a comprar insumos de fertilizantes y venenos para tener una mejor producción y poder venderla a mejor precio lo cual le generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
