Genaro Deciderio Velásquez is 46 years old. He lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood located in San Juan de la Concepción along with his wife, who helps out with the household expenses. They do not have any children to take care of as theirs are all adults and live in their own homes. Genero´s plans for his family are to improve financially so that he and his wife can have a better life. For the past 16 years he has worked as a farmer and the greatest difficulty has been lack of financing. He started growing crops but lacked supplies and needed the support of an institution in order to be successful. With this loan request he will buy fertilizers and poisons so that he can produce more and be able to sell at a better price which will generate more income for him.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and poisons.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Меликова Майрам живет со своей семьей в одном из дальних кишлаков города Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Домохозяйка. Занимается уходом за своим хозяйством, где имеет пару голов КРС. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота , планирует получить кредит и купить молодого бычка. Погасить кредит сможет течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mairam M. lives with her family in one of the remote villages around Tursun-Zade. She is married and has 4 children. Mairam is a housewife. In addition, she tends to a small cattle farm. Mairam applied for this loan to purchase a young bull. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phan Thị Cơ năm nay 56 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi cá và buôn bán cát đã xây dựng. Công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán của gia đình chị đang phát triển tốt và đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ thnág.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng bến bãi nhằm phục vụ cho công việc  kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phan Thị Cơ, 56 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, she and her family raise fish and sell sand and stone for use in construction. Both the fish-farming business and the construction materials business are doing well, together earning the family about 4,000,000 VND (240 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 5,000,000 VND (300 USD) to expand their riverfront landing in order to improve their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand and stone and fishfarming businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  inició el negocio ya que  era empleado de un taller mecánico, tenía varios años trabajando allí y su sueldo era muy bajo, y su familia iba creciendo, así que se decidío a poner su propio negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1987, fue gracias a un primo le ofreció en venta un carrito para la elaboración de Hot-Dogs y se lo compro. Desde el primer día le empezó a ir muy bien y actualmente tiene tres carritos, su hija mayor se encargaba de uno y el se encargaba de otro. Actualmente ya vende solo los fines de semana ya que entre semana se esta dedicando a la venta de productos  naturistas y sale a poblados cercanos a repartir.
 

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para comprar materia prima lo que le va a servir para comprar materia prima y desechables para poder seguir elaborando hot-dogs y hamburguesas y darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes teniendo todos los ingredientes necesarios.
texts.en:
Daniel began his business while he was employed in a mechanic's shop. He had been working there many years and his pay was very low and his family was growing. So he decided to open his own business. He began the business in March of 1987, thanks to his cousin who offered to sell his Hot Dog cart. From the very beginning, it went well, and currently Daniel has three carts. His oldest daughter is in charge of one, and he takes care of the others. He currently only sells during the weekends, as during the week he sells natural products in nearby towns. He needs this loan for MXN 4000, which he will repay in 10 installments, to buy raw materials and disposable products so that he can continue to sell his Hot Dogs and hamburgers and in order to give better service to his customers by having all the necessary ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: В июне у Салимы закончился прежний кредит от КИВА. За это время в ее жизни произошли приятные перемены. Ее старшая дочь, которая помогала Салиме в ее бизнесе недавно вышла замуж (на фото). Это произошло благодаря трудолюбию Салимы, которая не бросила заниматься бизнесом, несмотря на все трудности.  Сейчас Салима вместе со своим братом в дополнение к своему основному бизнесу – купле продажи фруктов, стала заниматься куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Для восполнения недостатка денежных средств решила получить займ.
texts.en:
In June, Salima’s previous KIVA loan ended. Since that time positive changes happened in her life. Her eldest daughter, who helped Salima in her business, recently got married (she is in the photo). This occurred due to Salima’s industriousness; she did not stop working on her business despite all the difficulties. Today in addition to her main business - purchasing and selling fruit - Salima together with her brother has started to purchase and sell small livestock. She decided to take out a loan to fill her shortage of funds.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Angelica Virginia

texts.es:
Señora Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo  y tiene estudio superior.

Trabaja hace 04 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y posee un negocio de Artesanías, su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió como capital para comprar lana y otros enseres para tejidos. Ella en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de trucha; negocio que le va bien.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará lana de alpaca y sintética al por mayor; y con las ganancias piensa darles una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.  Esta comprometida a pagar de manera puntual sus 04 cuotas. 

Ella desea tener una empresa propia de trucha y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Virginia is a partner of the "María Asunción Galindo" community bank. She lives in the district of Juli, in the Chucuito province of the state of Puno. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner and son. Virginia has a higher education. Virginia has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past four years, and she owns a handicraft business. her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy wool and other inputs for weaving. Now she raises trout, and the business is doing well. With this loan of 500 soles, Virginia will buy alpaca wool and synthetic fibers in wholesale quantities. She hopes to use her earnings to give her children a better education and a more nutritious diet. She's promised to repay punctually in four installments. Virginia would like to have her own trout business and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and fibers as well as trout food

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira has been fish seller and has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Jipe moyo loan group (group code 2088). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $85. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and fish for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Subira is 32 years old, married, and has a 9-year-old child. She also take care of one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fish for resale.

loans.name: Ofilio

texts.es: El Señor Ofilio Torrez tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, su compañera de vida vende comida casera, tiene cuatro hijos los dos mayores trabajan. La terminación de su vivienda es unos de sus planes para beneficiar a su familia. Don Ofilio se desempeña como albañil desde hace dos años tiene su trabajo fijo y seguro, que le permite invertir en la seguridad de su hogar. Ha tenido dificultares para el desarrollo de sus proyectos de la construcción de su casa por falta de financiamiento. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y perlines. Terminando un muro que se requiere para mayor seguridad y protección de su familia ya que hasta el momento lo tiene forrado con zinc.
texts.en:
Mr. Ofilio Torrez is 39 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He has four children, the two eldest of whom work. His partner sells homemade food for a living. He is trying to help his family by finishing their home. Ofilio works in construction and has had a secure job for two years. This allows him to invest in his home’s security. He has had some difficulty building his home because of lack of money. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he will buy construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, and timber. He is finishing a wall needed for more protection and greater security for his family. It’s covered with zinc right now.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un muro

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Felicia sells foodstuffs and household appliances at Melcom in Hohoe, which she has done since 1995. Her husband is a petty trader who earns little for a living. Felicia uses her income in supporting her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses.

Felicia will use the loan to buy more of the foodstuffs and household appliances that she sells to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and household appliances to expand her business

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нури Рахмонова  1954 года рождения., замужем имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее неоконченное образование. На рынке торгует 5 лет. Продает детские вещи, женское белье а также детскую обувь. Раньше торговала только детской одеждой. Кредит получила в 2003 году на покупку детских вещей. Со временем поняла что продажей только детской одеждой  прибыли больше не будет.С каждым разом увеличивала свой оборот и прибыль. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку и рада за полученный кредит.
texts.en:
Nuri R. was born in 1954. She is married and has four children. She did not complete secondary school. She has been trading at the market for five years. She sells childrens items, women's underwear, and children's footwear. Earlier, she only sold children's clothes. She took out a loan in 2003 to buy them. With time, she understood that by only selling children's clothing, she wouldn't make much of a profit. With each loan, she's increased her turnover and profit. She is grateful to Kiva for its support and glad to receive loans.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of summer clothing

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es: Santos Victoria Z. Z. tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo. Y es madre de 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Debido a la necesidad de aportar cierto ingreso para su familia,  y motivada por su familia decide emprender su negocio que es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, en donde sus clientes recurren a su vivienda para comprar la carne del cerdo. Uno de los desafíos que enfrento es que debido a su edad no puede caminar a lugares tan lejanos por lo que solo buscando en ciertas comarcas es donde encuentra más favorable a los cerdos. El destino del financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y ciertos utensilios. Su deseo es seguir luchando con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos Victoria Z. Z. is 65 years old and lives with her husband. She is also mother to two children who still depend on them. Due to the necessity to provide certain income for her family, and motivated by her family, she decided to start a business butchering pigs. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than four years whereby her customers come to her house to purchase pork. One of the challenges that she has faced is, due to her age, she cannot walk to faraway places so she is looking only in certain places where it is more favorable for the pigs. The loan will be used as working capital for the purchase of pigs and certain utenstils. Her desire is to continue moving forward with her business so that her children have the opportunity to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dimas Isaias

texts.es:
el joven Dimas Isaias F. se dedica al comercio, el cuenta con un negocio en el cual vende ropa para cama y planchas electricas, el sale muy temprano a diferentes barrios, colonias y caserios cercanos a la ciudad de Choluteca, tambien su producto lo distribuye en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que tiene que viajar a la frontera en donde los productos son mas baratos. esto es para poder sacarle mayor ganancias a los mismos. su meta a corto plazo es poder montar una pequeña tienda en donde el tenga su producto en venta y tambien salir a vender.
el nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que expresa que todo le esta saliendo bien y que tiene muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante. desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man Dimas Isaias F. dedicates himself to commerce. He counts on a business in which he sells bedding and electric irons. He leaves very early for different neighborhoods, communities and settlements near the city of Choluteca. He also distributes his products through different state and private businesses.

He needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise at wholesale. He has to travel to the border where the products are cheaper. This allows him to take bigger profits. His short term goal is to be able to open a small shop where he can have his products for sale and also get out of traveling sales. He told us that he feels very happy since everything is going well and he has a strong desire to excel and get ahead. He wants to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bedding and electric irons

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly D. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Beverly is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 36 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Beverly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dina Susana

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Dina es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Quinua, Dina tiene un puesto en el mercadillo del Distrito en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Dina tiene un carro con el cual realizan transporte de pasajeros.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para la mejora de la puerta de su casa.
Los sueños de Dina son comprar otro carro, construir un hostal y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the community bank, Banco Comunal Paraíso.

Dina is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. She lives in the Quinua district. Dina has a stand in the District market where she sells food. She works everyday with the help of her children. Dina has a car with which she offers tranportation to passengers.

Dina needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar and to fix the door of her house.

Dina dreams of buying another car, constructing a hostel, and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar and to fix the door of her house.

loans.name: Romilio

texts.en:
Mr. Romilio Rivas is 54 years old and is married to Mrs. Carmen Acuna Rivas. They live in their own home in Hohenau. 

Mr. Romilio has been devoted to peanut candy sales for quite some time with his wife. They are both responsible for the making and distribution of the peanut candy. Many customers consistently buy their product, and the product is also distributed to other kiosks and stores. The couple operate a small kiosk from their home that is run by Mrs. Carmen. Through this work, they have been able to succeed and grow a microentreprise. The demand for good quality products by customers continues to grow, which helps them maintain their home and cover other expenses that may come up. 

They are requesting credit to buy more supplies for candy, so they can fill orders and not fail customers. The amount requested is Gs. 3,000,000.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and sugar

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

Beatrice is a trader. She trades in plastic/metal buckets and other plastic wares. She sells on a table top at the local market square. Beatrice says she buys her goods from Kumasi and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy buckets and pans

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 57 years old, married, and blessed with six children. The family lives in the peaceful village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan.

William is a hardworking person who operates his repair shop business in their community. He has been in this business for more than ten years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000.

William wants his business to grow and, with this in mind, he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. This amount will be used to purchase tools needed in his repair shop. He believes that this will really help his business and help his family to have a progressive living.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed in his repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
The lives of people are filled with useful experiences. They are diverse like people themselves. Different people have different ordeals. It is believed that strong people have more difficult ordeals. However, steadfastness and hope for better always help people to live through them. Besides, there are always people around us who are there to support us in difficult moments. Those are our parents, closest relatives and friends. The leader of this group, Nazgul, a 28-year-old young woman, deserves to be called a strong woman. The ordeal that awaited her was divorce after a few years of happy marriage. The expectations of cozy and agreeable married life did not come true. Instead, after divorce actually took place, she was left with two children to raise and uncertainty about life in the future. Nazgul wisely viewed things in a sensible light. She talked to her parents and they agreed to help her look after her five–year-old son and three–year-old daughter while Nazgul is at work as a hospital nurse. Her parents have also given her some sheep for breeding and so animal husbandry became Nazgul’s second occupation. Although she only earns about $95 per month, she can always sell some of her cattle to satisfy her family's needs. Nazgul wants to increase the total population of her cattle and is therefore requesting a loan to buy a calf.

There are three partners in Nazgul’s group:

Asigul, 60, has raised four children and is married to a vice principal of music college. Asigul is a housewife who keeps some cattle and needs a loan to buy a cow.

Burulbu, 59, has one son, a boxing trainer. and a retired husband. For a living, Burulbu raises livestock and sells milk. She hopes to obtain a loan to buy a cow.

Kuljamal, 56, a mother of five children, is married to a shepherd. Kuljamal stays at home and looks after cattle and sells milk. She has applied for this loan to buy a milk cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for resale

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Marcia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 38 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Marcia no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. ovejas.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà una vaca.
Su deseo para el futuro es poder vivir tranquila.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the Communal Bank "San Juan," in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, is married, and has three children. Marcia did not go to school. She buys and sells livestock.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years and her first loan was for 300 Soles, which she used to purchase sheep. She now seeks a loan of 2500 Soles with which she will buy one cow.

For the future, she wishes to live peacefully. What she likes most about the organization is the saving and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita S. is from the village of Sebac, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Bernardita owns and operates a business providing house-rental services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month. In 2008, Bernardita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating her business. Bernardita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang E., 39 years old, is a good mother blessed with four children. Her three grown children go to school or to work at different occupations while the other one is married.

To earn a living, Vang E. and her husband are domestic workers at a construction location. They are also hired by neighbors to build their houses in the village.

Vang E. has a single son who wants to have a partner in his wife and needs to have a wedding party, but Vang E. doesn’t have money yet to have a party. Therefore, she has requested a loan of $500 in order to perform a party, if possible.

loans.use: To perform a wedding party.

loans.name: Los Geranios 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Los Geranios (The Geraniums), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing, which she buys in bulk packages that arrive from places like the Salvation Army. She will use the profits to invest in her children's future as well as improving her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Clothing to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy N., a 53-year-old married mother of six children, has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for eight years. She has long experience in raising sheep and has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan she will buy sheep which she will raise and sell on the market. This activity allows Amy to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza D. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bed sheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sandals and shoes to sell. Tereza is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy three sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sandles and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Z. Rahmatullo is 58 years old and has a successful business selling flour, rice and mineral fertilizer at the local market of Shahrituz region. He sells an assortment of different items of good quality. Because Rahmatullo buys his goods wholesale, his prices are cheaper than those of his competitors. Thus he has many customers who even make a purchase of his products straight from his house. Today Rahmatullo has great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. He has requested a loan of 13,000 Somoni to add to his working capital to allow him to purchase more inventory. Rahmatullo is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. IMON International believes his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rice to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia T. is from the village of Brgy. Uno, Katipunan. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a retail store selling a variety of different products such as shampoo toothpaste etc. in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sonia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support her child's education.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel H. y su esposo el señor José Manuel Bernal tienen una linda familia de dos pequeños hijos, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
En este momento están pasando por un momento difícil tiene un familiar enfermo y quieren ayudarlo pero como no cuentan con el dinero. 
 Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así poder ayudar a su familiar en estos momentos tan difíciles.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción ya que si esposo el señor José Manuel se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel H. and her husband, Mr. José Manuel Bernal, have a beautiful family of two little children, for whom they wish to provide the best. At the moment, they are having a difficult time. They have a sick family member and they want to help him, but they don't have the money. It's because of this that they are asking for a loan, to be able to help their family in these difficult times. She plans to repay the loan with the earnings she obtains from her work in a factory in the area. Her husband, Mr. Jose Manuel, will be in charge of the their household expenses with the income he obtains from his work as a security guard for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Bokk Jom/ndoffene1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « BOKK JOM » est créé depuis 3 ans, il a 6 cycles d’existence. Il fait parti d’un des sous groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de NDOFEENE1. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par affinité. Elles sont d’âges différents, entre 30 et 60 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Leur activité principale est l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine, cette activité est très favorable dans la zone du fait de l’existence de beaucoup de marchés hebdomadaires. Ses marchés hebdomadaires drainent beaucoup de monde, ce qui contribue à l’accroissement de l’économie dans cette localité. Et comme activité secondaire elle font du petit commerce de céréales locales.

Madame Cécile Khémesse NGOME, en médaillon en bas et à l’extrême droite  de la photo, est âgée de 47ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui lui sont confiés par des parents. Comme ses autres camarades de groupe, elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple en payant la scolarité de ses enfants et en leur assurant une bonne couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "BOKK JOM" was created three years ago, having spanned six (loan) cycles.  It is part of one of the sub-groups that make up the Banc Villageois of NDOFEENE1.  The group is composed of fourteen women, all from the same village, who are organized by affinity.  They are of different ages, ranging from 30 to 60, and are all married mothers having at least three children each.  As their main work, the group members fatten cattle and/or sheep.  This is a very favorable business, where many weekly markets exist.  These weekly markets attract a lot of people.  It helps the economy of this town to grow.  As a secondary business, the group members do a little commerce in local grains. Ms. Cécile Khémesse NGOME, whose portrait appears at the bottom and to the far right in the photo, is 47 years old and the married mother of seven children.  And she is the guardian of three others entrusted to her by relatives.  Like her friends in the group, Cécile fattens cattle and sheep.  She has been operating this business for over ten years.  The goal of her loan is to bolster her business with the aim of helping to improve her family's living conditions by, for example, paying the schooling costs for her children and ensuring good health care for them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and further developing their revenue-generating businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: D. M. Rose est née le 03 Avril 1952 et est mariée à De SOUZA Flavien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Rose vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rose vit avec ses enfants. Rose apporte une aide financière à son mari en l’aidant à répondre aux divers besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Rose n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Rose vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermentée accompagnée de sauce et de poissons frits) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Rose vend des produits divers (biscuits, bombons, savons, etc.). Rose achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Rose sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter la quantité de nourriture préparée pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rose D. M., born April 3, 1952, is married to Flavien De Souza. They have two children, both educated. For about 15 years she has lived in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, with her children. She helps her husband pay for the family's needs, thanks to her business income. She never went to school. For about eight years she has sold food door-to-door (corn mush and sauce, fried fish). She also sells other products such as cookies, candy and soap, which she buys at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business by preparing more food for her customers.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cornmeal and condiments

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Natalya sells children's clothing in the central market in Novomoskovsk, owning several vending kiosks in the same marketplace. She launched her start-up four years ago and presently has over 65,000 Grivnyas invested in the business. Her income amounts to 20,000 Grivnyas a month.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming fall season. In Ukraine, the school year begins in September and students are required to wear uniforms. Natalya wants to buy them in bulk for retail sale in August.

Natalya is an experienced vendor. She knows what a customer wants and tries to meet the demand. She is hoping to generate additional income and finish remodeling her new apartment which she bought only a year ago.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming fall season

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida P. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora desde hace 9 años cuenta con negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea Oyuky” en el que ofrece mejor calidad y bajo precio. La señora desea surtir el negocio de papelería para tener más variedad en su local y de esta manera pueda recibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelaida P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman. For nine years she has had a grocery business called “Miscelánea Oyuky”. She sells good quality for a low price. She wishes to stock her business with stationery in order to have more variety in her place. This way she will be able to get more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Xiomara R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Bibliotecaria en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  ocho años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado siete créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ropa y zapatos escolares para sus hijos para las fiestas patrias que celebran en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara R. is from the town of El Sauce. She has been employed as a City Librarian for 8 years. Ceprodel has granted seven loans for personal expenses. This loan is requested to buy school clothes and shoes for her children for the national holidays that are celebrated in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For school expenses.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un señor de 39 años de edad, vive en San Carlos Morazán junto a su esposa y seis hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, su trabajo es la albañilería realizándolo de lunes a sábado y de esta manera solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar.
Él está solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de cemento, arena, hierro para terminar su vivienda, y así tener una casa digna para el crecimiento de sus hijos, Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda pues el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para terminar de construir la casa.
El sueño de Pablo es poseer una casa segura y digna para vivir con la familia, para que en tiempo de lluvia no corran el riesgo de verse a afectados, mejorando así sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is 39 years old and lives in San Carlos Morazán together with his wife and six children, who depend on him economically. He is a bricklayer, and he works from Mondays to Saturdays to meet his family's basic needs. He is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, and steel to finish building a home, where he can raise his children with dignity. This loan will be a great help to him because he otherwise will not have sufficient money to finish his house. Pablo's dream is to have a safe and proper home for himself and his family so that they can be comfortable during the rainy season and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a rice-retailing business. Her husband Joenel, who is 43 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business. They have three children aged between 19 and 23.
Leziel joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leziel has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell so that she is able to continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.
Leziel A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Neli Francisco Paia

texts.pt:
Neli Francisco paia S. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 11, 15 e 18 anos de idade, os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez a 6ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, possui um negócio próprio de venda de frangos ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por cada lote de produção que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que já teve empréstimos nesta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e raçoes para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para fazer criação em grande escala.
texts.en:
Neli Francisco Paia S. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of three children, who are eleven, fifteen, and eighteen.  The two youngest are in school.  She finished sixth grade and didn't continue due to an unwanted pregnancy.  She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't financially support anyone outside of her family.

She never left the city of Maputo.  She has had her own business where she has sold chickens for more than four years.  She doesn't have any employees, but she has the help of her children.  She makes an income of 20,000 meticais for each lot that she produces, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some through a system known as Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system).

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who already had a loan with the institution.  This is her first loan in the amount of 16,000 meticais, which she will use to buy chicks and feed to increase the quantity of her stock.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines and will then ask for another loan to raise chickens on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: José Alexis

texts.es: El Sr. José Alexis Z. M. él es productor dedicado a diversas actividades  agrícolas los rubros que siembra principalmente es el maíz, frijol, trigo  tiene veinte años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para preparar el terreno  y comprar los materiales  para la siembra,   los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Alexis Z. M. is a farmer.  He mainly grows corn, beans, and wheat.  He has been doing this for 20 years.  

He has had two loans with CEPRODEL.  He used each loan to prepare the land and buy materials for planting.  The CEPRODEL loans have been greatly beneficial to him because that is the way he has improved his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies like urea and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro V. V., tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada y su esposo labora como Guarda de Seguridad, apoyándole a su familia con los gastos económicos  en que estos incurren , ellos tienen 3 hijos, y dos de ellos son mayores de edad que estudian la universidad y el menor  la secundaria, los padres de familia son agricultores, desde hace mas de 12 años, en donde han tenido problemas de sequia e infección de plagas, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que compro un pequeño terrero en el cual ahora están localizadas las siembras, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para un mantenimiento Fitosanitario optimo que favorezca la producción, aumente las ventas de las cosechas y mejore continuamente la economía de la familia, con el crédito compraran fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que a futuro permitirán la incursión a nuevos mercados de vegetales que se consuman en masa. Esta inversión les admitirá suplir con el gasto económico que incurre la familia con sus hijos mayores en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Celia del Socorro V. V. is 37 years old, married, and her husband works as a security guard helping his family with the financial expenses that they incur. They have three children – two are adults and are university students and the youngest is in high school. The parents have been farmers for more than 12 years and have had problems with drought and pests. It was with the help of her husband that she bought a small piece of land where the crops are now located.

She is requesting a loan for her business to provide good plant health care that favors production, increases crop sales and continually improves the family finances. With the loan, they will purchase fertilizers, fungicides and plant supplies that will allow them to enter new vegetable markets in the future where the crops are widely consumed.

loans.use: Plant health care

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is a forty-five-year-old single woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of owning her own residence. For twenty-three years, she has been a tailor and this has enabled her to pay school fees for her children with a dream of owning a tailoring school. 

Edreda needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying clothes for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco Q. de 49 años de edad esta casado hace 25 años con la Señora Feliciana Colmán de 45 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales 2 viven en el extangero.
El Sr. Francisco se dedica a la compra y venta de mandioca en  hace 8 años. Adquiere los productos de los propios productores y luego los comercializa en el mercado municipal y a comercios de la zona.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mandioca en cantidad en la chacra, ya que está llegando fin de año y tiene que prepararse para cumplir con todos sus clientes.
Mas adelante desea iniciar un negocio de venta de productos de consumo ya que tiene clientela formada.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Q., age 49, has been married for 25 years to Señora Feliciana Colmán, age 45. They have 5 children, 2 of whom live abroad.

For 8 years, Sr. Francisco has been involved with the purchase and sale of cassava. He acquires the product from producers and then markets it in the municipal market and to the area’s businesses.

He is applying for this loan in order to purchase cassava from farms. Since the end of the year is arriving he has to prepare to fulfill orders from all his customers. For the future, he wants to begin a business selling consumer products since he has an established clientele.

loans.use: The purchase of cassava.

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en: Gerelt-Od T. is a young man. He works as a plumber for the Gonchig Soum company since graduating from Ulaangom college, majoring in plumbing in 2010. His work is seasonal, therefore he plans to operate a taxi service in his town during summer months. He has purchased a car, through a 3,500,000 MNT loan, that will be used as a taxi. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay off the car loan. For the future, he hopes to have his own plot of land and fence.

loans.use: To pay off the car's loan

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 33 years old and married to K. Cherusei who is a matatu (minibus) driver, and he supports his family. Right now his monthly income is $15. Josphine also supports their family of eight people. She has been in the business of livestock keeping for five years.

She is borrowing 5,000 KES to purchase more goats to raise and sell. She plans to use the anticipated profit to educate her children. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She hopes to grow her business and in future be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Patawag Liloy Zamboanga del norte. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lisseth Noemy

texts.es:
Liseth, de 19 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 5 años de edad, la casa es de su suegra. Liseth se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio, el horario de venta es de 4:00pm a 9:00pm, aprendió la elaboración de las pupusas por su suegra.
Ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz, chicharrón y quesillo, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para preparar las ventas diarias, también a la atención de los clientes ya que espera mejorar su preparación de las pupusas.
Las aspiraciones de ella con respecto al préstamo es: realizar una buena inversión, mejorar los ingresos de la familia, ayudar a su hijo en los estudios y algún día tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Liseth, age 19, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazan department. She lives with her husband and five-year-old child. Their house belongs to her mother-in-law. Liseth sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and has had this business for one year. Her sales schedule is from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm. She learned to make pupusas from her mother-in-law.
She needs a loan to invest in corn, pork and cheese. This purchase will help her to have the necessary materials to prepare for her daily sales. It will also improve her customer service as she hopes to improve her pupusas.
Her goals with respect to this loan are: to make a good investment, improve her family's income, help her child with his education, and to one day have her own home.

loans.use: the purchase of rice, pork and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and buy more materials for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina De Fátima

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer luchadora que desde hace 19 años conoce el significado de trabajar en las calles, pues la falta de oportunidades la obligaron a conocer la ley del rebusque, que se ha convertido en su fuente de sustento. Es así como esta emprendedora es vendedora ambulante de productos de legumbrería, especialmente del tradicional aguacate. 
 
Sus jornadas laborales son largas, desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, Luz Marina ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes y tiene que soportar las inclemencias del clima, pues como ella misma lo afirma el invierno no es bueno para su negocio. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para surtir su negocio,  porque en ocasiones no le alcanza para comprar buena mercancía y así aumentar ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a hardworking woman who for 19 years has known what it's like to work in the streets, since the lack of opportunities have forced her to learn the law of gathering, which has become her source of sustenance. She is enterprising this way and is a mobile saleswoman of legume products, especially the traditional avocado. 

Her work shifts are long, from 6am to 6pm. Luz Marina offers her products to passersby and has to deal with inclement weather. She tells us herself that winter is not good for business. Currently she needs a loan to stock her business, because on occasion she is not able to buy good merchandise and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her legume store

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is 36 years old and divorced. Her husband left her a few years ago. Now she lives with her brother in a small city called Mian Channu which is located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She spends her day in doing her daily routine work. Her brother is very supportive by nature and operates an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. 

Irshaad also helps him in his business by taking care of his cattle, providing them timely food and water. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her brother’s business. Using the loan, he will buy goats and sheep and sell at a good profit. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Susime

texts.en: Susime is a hard working entrepreneur who has a salt selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Susime earns more income from pig fattening. Susime has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Kiva's partner, NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future. She is now borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more salt for resale.

loans.use: To buy more salt to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Evelyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh farms and he has a car. In free time he engages in the service of providing a taxi. He is married and has four children. He mainly deals with cultivation of wheat, grapes and seedlings. Several times he received a loan from Imon International and he likes our services. He wants to continue cooperating with Imon International. Farrukh would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS for purchasing of mineral fertilizers and payment of workers. Farrukh wishes to expand his business and hopes that the lenders will support him.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay workers.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a farmer from a small village in Adigeni District, Smatskhe-Javakheti Region. She is 49 years old and lives with her two sons (29 and 27 years old) and her daughter-in-law. All family members are involved in running the family dairy farm, which is the only source of income for them. They have eight milk cows and produce approximately 240 kg cheese per month. Cheese is sold to local dairy products retailers. 

Lili requested credit for transportation of her livestock to the summer pasture in a family-owned farm in a mountainous part of the region and take them back to the village after three months. With the borrowed amount she will pay to truck them and also supply some food for her sons, who will stay in the mountain farm to take care of the livestock. After the summer months the livestock will be returned to the village. Their productivity will significantly increase during and after mountain pasturing, as a result of much more fertile grass in the mountains. During the summer months, Lili’s sons will produce cheese in their summer farm and sell it there to retailers, who have already agreed with the family on the purchase of the product. 

The increase in the cows’ productivity and sale of cheese will raise the income of the family. Lili plans to use the increase in the income to purchase additional milk cows.

loans.use: to pay for transportation of her livestock to and from their summer farm in the mountains.

loans.name: Kpanah

texts.en:
Kpanah is 37 years old and lives in Paynesville. She's married and her husband is a cleaner; they have three children between the ages of 11 and 18, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

Kpanah has had her business for five years and she sells a wide range of dried goods and foodstuffs from her home including rice, pasta, spices, salt and other foods. She was taught how to run the business by her auntie. Her main challenge is the high cost of the goods she has to buy. 

She's requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods

loans.name: Nabatbubu

texts.en:
Nabatbubu lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 47 years old, single and has four children. She works at the registration office in her local area. 

After the breakdown of the Soviet Union, in order to support her family, Nabatbubu began her business of cattle breeding and farming. She rented land near her village where her family started to cultivate potatoes and beans. In addition, she gained a good income from selling milk products at the local market. Thanks to her persistent work, Nabatbubu managed to expand her business and still is eager to develop her farm. For this reason, Nabatbubu plans to use the loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer to manure her land and one more heifer. With the revenue from this investment, Nabatbubu plans further development of her farm in order to make it a successful family business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Divina has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Divina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Divina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children.   Jenny works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running this store for 5 years and also earns an income from scrap iron.

Jenny requested a loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.   

Jenny aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 33-year-old, widowed mother of four children. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to add stocks of rice, sugar, and cooking fat to her shop.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes are to venture into a green grocery business which she believes will sustain her family.

loans.use: To add stocks of rice, sugar, and cooking fat to her shop.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 49 years old and a single mother of a 26 year old. 

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has operated the business for 11 years. She also sells second-hand clothes to earn extra income. Previously, she owned a grocery.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. Her desire is to grow her business into wholesale.  

She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Baby Ruth

texts.en:
This is Baby Ruth, 41, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Epifanio, a overseas contract worker. They have four children, two in college while the others are still in high school and elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Baby Ruth operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a Php 29,000 loan. She will use it to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as it expands. 

Baby Ruth hopes to renovate her house in the province and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer units, spare parts and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn, 40, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Edelyn provides a jeepney or multipurpose cab service, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the maintenance of her service.

Edelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the maintenance of her service.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 49-year-old woman with 2 children --  1 son and 1 daughter. She is divorced and lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City.

For 10 years Ngoc has been earning income to support her family by selling soft drinks from the front of her house.  Ngoc would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages and products to sell. She believes that this will help her increase the turnover of her business. 

Ngoc hopes that through this loan she will earn a higher income and be able to give her family members a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua makes millet porridge for sale at Abura. To prepare her porridge, she first gets her millet, removes unwanted particles from it, and washes it.  She adds local spices such as ginger and pepper to taste.  She sends the millet to the mill to be milled into powder.  After returning from the mill, she adds water to the resulting flour to make dough. She leaves it for a couple of hours before using the dough to make porridge.

She heats water to a boiling point and mixes the dough into the water to get a porridge-like consistency. She gradually pours the dough into the heated water stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Millet porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts. 

Ekua is married to a police officer and they are blessed with four children.  Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize and millet and spices to make porridge.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and millet and spices to make porridge.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 46 years old, married, and is the father of five children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. 

Rolando is asking for a loan amounting to P 15,000 to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his farm. Rolando is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yield. He sells his crops to the trader.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He acquired a loan and bought a motorcycle, which he uses to earn income. 

Salim wants a loan to repair his motorcycle. High fuel prices, seasonal weather, and stringent traffic rules are his major challenges. He desires to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Joyless

texts.en:
Joyless is a twenty three year old lady with five children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Her family goal is to educate her children. 

She has been running a retail business for three years. The challenges she is facing are high commodity prices and her dream is a wholesale shop. 

Joyless needs a loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ma.wildelina

texts.en:
Ma.Wildelina is 44-years-old and married with three children.

Ma.Wildelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Ma.Wildelina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Ma.Wildelina aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Vendors -B Group

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Maureen from Machipisa, a high-density suburb in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married and has one child who attends school.  Maureen runs a retail business selling fruits and vegetables.  Her business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge she faces is the unavailability of some produce due to seasonal changes. 

Maureen has requested a loan of $400 to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay rent on time.  In the future, Maureen plans to have a fresh produce shop in the city center.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos comestibles,ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes,ella vende arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y golosinas,ella vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y golosinas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes continues working in selling groceries.  She has a small grocery store, where she sells rice, sugar, milk, oil and sweets. Mercedes works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  Through this business, Mercedes is making progress.  Her dream is to have an expanded store.  Mercedes is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and candy at wholesale.

Mercedes is happy with the loan and agrees to comply with the payments of her quota.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and candy at wholesale.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old single woman. She is one of four brothers and sisters who are still living with their parents.
Alaa is studying in Al Yarmouk University majoring in airport management. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester's tuition fees so she is able to finish her studies and find a job in her field.

loans.use: to pay her semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El sr. Humberto tiene  27 años de edad,  no tiene padre ni madre;  ya que fue abandonado con su tía, quien se encargó de criarlo, actualmente viven en la misma casa que es una parte de  adobe,  un material delicado para las lluvias, razón por la que su vivienda se deterioró más en esta temporada de lluvias y fue esta razón por la cual el sr. Humberto  solicita un crédito para la refacción de su techo que se derrumbó, anteriormente también solicitó un préstamo para refaccionar el cuarto en el que habita, demostrando que es una persona responsable.
