Esta vez necesita para la parte del techo.  Él trabaja como guardia de seguridad en un barrio en el que lo requieren, por ser responsable y trabajador.
texts.en: Humberto is 27 years old and has no parents.  He was left with his aunt who accepted the responsibility of bringing him up.  They currently live in the same house which is partly made of adobe, a material which is susceptible to the effects of rain.  For this reason, his house suffered more damage during this rainy season and so Humberto is seeking a loan to repair the roof which collapsed.  He previously requested a loan to repair the room in which he lives, proving himself a responsible person.  This time he needs a loan for a part of his roof.  He works as a security guard in a district where he is sought after for his responsible and hardworking attitude.

loans.use: to repair his roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy new ladies clothes

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: 58 year old Elisapeta M. is a mother of eight from Faleula fou who has great talent in elei printing long before joining SPBD but because there was no way to finance a business, Elisapeta never made use of her talents until the programme financed it. Elei printing is a form of printing created and designed on fabric by using colour paints. The designs are usually traditional arts but are very much liked by tourists and used on wrap a rounds and sun dresses. Elei printing is the only source of income for the family which is why Elisapeta wants to expand her business to earn enough to develop the status of her family and help fund her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabrics

loans.name: Jesby Kairel

texts.en:
I have had this business for three years. I make and sell corn tamales and I also cook corn-on-the-cob, to which I add cheese or sour cream, however the customer requests. This business provides what I need to help with my children’s schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo 3 años de tener este negocio, yo me dedico hacer tamalitos de elote y cocinar elotes a los cuales les agrego queso o mantequilla, como lo pida el cliente. este degocio me da mis gastos para ayudar a los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: To buy corn-on-the-cob

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi X., 56 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Bich, have 2 perches of rice-field, 22 pigs, 100 chickens, 20 wild geese and a fish pond. Their children all work away from home. X. and Bich spend all of their time on their farm. Nights are the only time when they can take care of their 2 grandchildren. Although having to work hard, X. always believes that their efforts will bring good things to their lives. Now she is looking forward to borrow $450 to buy young fishes and food for her pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Làm 2 sào ruộng, nuôi 22 con lợn, 100 con gà, 20 con ngan cùng một ao cá là toàn bộ công việc mà chị Nguyễn Thị Xuể, 56 tuổi và chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Bích đang đảm nhận. Các con đi làm ăn xa, hai anh chị đầu tư tất cả thời gian cho trang trại của gia đình. Chỉ buổi tối mới là lúc hai anh chị kết thúc công việc để chăm sóc cho 2 cháu nội. Tuy làm việc vất vả nhưng chị Xuể luôn tin những công sức mà hai anh chị bỏ ra sẽ mang lại kết quả tương xứng. Hiện tại chị đang làm đơn xin vay 450 USD để mua cá giống cho ao cá của mình.

loans.use: buy young fishes and food for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Osatohamwen

texts.en: Osatohamwen O. is a member of LAPO's union and she is happy with her kind of business. She sells all kinds of drinks and fried meat in her restaurant and needs a small loan in the amount of US$ 400  to boost her business by buying more drinks and meat for resale. She is 40 years old and has 3 years' experience in her business. She also has four children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Her love for her little girl and the desire to bring her a better quality of life are why Nelly continues to work hard day after day. She patiently and affectionately cares for her calves so they grow up healthy and strong, and are able to produce large amounts of milk. Now in addition to caring for them to sell later on, she also devotes herself to making cheeses that she can sell in the market of her home city, Ayaviri. With this activity, she is able to satisfy herself economically. Seeing how much demand there is for her product, Nelly wishes to purchase another milk cow to increase her income and bring a better quality of life to her daughter. For this goal she is requesting a loan that will allow her to acquire a small cow that will quickly improve the economy of her household and bring well being to Sindy, her pride and joy and her only companion.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El amor que siente por su pequeña niña y el deseo de querer brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, son algunas de las razones que impulsan a Nelly ha seguir trabajando y esforzándose día a día en la labor de crianza de sus becerritos con mucho cariño y paciencia con el objetivo de que crezcan sanas y fuertes para que sigan produciendo excelente cantidad de leche.Ahora además de criarlos para posteriormente venderlos se dedica a la elaboración de quesos, productos que luego los ofrece en el mercado de su ciudad natal Ayaviri, trayéndola esta actividad mucha satisfacción económica.A poco tiempo de haber observado la gran demanda que tienen sus productos Nelly desea comprar otra vaquita lechera para así incrementar sus ingresos económicos con el objetivo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su niña.Para esto solicita un préstamo que le permitirá adquirir una pequeña vaquita para mejorar pronto la economía de su hogar y le brindará bienestar a Sindy quién es su mayor alegría y su única compañera.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to increase production of cheeses

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata S. is 40 years old, and a widow with 7 children. The only breadwinner for her family, she sells palm oil along with some other items on the veranda of her house. Previous loans have enabled Fatmata to expand her business and earn more income. With the income, she is able to provide her children with an education and meet other family expenses.

Fatmata told us she would like to educate her first child to college level so that he will later assist her with the other children's education needs. She is determined to expand her business and is requesting a further loan to enable her to do so.

loans.use: To expand her business by including additional items for sale

loans.name: Turdiev

texts.en:
Turdiev Z. lives in Nausky district, Tajikistan; he is married and has 5 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he has shown himself to be a serious and strongly-motivated client. The amount he has been allowed to borrow has continually increased and that shows the stability of his business.

Mr.Turdiev is engaged in food production (preparation of various pies and doughnuts, such as traditional pies named “cheburecky” and sambusa). He is very experienced in this business, having been in it for about 20 years.

Working in this business sector, he has to face stiff competition; that is why he wants to widen his existing business by adding new recipes to his offerings. This will allow him to increase the family income and to plan for new business development.

Mr.Turdiev is requesting a loan of US$ 825 for this purpose.

loans.use: for the further development of his baked goods business

loans.name: Isabel De La Concepc

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel A.'s destiny changed after she los the job that was able to sustain her three kids in the city of Chinandega. For this reason, she's been selling a wide variety of refreshing drinks from her home. She lives in the city of Chinandega.

One of her goals is to establish herself in the local market since the room in her house is not practical for this kind of business. Her house is far away from the main streets and its difficult for people to notice her business.

With CEPRODEL's financial support, she's been able to increase her business. This allows her to have a wide variety of beverages to offer and at the same time cover some of her home daily expenses. She's had a total of 25 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel A. por infortunios del destino pierde su empleo con el que mantenía a sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Por esta razón desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad de venta de refrescos variados en su casa de habitación den la ciudad de Chinandega.

Una de sus metas es establecerse en un local en el mercado ya que actualmente su casa de habitación no presta las condiciones por el hecho de que se encuentra alejada de las calles principales de esta ciudad.

Con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio, lo que le permite ofrecer mayor variedad de refrescos a sus clientes y de esta manera incide en los gastos del hogar. Su record crediticio es de 25 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits to make drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma was born in 1988 and she is married. She lives in Goražde with her husband and their one-year-old child.  Her husband  does seasonal work and he can earn  about US$ 400 monthly. They are doing agriculture  and Elma  will use this  second  loan in the amount of  US$ 975 to buy livestock. Her wish is to expand the number of sheep they raise and increase  monthly income for her family.

loans.use: For buying livestock

loans.name: Mtumwa's Hatuchoki Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa, age 48, is married and has three children (ages 24, 20 and 12). She runs a business of selling coconuts, sarongs, and bedsheets, and she sells these items from 7am to 4pm daily. From this business, which she started three years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $25.

Mtumwa is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to sell. She will share this loan with Fatmo, who is her fellow member in the Hatuchoki loan group. These members share the responsibility of paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of coconuts, sarongs, and bedsheets

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young man with the desire for self-improvement. For many years, he has been making bricks from home. He now wishes to start a new business working for himself raising small animals because he has noticed that this is a very lucrative activity in his city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Edwin, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ladrillos en su espacio familiar y ahora desea emprender un negocio de manera independiente criando animalitos menores ya que ha observado la rentabilidad de esta actividad dentro de su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital for starting a new business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the “Mujeres Valientes” (brave women) community bank, located in 123 Jr. Lima, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 60 years old and has 6 children, her husband is a laborer. Their income didn’t cover their family expenses and this is why Rosa received a loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos and invested in a business to sell groceries.

Currently, she owns a small general store. She gets up at 7 am prepares breakfast for her family and opens the store to service clients until 8 p.m.

With the $525 USD (S/. 1,500) loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, milk, oil, eggs, detergent, pasta etc.

Rosa is a lady that has lived long and has achieved great things to the benefit of her family, even though she counts with the support from her children, she wishes to work and obtain income from her own effort, she demonstrates this everyday by working at the general store. Her children are proud of her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Lima 296, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es obrero, pero los ingresos económicos no satisfacen sus gastos familiares, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y de ella, de allí abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro arroz, leche, aceite, huevo, detergentes, fideos, etc.

Rosa es una señora que ha vivido mucho y ha logrado grandes cosas para el beneficio de su familia, pero ella a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos desea trabajar y obtener sus ganancias con su propio esfuerzo que a diario se refleja al manejar su propio negocio de abarrotes, sus hijos están felices orgullosos de ella.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale products for general store.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina has been selling maize and beans in Arusha since 2006. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Her children are ages 13, 15, 17, 19, and 21. Working every day from 10:00am to 6:00pm, Paulina is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $60.

Paulina will use this loan to buy sacks of maize. The additional maize will increase her inventory and assist her in increasing her profit.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of maize as inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Blanca Nory

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.

Blanca es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Blanca viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales y luego D. acopiar venD. al por mayor a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en la época D. cosecha D. papa se dedica a realizar papa seca (sancochan la papa luego D. pelarlo lo hacen secar al sol, este producto se utiliza para preparar platos típicos D. la costa), la papa le adquiere D. los productores que le llevan a su casa, este producto lo envía a mercados D. la costa.

Blanca necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa por sacos. Blanca sueña con sacar profesionales a sus dos menores hijos, tener una tienda estable que no le genere mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Kusikuy Communal Bank (happiness in Quechua) Blanca is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children; she travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains. After her purchase she sells to wholesalers at different markets in the city of Ayacucho; during the potato harvest she makes “dried potatoes” (boiled and peeled potatoes that are then let to dry in the sun; these are then used to prepare food typical of the coastal areas); she acquires the potatoes from producers who bring them to her but also send their products to the coastal area. Blanca needs a loan of 1200 soles that she will invest in the purchase of potatoes by the sack. She dreams that her two young sons will become professionals and will have a stable store that generates income without much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blanca needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes by the sack.

loans.name: Tayta Espiritu Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Espíritu esta ubicado en la comunidad D. La Mejorada, distrito D. Mariscal Cáceres en Huancavelica.

Elsa C., se dedica al negocio D. venta D. verduras, se inició hace 10 años junto a su esposo, fue muy difícil porque tenían poco capital. Cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo los gastos eran mas grandes, Elsa usará su préstamo en incrementar su negocio.

Edeliza Q., se dedica a la venta D. ropa en las ferias D. Yauli, Ascoria e Izcuchaca, su esposo trabaja en la chacra, así solventa su hogar D. sus 7 hijos, ellos se iniciaron con poco capital, pues los bancos les pedían muchas cosas y era difícil solicitar un préstamo. Con el apoyo D. FINCA a comprado mercadería, ahora desea invertir porque se vienen las fiestas naviD.ñas y el negocio es bueno en esa época.

Ana Antonia, tiene una bodega, antes vendía hojas D. coca y gaseosas, ella desea con el préstamo incrementar su negocio para ayudar en los estudios D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Tayta Espíritu Communal Bank is located in the community of La Mejorada, district of Mariscal Cáceres in Huancavelica.

Elsa C. has a business selling vegetables. She started 10 years ago with her husband and it was very difficult because they had little capital. As her children were growing up the expenses were very big. Elsa will use her loan to grow her business.

Edeliza Q. works selling clothing in the markets of Yauli, Ascoria and Izcuchaca. Her husband works on a farm and that's how they support their home and seven children. They started with little capital because the banks required a lot from them and it was difficult to obtain a loan. With the support of FINCA to buy merchandise, they now wish to invest because Christmastime is coming and business is good that time of year.

Ana Antonia has a store. Before she sold coca leaves and soft drinks. She needs a loan to increase the size of her business to help fund her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 11 communal bank members will invest in their businesses in the community of La Mejorada

loans.name: Rosaana

texts.es:
Con tan sólo 10 meses en el negocio, casi el mismo tiempo que se hizo cargo de un kiosco en un colegio, la señora Rosaana, que también tiene ingresos de las habitaciones que alquila en su casa (de 3 pisos), no se da abasto para poder sustentar la educación de sus 4 hijos (2 en la Universidad y los otros en el colegio), por lo que constantemente se encuentra invirtiendo en sus 2 negocios. Con la ayuda de su esposo, se plantearon metas a largo plazo para con sus 4 hijos: convertir a sus hijos en los mejores profesionales ( es decir, financiar su educación primaria, secundaria y superior), por lo que el trabajo es arduo y les depara más que esfuerzo.

En pos de contar con más capital para adquirir los insumos necesarios para ambos negocios (lo que le permitiría reducir los egresos y subir los ingresos) es que necesita de 1300 soles de préstamo, considerando lo lideresa de su persona así como el ejemplo que les da a sus hijos al no declinar en su trabajo para poder brindarles la educación que merecen.
texts.en:
With only 10 months working this job and the same amount of time running a kiosk in a school, Ms. Rosaana (who also has income from the three rooms that she rents out in her house) does not have enough to sustain the education of her four children (two at university and the others in school) which is why she is constantly investing in two businesses. With the help of her husband, she has formed long-term goals for her four children: to make sure that they reach a good professional career (by financing their basic, secondary, and university level education), for which the labor is difficult and requires more than just effort. In pursuit of more capital for the purchase of materials for both businesses (which will allow Rosaana to lower her costs and increase her income) she needs this loan of 1300 soles. Considering the leadership she shows as an example for her children, she cannot turn down the work to give them the education they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for the production of sequins and to supply her small kiosk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La microempresaria Isabel C. Álvarez tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, con 6 hijos, 2 menores que estudian en nivel secundario y 4 adultos que viven en sus propias casas. Esta señora tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años cuando emigro de una zona rural de esta región en búsqueda de mejores alternativas para su familia. 

Este negocio le permite a la señora C. y a su marido poder sustentar el hogar dándoles estudios y otras necesidades mínimas a sus 2 hijos que viven con ellos.

Sin embargo necesita se le financie lo siguiente:

5 quintales de arroz americano el cual compra a US$ 59  cada quintal, 4 quintales de azúcar que compra a US$ 28 cada quintal, 2 quintales de frijoles a US$ 54 cada quintal, 6 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidón y 5 quintales de harina a US$ 32 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman Isabel C. Álvarez is 52 years old and is married with six children: the two youngest ones who are high school students and four adults who live in their own homes. This woman has owned a shop for more than twenty years when she emigrated from a rural area of this region looking for better alternatives for her family. This business allows Mrs. C. and her husband to support their home and give the two children who live with them an education and other small necessities. Nevertheless, they need to fund the following: 500 lbs. of American rice which costs US$ 59 per 100 lbs. 400 lbs. of sugar which costs US$ 28 per 100 lbs. 200 lbs. of beans at US$ 54 per 100 lbs. 6 drums of oil at US$ 25 per drum 500 lbs. of flour at US$ 32 per 100 lbs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 500 lbs of American rice, 400 lbs. of sugar,  200 lbs. of beans, 6 drums of oil, and 500 lbs. of flour.

loans.name: Kaneez Begum M. Murad Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Begum Baji is 34 a year old lady who resides in a shrine city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the past 20 years.  

Her husband's name is M. M., and he has a clothes selling business.  She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters.  Her elder son helps his father in the clothes selling business.  The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  

Kaneez Baji has a clothes sewing business.  She earns 1500 Pak Rupees per month, which she saves to pay her children’s school fees.  She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s clothes selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her community.  Shamim Baji and Naziran Baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes selling business. 
 
This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Atukuzwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Atukuzwe Mbanga is 33 years old and she is from Mwanza. She is married with one child, who is eight months old.

Atukuzwe has been running a tailoring business since 2007. She purchases vitambaa, vitenge, and kanga (all types of materials) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is assisted by one employee.

Atukuzwe currently earns about $200 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase additional materials for her business. In the future, she plans to open another business. Atukuzwe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase materials such as kanga and vitenge

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 40-years-old and is married with four children. He lives in Benin City where he uses a motorcycle to convey passengers from one location to another. He is requesting a loan amount of $350 (N50,000) to purchase one additional motorcycle to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola A. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions like noodles, butter, milk, etc. She requests the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie P. is a 32-year-old mother of six. Her husband Jason is a fisherman.  She buys and resells fish and raises chickens to help support the family. She applied for this loan to support her current fish vending business, and some of her loan will be used to buy fishing gear.  She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to apply for more loans in the future to supplement her new venture. She hopes to get a stall in the market to sell greater volumes of fish which would help to increase her income. She dreams of sending her children to a university.

loans.use: To grow her fish vending business and to buy fishing gear.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora  Edith es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” del sector Kajje de la comunidad Chucasuyo, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudio de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora del dicho Banco Comunal, tuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual pudo comprar ropa de adultos y bebes; este negocio le va bien, asimismo ella compra  su mercadería en los distritos de Desaguadero, Juliaca y los vende en la comunidad y en Ilave.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará prendas de vestir como chompas, camisas, medias, etc.  De esta manera pretende ayudar económicamente a su hijo.  Este crédito será pagado en 4 cuotas. 
La señora Edith desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hijo y comprarse una casa en Juliaca.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank, in the Kajje section of the community of Chucasuyo, district of Juliaca, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 29 years old, lives with her common-law husband, is the mother of 1 child and completed her secondary school studies. For the past 18 years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and is a founder of her communal bank. Her first loan was for S/. 300 new soles and with that she was able to buy clothing for adults and children. Her business is going well for her. She buys merchandise in the districts of Desaguadero and Juliaca and she sells it in her community. With this loan for S/. 500 new soles she will buy clothing such as sweaters, shirts, socks, etc. In this way she tries to support her son financially. The loan will be paid in 4 installments. Edith would like to keep working to help her son and to buy a house in Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, shirts and socks.

loans.name: Batmonh

texts.en:
Batmonh D. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangha, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Batmonh's three children are all high school students. Batmonh has a small business printing newspapers. He started his business in 2000 by printing just a few copies of a local paper with only 150,000 Mongolian Tugriks (about US $105).

His printing business is doing well, and now has capital that ranges between 400,000 to 500,000 tugriks (about US $280 - $350). He hopes to expand his printing business and would like to focus on his sales management. Batmonh requests a loan to purchase necessary raw materials such as paper and ink for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for printing

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalita B. is a bona fide resident of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She has been a regular member of Paglaum Coop since March 13, 2008. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

She is requesting a loan of Php5,000.00 for additional capital to expand her business, which is a sari-sari store. Rosalita wants to expand her business in the future to earn a bigger income, so she can increase her stock and customers. She hopes for her family that she will be able to complete her children's schooling.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua Y. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Akosua is a petty trader. She sells plantains and smoked fish. She sells on a table top at the market square. Akosua supplies the greater part of her merchandise to retailers and food vendors. She wants a loan to buy plantains in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Akosua has been in business for ten years. She aspires to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamoanga del Sur. She is 43 years old. Merlina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of children.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 25 años, es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana Maximiliana de 35 años, quien le ayuda en los negocios que realiza. A más de 5000 mil m.s.n.m. se encuentra la mina La Rinconada, la cual está ubicada en Ananea (Distrito de Juliaca), es aquí donde Eusebia tiene su negocio de venta de muñecos de peluche, el cual es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los enamorados que buscan regalar algo bonito a sus parejas, los muñecos que comercializa los trae desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero, las cuales por ser fronterizas, ofrecen una variedad más amplia. Eusebia es muy feliz cuando se entera que uno de sus muñecos fue bien recibido por la persona a quien se lo regalaron, ya que el pueblo donde trabaja es muy pequeño y se entera fácilmente de lo que sucede. Lleva 4 años en este negocio y cree que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso frió que hace en la mina, que muchas veces la enferma y no la deja trabajar con normalidad. Para un futuro cercano, anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Eusebia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no causar problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por los ánimos que le pone al trabajo en grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muñecos de peluche para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Eusebia, aged 25, is a very enthusiastic and hard-working young lady. She lives in a rented room with her sister Maximiliana, aged 35, who helps her in her business.

The La Rinconada mine, which is located in Ananea (district of Juliaca), is situated at over 5000 meters (16400 feet) above sea level. It is here that Eusebia owns a soft toys store. It is a very popular store, especially with lovers who look for a nice present to their sweetheart. Eusebia buys her toys in Tacna and Desaguadero, which are border cities and offer a wider range of products. She is very happy when she finds out that one of her soft toys was gladly received by the loved one, which she easily gets to know since her village is very small. She has been running this store for four years and the hardest is to endure the intense cold in the mine which often makes her sick and prevents her from working normally. Her greatest wish for the near future is to have a larger store in which she can provide a better service to her customers.

This is Eusebia’s fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she must pay her installments in time and not cause problems to the members of her community bank who love her team spirit. Eusebia will use her 2000 nuevos soles to buy more soft toys and increase the inventory in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre D. 03 hijo, 01 que esta estudiando y depenD. D. ella. 

Carmencita, una mujer trabajadora y luchadora decidió vender comida, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en un puesto que tiene al frente D. un Hospital D. su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es conocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores D. este centro D. salud y moradores.

Esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the Las Brisas Community Bank, which is in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 44, married, and has three children. One child goes to school and is still dependent upon her. Carmencita is a hardworking woman and a fighter. She decided to sell food in a well set up place, which is located in front of a hospital in her district. She has good daily sales. She is known for the good seasoning she gives her food. Her primary customers are the people who work in the health center and neighbors. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy supplies for daily food preparation like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, and some utensils. These items are to use in her business and to give better attention to her customers. She feels full of life and has the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start up of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Mrs. Patria C., 47 years of age, married but separated with her husband is a resident of P1 Sumirap, Tangub City. She had 2 children who are now in their high school years. Her live-in partner is a motorcycle driver with an average net income of not less than P200.00 a day. With the support of her live-in partner now a day, she was able to send her children at school. 
Presently, Mrs. Patria is engaged in sari-sari store business and a little rice retailing activity in their barangay. She started this kind of business since year 2002. Now, her business is still in stable condition and progressing in which she is earning an average net income of not less than P6,000.00 a month. For 1 year already, she maintains a good credit record in our cooperative and able to availed 2 cycles of loan. Now, she is applying an amount of P14,000.00 as her 3rd loan availment to add her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. 
Her only dream in life is to be able to give her children a better future from her hard works with the help of our Lord and through the financial assistance from our cooperative.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store business

location.town: Tangub-P1 Sumirap, Tangub City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años, vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Ella tiene 22 años de experiencia de dedicarse al comercio, actualmente vende ropa de manera ambulante en la feria comercial de su ciudad, todos los fines de semana. Las prendas que ofrece son de acuerdo a la temporada del año y a precios muy accesibles. En algunas ocasiones la acompañan sus hijos a su trabajo y la ayudan con la atención a los clientes. Para Maria, su negocio es gran disfrute, además, tiene habilidad para las ventas, por lo que mantiene su negocio con ganancias regulares. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y en su anterior su crédito demostró ser muy puntual en sus pagos, razón por la cual fue considerada para tener un nuevo. El dinero que solicita será destinado a la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her 6 children. She has 22 years of business experience selling clothing as a traveling merchant at the city’s trade fair every weekend. Maria offers her products based on the season and the prices are very affordable. Her children accompany her on occasion and help attend to the customers. For Maria, her business provides great enjoyment. She has excellent sales skills which has enabled her to maintain her business and generate a regular income.

This is Maria’s second loan with MFP. She demonstrated punctuality with the payments from her previous loan, so she was considered to receive another one. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de machine

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: D. Aline est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aline vit depuis près de trente quatre ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou. Mariée à ANIAMBOSSOU Luc un agent de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie, Aline a à sa charge cinq enfants dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Aline n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, mais tous ces cinq enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Aline vend depuis déjà 10 ans, des boissons (bières, sucreries de tous genre) ainsi que du riz et des tissus dans la buvette Marina à Cotonou. Aline achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aline a déjà eu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Aline voudrait satisfaire plus les besoins de sa clientèle, et subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle envisage acheter et construire plus tard une parcelle, grâce aux économies issus des produits vendus. C'est pourquoi, Aline s'est rapproché de ALIDé pour obtenir un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Aline D. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For nearly 34 years, she has lived in the Gbégamey district of Cotonou. Married to Luc Aniambossou, an agent for the Société Béninoise de Brasserie, Aline has five children, three of whom are her own. Aline never had the opportunity to go to school, but all five of the children are in school. The couple shares responsibility for the family's expenses. For 10 years, Aline has sold beverages (beer and soft drinks of all types) as well as rice and fabrics in the Marina refreshment area in Cotonou. Aline buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Aline has already received two loans that she repaid in full to Alidé. Aline would like to keep up with customer demand more and take care of her children's needs with no problems. Sometime in the future she would like to purchase and build on a plot of land with the money made from selling her products. This is why Aline has gone to Alidé for help in obtaining a third loan.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cases of beverages (beers, alcoholic beverages) and bags of rice

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Despite having a heart ailment, Aurea D., 48 years old and a widow, stays strong and courageous while facing challenges as a single parent to her daughter Kristine Joy. Her 14 year-old daughter is Aurea’s life and happiness. 

Imagining her dream of seeing her daughter graduate from college coming true through Aurea’s hard work and perseverance gives Aurea joy and contentment. 

To make her dream real, she is requesting a loan which will give her more opportunity to grow her business and enhance her profit. As the sole provider for her daughter Aurea has to make her business profitable and stable. Loans she can access through ASHI are her only hope in helping her and her daughter change their lives and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Most will be used to purchase cattle to fatten and sell and some will be used to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Milly Nalubega's Group

texts.en:
Milly is a 45-year-old single mother of seven children aged between 5 and 20 years. None of her children goes to school because she couldn’t come up with the school fees. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Milly takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water; they get three meals a day.

Milly incurs transport costs to and from Kiyembe. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Milly works seven days a week. She receives an average of 5 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of tailoring materials and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works from an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and medications.

Milly has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years, servicing her seventh loan. Milly joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a designing shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a rice farmer. She is 41 years old and has been married to her husband Ricardo for 29 years now. They have a seven-year-old child. Work at the farm is tedious, but Marilyn stays strong helping her husband tend their farm. She shared that her farm currently needs inputs. She applied for a loan from CEVI of PHP4,000. This loan will be used for farm inputs like fertilizer and others. This loan will also help Marilyn be active in their business life.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.en:
For the last 16 years, Esperanza del Socorro has worked selling electric household appliances, plastic bags, and sodas in the City of Leon. She is requesting a loan to buy capital for her store. She wants to buy appliances including TVs and refrigerators to sell. Esperanza works everyday from 4:00am to 6:00pm. Twice a week (or when clients demand is up more frequently) she buys goods for her store. Her store is located in the La Terminal Market.

Esperanza is single. She is responsible for taking care of one of her grandchildren. Before selling appliances, she sold aprons “ambulante”, which means while walking around the street with her goods. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 5 years. This is her 27th loan. The loans have helped her expand and improve the quality of her business, she said.

loans.use: To buy household appliances like TVs and refrigerators to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K., 37 and her husband, Mr. Kosal Oem, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh. Three attend school and the youngest stays at home. 


Mrs. Touch K. has been a silk weaver since she was 17 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. In the past he used to be a mason. Touch has previously asked for a loan from Kiva through Maxima. She now is requesting her second loan in the amount of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M. was born in 1949. She is a widow and the mother of three children. One of her children is married and started a new home. Meas M. has a son who is skilled in repairing mobile phones and currently he uses his knowledge to invest in a phone sale business, the proceeds from which helps provide food for the family.  Her son-in-law is a carpenter.

Meas M. owns a few machines that she uses to sew clothing for her villagers for money. She has a daughter who works with her in sewing clothing. Meas M. complains that she always faces difficulty with transportation because she has no vehicle for traveling purposes. She hopes to reduce this problem by looking for a loan from Kiva to buy an old motorcycle to use as transportation.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle to use as transportation.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Carmen, 35, is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Fe y Amor (Faith and Love), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Carmen and her husband have two children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are highly overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Carmen runs a successful “salchicha” (hot dog) stand. With this loan, she plans on purchasing more hot dogs, bread for buns, and a new stand to display the hot dogs and other sandwiches.

This is Carmen’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to expand her business and improve home life for her family. With her profits, she hopes to purchase a stove for her home and some shoes and books for her children. Carmen also hopes to add some fun around the house by purchasing a pet for her kids, while also teaching them about responsibility and ownership. Carmen has high hopes for her children, and with profits from her loans, she is confident that they will receive a great education and attain a step up in their lives.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Carmen and the Fe y Amor group!

loans.use: Hot dogs, bread, and a new hot dog stand

loans.name: Mahasa Kawarujju Bee Keepers, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en: T. Wilson, on the top left side of the photo, is the leader of this group. He is 47 years old and married with 12 children, most of them in secondary school. He also takes care of other dependents. Wilson has been involved in selling second-hand clothing in the town of Kawarujju for 4 years. He sells in periodic markets and his biggest challenge is traveling to his work stations. This is the first loan that Wilson is seeking from Pearl Microfinance/Kiva and he hopes to become a successful old businessman and have a stable family. He needs a loan to be able to buy more used clothing for resale so that he can earn more profit.

loans.use: buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Dorathy

texts.en:
Dorathy is a hardworking and honest woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children and she is 42 years old.

Dorathy sells foodstuffs and clothes at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business since, currently, her business income is not enough to meet all her family's needs. She wants to take a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and clothes to increase her business income.

Dorathy has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Odete Antonio

texts.pt:
Odete António M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 28 anos de idade casada e mae de 2 filhos de 9 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe, não continuou por motivos de doença prolongada. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca sai de Boane, depois do casamento ergueu sua residência junto com o marido no mesmo local onde vivem ate hoje. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt, a 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Ja teve empréstimos no Banco CCP mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através da dona Júlia Ernesto que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (roupa de crianças diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na construção da sua residência e continuar a desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Odete António was born in the Boane District, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 9 and 3 years old. The oldest is in school. She dropped out of school in the 5th grade due to a lingering illness. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. She has never left Boane. After she got married, she and her husband built the house where they now live. She has had her own business for over 10 years. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of 6,000,00 to 7,000,00mt which goes to household expenses and a traditional rotational savings account (Xitique). She has had loans with CCP Bank but decided not to continue due to numerous reasons. She came to know Hluvuku through Ms. Julia Ernesto, who is also a partner of the same institution. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, is her fourth. She intends to purchase assorted pieces of children's clothing to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 10.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt and 13.000.00mt and were all applied towards the same activity. She commits to paying this loan on time in order to be able to be granted other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to build her house and continue to develop her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of assorted pieces of children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs to sell

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath S. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Leang May, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice on to earn a living. Mrs. Sambath S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming. Aside from farming, Mr. Leang May is a fisherman who can earn only a small income to support his family. This couple has six children; four are students in the local school and also support their parents' farming while two other are too young to study or work. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en:
Dorothea A. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Dorothea owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dorothea has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Dorothea joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dorothea is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
María Natividad tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive en el caserío San José del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varios caseríos considerados como zonas rurales que distan mucho uno del otro. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral y ovejas en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un nivel adecuado de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para venderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos por lo que da siempre lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para criarlos y también con la compra de alimento balanceado para que se desarrollen rápida y correctamente. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer honesta, sencilla y con muchas ganas de trabajar por el bienestar de su hijo. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Natividad is 53 years old. She is a single mother, and she has one dependent child. She lives in the San José settlement in the Mórrope district. The district is comprised of various settlements, which are rural zones that are far from each other. It is part of the Lambayeque district, and it is one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising and selling small farm animals for over 15 years. She raises poultry and sheep in corrals that are close to her house. When the animals have grown enough she sells them to the business people who often visit the area to get animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo. This activity is her only source of income, and that is why she always gives her best to maintain her business. María wishes to expland her business by purchasing more animals to raise. She will also buy nutritionally balanced feed so that the animals develop rapidly and correctly. To achieve her goal she is asking, for the first time, Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 700 PEN. María is an honest and unassuming woman. She has a great deal of desire to work for the well being of her child. Her greatest aspiration is to provide him with the possibility of having a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Salceda

texts.en:
Salceda E., age 50, is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Salceda is widowed and has three adult-aged children. In the picture, Salceda is the one wearing a white blouse and a jacket. She is pictured with her driver. To make a living, Salceda provides motor transportation services. Salceda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Salceda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Salceda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Salceda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salceda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives with her three children, all of whom go to school. The third child is still very young.  She also takes care of her old parents.  She owns a small restaurant in Nakulabye's Kiyaye zone market, selling all types of food like local food, chips and chicken. She sells to all types of people both retail and wholesale.  

She wants to use this loan of 300,000 UGX to buy more food stuffs like bananas, rice, cassava, beef and charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years. Some of her customers are market vendors.  Justine works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season. When it rains it becomes difficult for her customers to reach her restaurant.  

Justine is dreaming of owning a fully stocked hotel. She joined MCDT because she wanted to get additional capital for her business.  She rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, cassava, beef and charcoal

loans.name: Larina

texts.en: Larina T. is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by engaging in a food-vending business. She lives in Purok Sto. Rosario, Barangay Nanunga, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, with her four children who are between 17 and 26 years old. Larina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 7,000. Larina is now borrowing Php 11,000 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her food-vending business. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Larina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Maria Leanie

texts.en:
Maria Leanie A. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 42 years old. Maria Leanie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Leanie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Maria Leanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Maria Leanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Leanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Maria Leanie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Maria Leanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 51 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to the local community. Flordeliza is just starting this business.

Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Edwin Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin Alberto M. G.  es trabajador activo de la  Empresa CEMEX de Nicaragua tiene  dos  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como utiliti, actualmente tiene tres niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción para reparar y ampliar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Edwin Alberto M. G. is an active employee of the Cemex Company of Nicaragua. He has been employed by this institution for two years as a utility worker. Edwin has three children who are in school. He has taken two previous loans with CEPRODEL which were used to buy construction materials needed to repair and expand his house. The loans have been a great benefit because they have allowed him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, stone, blocks, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair house roof

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila B. is a 34-year-old mother who sews and is married to Joel B., a fisherman. The are living on an island located in the middle of Laguna de Bay in the Philippines. Married at an early age, they now have five children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old, followed by the ages of 15, 12, 3 and 1 year old. 

According to her, raising their five children with a meager income is so difficult; that is why the couple agreed to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., (ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines, to have access in capital. Her first and second loans were utilized in buying raw materials for her sewing business and fishing gadgets for her husband to use in fishing, their primary source of income. With both earning income, their life started to improve. 

To further earn profit this time, she is applying for a loan of 20,000.00 pesos to finance a fish cage. She will buy rolls of fishnets, bamboo poles and fish fingerlings and pay for labor for the construction. She is hoping that this loan will be funded so that she can fulfill her dreams for her family, especially the schooling of their children, and earn more capital from the proceeds in order to expand their fishing business. She plans to invest in fish trading in the future. She prays that Kiva lenders will always support her goals until she reaches success.

loans.use: To buy materials for a fish cage: rolls of fishnet, bamboo poles and fingerlings and to pay for labor for the construction

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: Madame Mareme G. est une femme de 45 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et25ans. Depuis plus de plus de 25 ans elle exerce l’activité de commerce de tissus. Elle a fait ce choix parce que c’est une activité qui procure beaucoup de bénéfices. Aussi  en même temps elle est employée comme femme de ménage dans le projet  du programme de développement  de l’enfant et de la famille à  Diamalaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2006. Elle  sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises qu’elle va placer à ses clients. Son souci est d’accroitre ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Mareme G. is 45 years old. She lives in the township of Yoff. She is married and the mother of three, from 6 to 25 years of age. For more than 25 years she has been in business selling fabric. She selected this line of work because it is a profitable activity. In addition, she is employed as a housekeeper within the framework of a program for child and family support services in Diamalaye. She joined the Yoff mutual fund in February 2006. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 West African francs in order to purchase merchandise for reselling to clients. Her goal is to increase her revenues and to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Bolstering working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Francisco

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo G. es trabajador de ALCALDIA DE MANAGUA labora como responsable de servicios generales es casado tiene dos personas a su cargo solicita crédito para mejoras de vivienda, compra de hierro, piedrín, cemento. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su apoyo incondicional y apoyo para realizar su obra.
texts.en: Reynaldo G. is an employee of Alcaldia de Managua (Managua City Hall). He is responsible for general services. He is married and has two people in his care. He is requesting this loan for housing improvements, purchasing iron, gravel, and cement. He is grateful to Kiva partner Ceprodel for its unconditional support and help for carrying out his project.

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a thirty-seven-year-old married man. He has seven children and lives in a family house in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a retail shop for ten years that he started with 500,000 Uganda shillings of capital but increased to capital of 4,500,000 Uganda shillings. However, his hardships include low demand as a result of a sparsely populated area and increased costs of goods.

Ahmed wants credit to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy milk, flour, beans, butter, cheese, eggs, coffee, sugar, beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Nicolas De Tolentin

texts.es:
Don Nicolas  de 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y el mayor trabaja, su esposa lo apoya realizando los quehaceres del hogar y cuidando  de sus hijos, él trabaja como Guarda de seguiridad de  la Universidad desde hace 4 años siendo este su mayor fuente de ingresos, es una persona muy dedicada y esforzada esta pendiente de sus obligaciones mismas que asume con responsabilidad.  

Le agradece a Kiva por el apoyo recibido, ya que fue beneficiado anteriormente con un credito el cual lo cancelo en tiempo y forma, solicita su segundo crèdito, para repellar una habitaciòn y hecharle el piso a su vivienda para no perder el hilo de la construccion de la misma.   

Su mayor sueño en la vida es continuar mejorando su vivienda hasta llegar a concluirla, mantener estabilidad laboral y que su familia permanezca en buenos caminos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 52 years old and has 3 children who are all students and the oldest works; his wife helps him by taking care of their home and their kids.  He has worked as a security guard at the Uraccan for the last 4 years; this is his primary source of income.  He is a very dedicated person who works hard; he is very aware of his responsibilities and takes pride in fulfilling them.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support he is receiving through this loan; he was the beneficiary of a prior loan from Kiva which he paid back on time.  He is seeking his second loan to plaster the walls of his home and to put down a floor to finish parts of the interior.

His dream is to continue improving his home until he can finish it, to have stable employment, and to have his family follow the right paths in life.

loans.use: Plaster the walls of his home and put in a floor for the house

loans.name: 25 Thieu Duong Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hop D. T. (12) is a 26-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu D. Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Hop is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 25 Thieu D. Thieu Hoa (02.09.25 Thieu Hoa).


Hop is married and has one infant-aged child.  To make a living, Hop operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL..  Hop has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Hop joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hop is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Hop from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hop plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:



1.  T. T. Hoa (11) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Hoa (13) is a 26-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hop D. T. (12) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu D. Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Hop là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 25 (02.09.25).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hop thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hop kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hop đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hop đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Hoa (11) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Hoa (13) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Rosmy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosmy; La socia tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera; la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual ella misma lo administra y ella desea también paralelamente a esta actividad estudiar una carrera técnica, para lo cual pedirá que las horas que ella estudia su mamá la remplace en su abarrotes, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su tienda, ella comprara con el crédito arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, entre otros productos básicos como leche, aceite. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y comprar productos básicos.
