La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosmy is a member of the "Ahorro es Progreso Choquetata-Tipon" (Saving Is Progress Choquetata-Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosmy is 24 years old and single.  She has a small grocery store which she runs herself and she would also like, in parallel with this business activity, to study for a technical degree.  She will ask her mom to replace her in the grocery store during the hours that she is studying.

Rosmy is requesting this loan to invest in her store.  She will use it to buy rice, sugar, noodles, flour and other basic products such as milk and oil.  She is requesting this loan to keep her store running and to buy basic products.

Rosmy is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her business running and to buy basic products

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen P. D. B. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad. María es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a la comercialización D. ropa para mujeres como: pantalones, chumpas, camisetas y faldas, el negocio se encuentra en su casa D. habitación y es bastante estable. María solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, así D. esta manera hacer crecer su venta y al mismo tiempo obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María Del Carmen P. D. B. is 30 years old and lives in Mejicanos, in the San Salvador department, along with her husband and three young children.  She is a very responsible and hard working mother who sells women’s clothing, sweaters, t-shirts, and skirts.  Her business is stable and she runs her business out of her home.  María is requesting this loan through Integral so she can buy clothing in quantity and be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra P. tiene ya mas de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, está es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Está solicitando un préstamo para liquidar el pago de un pedido que realizo ya que los clientes que le encargaron el producto ya no le quisieron pagar, y ella tiene que solventar el pago si no le cancelan el crédito. Para la señora Alejandro es importante conservar su contrato con la compañía de belleza solo con ese ingreso cuenta para salir a delante con su familia. 
Espero contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que el anterior puedo compra la mercancía que necesita para entregarles a sus clientas lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Señora Alejandra P. has already spent four years selling beauty products from a catalog. She uses the income from this business to support her family.

Alejandra is seeking a loan to pay for an order that her customers asked her for but do not now wish to pay for the product. If she does not pay for it, the company will refuse to give her credit. It is important to Alejandra to maintain her contract with the beauty products company as without this income she will not be able to get ahead.

She hopes for our cooperation in obtaining this loan so that, as she did in the past, she can buy the merchandise that she needs for her customers as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Mauricio vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz,actualmente está casado y tiene un hijo. Mauricio trabaja como currier. el préstamo será utilizado para la compra de un monitor LCD.
texts.en: Mauricio lives with his parents in the community of Alto Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has one son. Mauricio works as a courier. The loan will be used to purchase an LCD computer monitor.

loans.use: To purchase an LCD computer monitor.

loans.name: You's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members who hope that their portions will help increase their income to improve their families' standard of living. Mr. You, born in 1943, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mr. You and his wife are farmers who own a 1.30-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. In order to support this activity, Mr. You would like to ask for a loan to buy more seeds for cultivating rice. Aside from farming, they also earn a living by making and selling Chinese noodles and Mr. You would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice to increase production. He is also a village chief who is able to earn a small amount of income to help support his family. The couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy seeds for cultivating rice

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 59 years-old, she has seven children who are between the ages of 17-25 years-old. She owns a restaurant and sells beer and she has been doing this business for 17 years. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business and with the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to reinvest in her restaurant and beer business.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Elizabeth C. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.
Reyna es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.
Reyna cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja en una llantera.
doña Reyna se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para elaborar sus ricas tortillas. 
sus tiempos libres lo dedica  a la iglesia. 
juntos con su esposo trabajan duro para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 40 years old, lives in Las Arenas in the city of Choluteca and works making and selling tortillas. She runs her business from home. 

Reyna is the mother of three children, who study in the town’s public school. Reyna depends on her husbnad to take care of household expenses. Her husband works in a tire shop.

Reyna gets up at 4:00 in the morning every day to prepare her tortillas. She devotes her free time to church. Together, with her husband, she works hard to give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wood, lime, water and corn

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s timber selling business. Gas is not available in his area and people approach him to buy wood from him for cooking food. Using the loan, he will buy timber in bulk quantity which will help him to fulfill the timely needs of his customers and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Mussarat is confident that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business. 

Mussarat is a housewife but she also operates a decorative embroidery business for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful at her work and receives a good number of orders every month which helps her to pay the utilities. She is the mother of four children. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business while her daughter is doing a nursing course. Her remaining 2 children are getting their education from a local school. 

Mussarat is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in every loan year.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Det

texts.en:
Det S. has been a farmer for a long-time. She uses her own farmland to plant a rice crop as an annual activity. She can generate an income of around $2.50 each day from her crop-growing business. In order to help support Det S., her husband works as a driver making a profit of approximately  US$3 a day.  Det S. has three children, two of whom also work as drivers for a private company while the other is a  student and a dependent. 

Det S. has been paying money for taxis because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a 23-year-old married mother of one child, works very hard to provide for her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, a business she has had for two years. She sells a variety of items such as diapers, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Melanie has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store, and in the future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store such as diapers, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Triphonie

texts.en:
Triphonie, who is 37 years old, has four children ranging in age from 4-16 years old. With her husband, Triphonie owns a business selling a variety of items commonly used at home including salt, matches, sugar, etc. Operating this business since 1998 has enabled her to educate her children and feed her family.

She is now requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle which will enable her to transport her goods from the shop where she buys items to her own shop. She plans to save all the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her in her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 33-year-old single man from Saida. He has worked as a tailor since 2008 with 4 years of experience. Hussein is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the third time in order to buy the necessary tools for his business, and to continue pasting tiles and finishing all the sanitary items in his house.

Hussein's previous loans were effective as they let him help his brother do the necessary maintenance to his house so it would be a healthy place for living.

He's a borrower in good-standing and liked by most of his clients. His work is clean and professionA.. He specializes in women clothes.

He loves his business a lot and hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been farming for five years in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. He is age 33 and married with three children, two of whom are already in school. His farm has been producing milk and maize which he sells at the local market. However, Joel is disappointed with low market prices for farm produce and common animal diseases.

Joel has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase poultry birds. He says the venture has high turnover and will provide his family with basic needs, especially education, and act as a supplement for their normal needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Namasuba Women's Development Initiative Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Fatumah has been selling electronic goods for five years now in Kampala. The single mother of one says she began this business under the financial auspices of her close friends and relatives. 

At her shop, she sells a variety of electronic goods such as kettles, DVD players, iron boxes, bulbs, etc. She says this business generates her sales revenue totaling 50,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. She says she is to utilize this Kiva loan money to purchase more electronic goods such as electric kettles, bulbs, iron boxes, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic goods such as electric kettles, bulbs, iron boxes, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru:
Гульзат 38 лет. Совместно с супругом Намазбеком растят троих детей. В 2004 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле мясом, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS).  Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гульзат имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 6,000-7,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли начать постройку большого дома для своей семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гульзат обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 30 голов овец и коз.  Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в завершение стройки и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих детей. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 38 years old. She and her husband, Namazbekom, are raising three children. In 2004, the couple started a business in the meat trade, using 10,000 soms (KGS) as seed capital. Because she was able to develop her business and find regular customers, Gulzat now has average income of 6,000-7,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to the hard work they put into their business, the couple were able to begin construction on a large house for the family.

In order to further improve and expand her business, Gulzat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy thirty head of sheep and goats. With income from the loan, Gulzat plans to complete construction on her house and save money for university tuition for her children.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
With her patience and determination, Angelita strives hard to generate income and support the education of her five children. She doesn't want to laze at home. Together with her husband, she plants and harvests rice twice a year. They usually sell it to local traders in the village. They have been doing this for almost 20 years. 

Last harvest season, in May, she earned P30,000. According to her, the amount of profit she earned was not enough to cover all their expenses. But she was still thankful for all the blessings she received. For the next planting season, the couple needs additional laborers to help till, sow, pull and transplant the rice crop in the field. This is an additional expense for them. But they need to hire the help because they cannot do all this work themselves.

Angelita is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pay for farm laborers. With the help of this loan, she believes she would achieve an abundant harvest and earn constant profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for farm laborers for land preparation and harvesting.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old and married to Waigera. She has been running an M-pesa (PHONE MONEY TRANSFER) shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 8,500, which she uses to support her family members.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ruth will use the loan to renovate the M-pesa shop (PHONE MONEY TRANSFER). 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and be prosperous.

loans.use: To renovate her Mpesa shop( PHONE MONEY TRANSFER)

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 53 years old and lives with her son and husband in a two-room apartment in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is currently in South Korea, visiting their eldest son. She started her business, a tailor and fashion salon, about 4 years ago. Beforehand she used to work at the Mongolian Fashion Palace as a designer. She has many years of experience. 

Bayarmaa is a diligent and hard working woman who says "Although I had good work as a designer at Fashion Palace, it was my dream to have my own business and start it. But now, I have many regular clients who come here often to receive my service. I am glad I did it." She receives uniform orders from Nachin Zaan, non-bank financial institution. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sewing materials and cloth for the uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and cloth.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Aida has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages .
Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 27 years old, is a garment factory worker and earns $2.50 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok (motorcycle) driver who earns $10 per day. This couple lives with their parents and they have no children yet. Every month, she has to spend $64 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on house rental fees in Phnom Penh where she work, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. Her husband plans to buy a new Tok Tok after finishing this loan because his current Tok Tok is old and can’t make good income. Her parent gave the house that they live together in the province to Phally, so she plans to repair her parent's house to be bigger than it is now.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is very supportive and sells clothes to financially support her husband. She started her business many years ago. She makes good profits from her business which allows her to pay off the utilities and  better manage her household expenses. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. She is the mother of 8 children: 7 of them are studying, while the remaining one is working. 

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her clothes business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety that will allow her to make more profits for her family.  She is very confident about the success of her business after the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and none of her children goes to school. She has two additional family members (a daughter with her child). She sells second-hand clothes on a retail basis. She sells her products at the market. 

Madina has been in business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. Her other source of income is a little restaurant. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals are to see her business grow big and start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land to build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Robert Michael

texts.en:
Robert Michael 28 years old and single. He is from Mabini Extention, Carmen annex Ozamiz city. To make a living, Robert Micheal owns and operates a  computer services business. His main source of income comes from his computer services. Robert Micheal has been in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 to 15,000 PHP a month.

Robert Micheal joined in GDMPC to gain financial services to help improve his living situation and have a successful business in computer services. Robert Micheal is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to support and improve his computer business. This will be first loan taken by Robert Micheal from GDMPC. He plans to also use his loan to improve his general living.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most impressive cooperative in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the province of Zamboanga del zur, Lanao del norte and Misamis occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of the farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*note: To maximize efficiency and reduce cost, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation of Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support and improve his computer service business.

location.town: Mabini Extention, Carmen annex Ozamiz city

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is 26 years old and married. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Sreytoch and her husband are farmers. They also raise pigs and water buffaloes. 

Sreytoch is requesting her first loan from KREDIT for $1,000 to purchase cows and buffaloes to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate additional income.

loans.use: to cows cows and buffaloes to sell

loans.name: Men

texts.en: From Kompong Speu province, Mrs. Men, a married woman and the mother of 5 children, is a hardworking farmer. Her husband is also in the same business. They grow rice crops for their livelihood and are able to earn approximately $ 2.50 per day. Because of the low income, 4 of her children have quit studying and have started working to help support the family's living conditions. Three of her daughters work in a garment factory as sewing staff, while her son is basket weaver. As shown in the picture, Mrs. Men house is being rebuilt again because their old home area is hard to leave. Therefore, she would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy necessary building materials to complete the reconstruction. She is very grateful for the support from lenders. She hopes that this new house will provide her family with a comfortable living space.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to complete the reconstruction of her home.

loans.name: Fasodeme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe FASODEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans, et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ADIARA, la seule assise,  fait le commerce de savons dans ce groupe de femmes FASODEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  une dizaine de cartons de savons (toilette et traditionnels pour le linge – la vaisselle). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso chez les grossistes. Elle les revend au marché de Ouayerma de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the Fasodeme group are married women who are on average 34 years old with three children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.

They are on their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking  to meet the needs of their customers.
Adiara, the only woman sitting, is active as a soap trader in the Fasodeme group.

She intends to use the loan to buy a dozen cartons of soap (both beauty and traditional for clothes and dish-washing). She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the general market in Sikasso. She retails them for cash at the Ouayerma market, as an itinerant vendor and from her home to both women and men customers.

She expects average monthly profits to attain 17,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and interest, and the rest put into savings. She aims to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Buy soap

loans.name: Marouba

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme qui vit avec sa femme et son fils agé de quatre ans.Il tient une cantine de vente de matériel informatique et d'accéssoirs de téléphoniques depuis trois ans.Auparavant, il a été carreleur mais suite à une longue maladie qui lui a valu deux opérations, il a été obligé de changer de travail.Aujour d'hui, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 1 unité central et des accéssoirs de téléphone. Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en: This lender is a man living with his wife and four year old son. He has had a business selling IT products and telephone accessories for three years.  Previously, he was a tiler; however he was obliged to change careers following a long illness and two operations. Today, he is seeking a loan of 200,000f to purchase a central switchboard and telephone accessories. His ambition is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a central switchboard and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 66 años, es muy trabajadora y muy responsable en las actividades que realiza. Carmen es soltera y vive con su único hijo en Pelileo que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Ambato en la Provincia de Tungurahua.

Carmen trabaja con su hijo en el cultivo de tomates, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para poder sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Ya son casi 7 años que trabaja con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicita es para la compra de abonos, fungicidas debido a que por el mal clima los cultivos pueden dañarse y con esta inversión ayudará a que los tomates esten en buenas condiciones y sean de buena calidad y puedan venderse en el mercado. carmen con esta inversión obtendrá buenas ventas e ingresos que ayudarán a sustentar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carmen sueña en comprar otro terreno para poder sembrar más y poder ser una microdistribuidora.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 66-year-old woman who is hardworking and very responsible in the work she does.  Carmen is single and lives with her only child in Pelileo, which is 20 minutes from Ambato in the province of Tungurahua.

Carmen works with her son growing tomatoes because this business is the only source of income they have to be able to pay their household expenses.  She has been working with FODEMI for almost seven years.  The current loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer and fungicide because of the bad climate that can harm the crops.  This investment will help the tomatoes be in good condition and of good quality, so they can be sold in the market.  With this investment Carmen will get good sales and income, which will help her pay for her household expenses and improve her quality of life.

Carmen dreams about buying another plot of land to be able to plant more and be able to be a micro-distributor.

loans.use: to buy fungicide and fertilizer because the bad climate can damage the crops and cause loss.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea is a local farmer as is her husband. She has been in the agricultural business for many years. She lives and works in Prey Chor district, where she was born. She has six children: five are single and one is already married. One of her children now works as a garment worker in Phnom Penh city to help the family. The other children have quit studying and are unemployed. However, they always help Kea with the farm. Kea doesn’t own any animals for agribusiness yet, so she wants to acquire some funds from Kiva lenders to purchase a cow. Kea hopes that she’ll be able to improve her business gradually.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is married with 46 children. Diosdada is 46 years old and lives in Lawagan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Diosdada grows pigs to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feeds.
Diosdada has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Diosdada hopes to add more pigs to grow.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Tushirkiyane Group

texts.fr:
Ange fait partie du groupe  Tushirikiyane et  habite à  Buja. Elle a 27 ans et est marié à Hassan, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 6 à 10 ans, tous  étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge son frère  qui étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  mèches   depuis  20 ans. 

Elle  est à son huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de mèches  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Ange is part of the group Tushirikiyane and lives in Gitega. She is 26 years old and married to Mécanicien, a merchant. Together they have two children, both students.

Ange has been doing commerce in hair extensions for fifteen years. 

She is on her 7th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of hair extensions to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de mèches  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Es una señora alegre, sonriente y emprendedora, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 10 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Desde hace más de 2 décadas trabaja en su pequeño taller de costura, de esta manera obtiene sus propios ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales para su negocio de corte y confección: telas para la elaboración de uniformes y togas, particularmente en esta etapa de graduaciones, hilo, aguja, entre otros productos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejorar las condiciones de su local.

loans.use: para comprar materiales para su negocio de corte y confección: telas para la elaboración de uniformes y togas

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina V. is 33 years old. She is married and has a kid. Her husband works as a driver.

Evelina has worked as an expert in the Bureau of Labour in Vratza for 6 years but because of reduce of establishment she has lost her job. Evelina V. borrowed some money and opened a little shop for washing materials. At the beginning she used her profit to reinvest and to have a wide range of goods.

Now she wants to supply some cosmetics and needs an $ 850 loan.

loans.use: To supply some cosmetics

loans.name: Ausage

texts.en: Now most people have no time to cook home made food and are up and about looking for fast food. There is no place further to look than Ausage’s stall in the marketplace where most of us go for an affordable meal. Her loan from SPBD helped in improving her business in terms of buying cooking utensils, supplying the ingredients for the different dishes like fresh fish, mutton flaps and other meat products. Ausage earns one hundred and fifty tala per day. She is assisted by her husband so there is no need to hire extra workers as they can manage on there own but they also manage money wisely in minimizing expenses.

loans.use: To purchase stove, pots, plates, mutton flaps, turkey tail, chicken, banana, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Nageba

texts.en: Nageba lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor. She lives with all the members of her family and she wants to increase her business. She took her 3rd cycle of group loan and bought all the materials for tailoring and now she wants to take anther loan to buy 2 or 3 new machines for her students to make a good business. She is trying to be a good business dealer in the future.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung's husband died in an accident in May 2006 and left the family owing $821.50 in hospital bills. Trung had to sell their house to pay her debts. Now she and her children live in a rented house with 300 "green dragon" (fruit) plants. They must pay $187.50 per year.

Trung also works as a day laborer and sells something out of their home to pay her children’s school fees; they are in 8th and 5th class. She wants to borrow $ 75 to invest in the "green dragon" plants so that she will get more profit from them. She is sure she can repay this loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: improve her yield from her "Green Dragon" fruit plants

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 48 years old, she is married and has two children. She sells and buys recyclables since more than 15 years ago. Thanks to this job and to the help of her husband she could raise and educate her children, as well as improve her home with basic commodities. Francisca, comments that this job of buying and selling recyclables is very complex because one needs to be a quick assessor; when her neighbors come and sell her the products she needs to value and quote on the spot. Francisca and her husband are hard-working dynamic people. They are early risers, they start their working day very early, because of this they sell their products in the main recycling plants of the city. The previous loans that she got from Fundacion Paraguaya were invested in the purchase of a scale and for the enlargement of the floor in her backyard to store the products. Now, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more recyclables such as irons, plastics, and cartons.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 48 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la actividad de vender y comprar artículos reciclables hace más de 15 años y gracias a éste trabajo y con la ayuda de su marido pudo mantener y educar a sus hijos, como así también pudo dotar las comodidades mínimas a su casa. Francisca, comenta que éste oficio de comprar y vender éstos artículos es muy complejo ya que uno debe ser un tasador veloz, porque los vecinos de la zona se acercan a su domicilio a ofrecerle los artículos y en el momento debe cotizar y pagar por la compra. Tanto, Francisca, como su marido, son personas trabajadoras y muy dinámicas, ya que se levantan a muy tempranas horas para iniciar su jornada laboral, debido a que estos productos ellos los venden a las principales fábricas de la ciudad. Los préstamos que obtuvo anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya los ha invertido en la compra de una báscula, y también en la ampliación del piso de su patio para almacenar sus mercaderías. Ahora solicita un préstamo nuevo que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para reciclar como hierros, plásticos, cartones, etc.

loans.use: compra de materiales para reciclar como hierros, plásticos, cartones, etc.

loans.name: César

texts.en:
César C., 32, owns a mobile stand selling hammocks and decorative blankets. He is married and has two young children who currently attend grade school.

Mr. C. has been working since he was very young. When he was about 9 years old he began selling bedding that he and his mother had made. At a little more than 10 years old Mr. C. decided to begin selling on his own. He sells his crafts to the towns of Areguá, Luque and Limpio from his motorcycle. Thanks to this work he has been able to obtain a modest house, some conveniences for his home and provide for his family.

He has asked for a loan to buy more crafts that are the primary source of income for his family. With the approaching holiday season he has had an increase in orders for hammocks, throws and other bedding.

loans.use: To buy more crafts items

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang D. has been operating a kiosk since 15 years ago. She sells various daily needs, from staple foods, school supplies and household goods. She needs quite a large fund to operate her kiosk. Since joining DINARI, Ni Komang D. obtained training and possible loan facilities to increase her inventory and offerings. Ni Komang D. opens her kiosk at 6 am and closes at 9pm each day. Besides operating her kiosk, Ni Komang D. goes to the market to buy goods to be resold every three days. Sometimes she gets her goods from roaming salespeople. Currently Ni Komang D. lives with her husband and 2 children who is already in the workforce and enrolled in high school. Her kiosk sales is about $11 to $22 per day with $3.30 to $5.50 profit per day. With this earnings, Ni Komang D. supports her husband, Made Anggrawiana and her two children.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang D. menekuni usaha warung sejak 15 tahun yang lalu. Barang yang dijual bermacam-macam mulai dari bahan makanan pokok , keperluan alat- alat sekolah dan alat- alat keperluan rumah tangga. Modal yang yang diperlukan memang tidak sedikit untuk melengkapi keperluan usaha warungnya. Semenjak bergabung dengan DINARI , Ni Komang D. mendapat pembinaan dan mendapat kepercayaan sehingga memperoleh pinjaman dana, sehingga dapat melengkapi keperluan usaha warungnya yang beberapa lalu belum terpenuhi. Ni Komang D. membuka warungnya pada pukul 06.00 wita dan ditutup pukul 21.00 wita. Selain menunggui warung, Ni Komang D. juga dapat mengerjakan pekerjaan dirumahnya sebab warung terletak didepan rumahnya.Untuk melengkapi warungnya Ni Komang D. setiap tiga hari sekali berbelanja di dipasar, selain itu juga ada beberapa barang yang selalu diantar oleh sales keliling. Saat ini komang Dami tinggal bersama suami dan kedua orang anaknya yang sudah bekerja dan sekolah pada tingkat atas. Total pendapatan yang diperoleh dalam sehari mencapi Rp.100.000,- sampai dengan Rp.200.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih yang diperolehRp.30.000,-sampai Rp.50.000,- dengan keuntungan inilah Ni Komang D. mencukupi keperluan sehari-harinya bersama dengan suaminya, Made Anggrawiana dan kedua anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase additional Inventory

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda M. is single and a mother of 3 children. She makes 'saltenas' (Bolivian sweet meat pastries) with the help of her older son who helped her buy 2 industrial ovens which they use to the fullest to keep up with demand.

Ayda has been doing this for the past 20 years. She learned this trade from her husband whom she met when she was just a little girl and used to only sell 'saltenas'. She now has passed on the trade to her older son.

At this time, Ayda is owner along with her son of the 2 industrial ovens which they use to make 'saltenas'. They also own 4 small and mobile ovens which they distribute along the areas of El Alto.

Her older son is currently going to college and is almost done. His major is in systems engineering. This is Ayda's major reason as to why she needs a loan so that she can help her son with tuition and to invest into their business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ayda M., soltera y madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas, oficio que realiza con su hijo mayor, quien la incentivó para la adquisición de dos hornos industriales, con los cuales pueden hacer frente a la demanda existente. Ayda se dedica a este rubro hace más de 20 años, cuando ella era pequeña y era solo vendedora. En uno de esos puestos conoció al que fue su esposo, quien le enseño el oficio y ahora ella lo ha transmitido a su hijo mayor. Actualmente Ayda es dueña, conjuntamente con su hijo de dos hornos industriales para el horneado de salteñas, y de cuatro hornos móviles y pequeños, los cuales los distribuye en los más concurridos barrios de la ceja de El Alto. Su hijo mayor, el soporte de su negocio esta cursando los últimos cursos de la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas, motivo por el cual Ayda precisa de dinero para poder colaborar a su hijo con sus estudios, y al mismo tiempo reforzar la inversión en insumos para su negocio.

loans.use: To invest into business and to help pay for college tuition

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
E. Muhabbat is 39 years old. She is married with two children that are currently in school.

For the last 9 years, Muhabat has sold jewelry in the local market. She started her business having only 300.00 dollars from a loan. Gradually, her business expanded and currently Muhabbat has earned 3000.00 dollars from work. Muhabbat has sold jewelry of the oriental style. The national earrings, rings and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. Every woman has at least one set of jewelry probably inherited from her grandmother. Muhabbat has a lot of clients and her business is rather successful and generates the stable income for the family.

Today, Muhabbat requests 700.00 dollars for the 4 month term. She is going to purchase new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods for selling. Being the client of IMON for several years already, Muhabbat has demonstrated herself as an accurate and reliable client. She thanks you for all your support and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Niaz Din

texts.en: Niaz Din lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of two sons. He has a shop where he sells construction supplies. He has been in this business for 5 years. His two sons are working part-time In the shop. He needs to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to buy more supplies of construction to attract more customers to expand in his business. He needs to make a good income to help his family. He is happy that he can develop his business with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy hardware inventory for re-sale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an experienced, hard-working entrepreneur from Melitopol, Ukraine. For the past nine years, she has operated a small grocery sales business. She currently sells a variety of canned foods and dry goods from a little space at a market near the bus station in Melitopol. Tatyana is married and has two children. In addition to taking care of her family, she also helps care for her elderly parents.

Tatyana has requested a six-month loan to give her additional working capital so she can purchase more inventory for her business. Tatyana has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, repaying all previous loans with no delays. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her in operating a successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital so as to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kessy's Group

texts.en:
Kessy E., age 39, is married with 4 children (ages 20, 18, 13 and 4). She sells rice, a business she started five years ago. She buys rice from upcountry and brings it to Dar es Salaam for selling. She travels twice a month and is able to make a monthly profit of around $488.

In the past, Kessy has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay her children’s school fees. She hopes for a new loan to hire a go down (warehouse) for the storage of her rice. Kessy will share this loan with her subgroup members who sell meat, clothes, soft drinks, charcoal, and retail goods.

In the picture, Kessy is the first person standing on the right.

loans.use: To hire a go down (warehouse) for storing rice

loans.name: Mara

texts.es:
Mara is very happy and satisfied to have taken-on independently her own business selling fruits, with which she can offer her two children everything necessary for their development. Her constant efforts have improved the conditions of suppland demand and now that the dreams of her darling children are expanding and changing she needs to redouble her efforts. It is for this reason that requesting the loan is so important.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mara, está muy contenta y satisfecha de emprender independientemente su propio negocio de venta de frutas con el que puede ofrecer a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su completo desarrollo. Su continuo esfuerzo ha mejorado sus condiciones de oferta y demanda y ahora que los sueños de sus amados hijos experimentan un amplio cambio necesita doblegar este esfuerzo. Por ese motivo tan importante solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital injection in order to continue offering her bargains.

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Mr. Rady V. is a villager in Kraing Svay Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is currently a government officer who gets only a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chhanny Sem, is a subsistence farmer. They have five children, all of whom are attending the local school.

Although the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. Therefore, Mr. Rady V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow in order to start another business in cow breeding. Last year, one of his children got dengue fever so Mr. Rady V. spent $125 to cure him. Because of this disease, Mr. Rady V. cannot afford a cow on his own. Mr. Rady V. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To start another business in cow breeding.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Okokhuo, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She plants corn on her farmland. After harvesting, she sells the corn to people in her community. She says she makes a lot of profit from the sales. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to clear her farmland. She says thank you.

loans.use: For clearing her farmland

loans.name: Gaby Luz

texts.es:
Gaby is 46 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. She works on agriculture since she was a kid, now is a mother and supports her home and keeps on working on cattle raising, she raises pigs, sheep and cuyes to sell their meat later on, she provides meat to grocery stores around her region, she feeds her animals with pasture and alfalfa that she cultivates (in the photo), so she saves on food which allows her to obtain the necessary profit, not long ago with the profit obtain from the sales of meat she was able to sow another field of alfalfa and keep on working. Gaby wants peace for her family and wants to improve her children’s life. With the loan she will buy 3 sheep to feed them and improve her farmyard.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Gaby tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde su niñez, ahora es madre de familia y un sostén para su hogar, sigue desempeñándose en la ganadería, cría animales como cerdos, ovejas y cuyes para luego vender su carne, es una proveedora de carne de las bodegas y tiendas de su zona, alimenta a sus animales con pasto y alfalfa que ella misma cultiva (en la foto), así ahorra en los gastos de alimentación, esto le permite obtener las ganancias necesarias, hace poco tiempo con las ganancias de la venta de carne pudo sembrar otro terreno de alfalfa, y así seguirá trabajando. Gaby desea la tranquilidad para su familia, y adquirir mejores cosas para sus hijos. Con el dinero proporcionado, Gaby comprará 3 ovejas para engordarlas, además de ello mejorará su corral de crianza.

loans.use: To buy sheep to feed them and then sell their meat, and improve his farmyard / Comprar tres ovejas para engordarlas y luego vender su carne, además de mejorar el corral donde cría sus animales.

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años. Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende ropa. Ella empezó este negocio hace ocho años. Anteriormente vendía ropa en un puesto ambulante, sin embargo, los ingresos que obtenía eran insuficientes, por lo que decidió poner una tienda en una galería de ropa.
El último crédito que Rosa recibió lo invirtió en mercadería para su negocio. 
Ella cuenta que necesita un crédito adicional que le permita comprar una máquina de confección de prendas de vestir, así podría expandir su negocio y empezar a vender la ropa que ella misma diseña.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old. She has a store where she sells clothing. A business which she started eight years ago. Previously she sold clothing at different stalls. Even so, the income she obtained was not sufficient which is why she decided to open a store. Rosa used the last loan that she received to purchase merchandise for her business. She needs an additional loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can expand her business and start selling clothes that she designs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Ana J. con gran esfuerzo se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Esta dama se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio.

Debido a que comenzó hace seis años con su negocio, hoy en día ha logrado mejorarlo y salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos. No podemos obviar que ella es una madre soltera cuya labor es atender su negocio en el mercado y de igual forma atender a sus pequeños hijos.

La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito para la compra de la ropa, cosméticos y productos personales para comercializarlos en su tramo.
texts.en:
Ana Jiron has established her clothes and cosmetics sales business with great effort. She operates the business in the central market of her native city, Chinandega. This lady is known to be very hard working, someone who despite having faced a difficult economic situation built a successful business.

She started the business six years ago and she's still improving it today. She's also managed to improve the lives of her family which is made up of her two small children. We can't forget that she is a single mother whose responsibility it is to tend to both her business in the market and her two kids.

Ana has approached Ceprodel to get a loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and personal products that she will resell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon Y. is a group leader of eight people who all live in Korng Keb village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are farmers while the other is enrolled in the local school.  Her husband is presented in the picture.   She is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on her plot of land. He husband, Mr. E. C., is a fisherman. Their family needs more income to support their family and improve living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Yon Y. requests a loan to add to her savings to buy a new house for her family. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a new house for her family.

loans.name: Panah

texts.en:
Panah Q. is a 40-year-old butcher who sells mutton and beef to the local people and restaurants. Panah started his business in 1999, when he borrowed some money from his relatives and opened a small butcher shop uptown. Now Panah rents a shop in the heart of the southern city of Azerbaijan.

Panah is married and has 2 adorable children whom he loves most of everything. He tries very hard to improve their living conditions. Pahan wants his children to get a good education. Now he would like to build his own store and for this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. Panah counts on your help!

loans.use: build his own butcher shop

loans.name: Ly

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng Lý năm nay 27 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn Hà Nội. Hiện nay chị Lý đang là chủ cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa còn chồng chị là thợ lắp đặt điện nước. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn làm dịch vụ rửa xe nên thu nhập của gia đình hàng tháng rất ổn định( 4.000.000đ/ tháng) Vòng vốn tới chị Lý mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm dụng cụ phục vụ cho việc phát triển dịch vụ rửa xe.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hong Ly is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and 1 small child in the district of Soc Son, Ha Noi. She is the owner of a grocery store while her husband installs electricity and water. In addition, she also has a business washing vehicles and thus her family's income is very stable (234 USD per month). For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to buy additional supplies to expand her car wash business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Amaeze

texts.en: Amaeze is 50-years-old and is married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria where she sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, bathing soap, detergent and drinks. She is requesting a loan amount of $475 (N70, 000) to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO micro finance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Paulina Doris

texts.es:
La Sra: PAULINA, es socia del banco comunal, ella vive en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos de, 10 y 3 años.

Ella se dedica entre sus actividades domésticas a la crianza de vacas Holstein, teniendo un total de 10 vacas, las que le permiten la producción de leche fresca y sus derivados como son, quesos, quesillos, yogurt, manjar blaco, los cuales son vendidos en las ferias locales y en su mayoría llevadas a la ciudad del Cusco para venderlas en el mercado central de la ciudad.

Ella solilita el préstamo para la compra de 2 vacas holstein, y poder ampliar y mejorar su pequeño establo, para poder organizarse mejor y tener mayor producción a corto plazo.

La socia reconoce y valora de manera especial el préstamo otorgado, quedando muy agradecida y manifestando su compromiso para la pronta devolución del préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the communal bank and lives in the Tambo Real community in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 29 years old and has 2 children who are 10 and 3 years of age. Among her domestic activities, she works at raising Holstein cows and has 10 cows, which allow for the production of fresh milk and products such as cheese, quesillo, yogurt, and manjar blanco, which are sold at the local fairs and mostly taken to the city of Cusco to be sold at the central market. She is requesting this loan to buy 2 Holstein cows and to be able to expand and improve her small stable in order to get more organized and increase production in the short term. She recognizes the value of the loan and feels grateful and committed to quickly repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 cows and expand her stable.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE QUE INGRESA A EMPRENDER UN 8 DE MARZO DEL 2004 EN EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO UNIVERSO LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO DECIDE SACAR UN CREDITO EN FORMA INDIVIDUAL, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA NUEVE DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE DE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES EN SU PUESTO EN LA POPULOSA ZONA DE JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA QUE ACOMODA POR MAYOR EN LAS DIVERSAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO,  LA PAREJA TIENE CUATRO HIJOS QUE JUNTOS EDUCAN CON DEDICACION Y AMOR, SON CLIENTES DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD QUE TIENE EL ANHELO DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UNIAS MEJOR FUTURO PARA SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Ms. Cristina C. M. is an excellent client who joined Emprender, with the Universe Solidarity Group, on March 8th, 2004. After some time, she decided to request an individual loan and is in her ninth loan cycle for individual loans. She sells furniture at her site in the densely populated zone of Jesus del Gran Poder. Her husband is a carpenter and works in wholesale at markets in the city El Alto.

The couple has four children and they raise them with dedication and love. They are applicants with excellent attitudes, and a desire to excel and create a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a turner for carpentry

loans.name: Luafa

texts.en:
Luafa S., 52, is married with four children. She has ten years of experience in the taro and taamu business. She sells to the village people and public three days per week. She paid off her first loan of 750 tala and this loan of 1500 tala is her second loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala. 

SPBD loans are Luafa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Pay for her kids' school fees and purchase timber, iron roofing and nails for house repairs.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal  “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito D. Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 44 años D. edad, ella es casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercer grado).
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ya 10 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos  soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para su tienda.

Con este préstamo D. S/3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, piensa adquirir mas mercadería para su tienda, ahora mayorista, y abrir una pollería  que le generará mas ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda mayorista y una pollería; Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banquito son las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the “Dios es Amor” community bank in the MazoCruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 44, married, and has 4 children. She has a third graD. education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy groceries for her store. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy more merchandise for her store – now a wholesale store. She will also open a chicken store to generate more income for her family. Her biggest desire is to have a wholesale store and a chicken store. What she likes best about her bank are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, flour, canned goods, soft drinks and other basic needs items

loans.name: Azra Khalid Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Azra baji is a very hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered dresses on order which she collects from the cloth markets. She completes the order even if she is ill or tired. Her family is very inspired by her.

Her hardworking quality gives power to her husband also who runs a business selling plastic utensils. He goes to different communities and sells his utensils by making a loud voice. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy utensils to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Naziran baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her animal-selling business.

Nargis baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy utensils for her husband to sell

loans.name: Valihon

texts.ru: Курбонов Валихон проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Валихон более 20 лет занимается земледелием. В этом ему помогают дети. Он в основном выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Клиент получившую сумму будет использовать для сбора  урожая и посева второго урожая. И в дальнейшем продаст собравший урожай.
texts.en:
Valihon K. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Valihon has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. His children help him. He mostly grows rice and sells it at the market. The client will use the received sum to collect a harvest and to plant a second harvest. In the future he will sell the collected harvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant and collect harvest

loans.name: Mazouza

texts.en:
Mazouza is a 42-year-old married woman with 8 Children, all under the age of 18. She owns a grocery shop at Kharas village, near Hebron, while her husband works at a carpet shop in another city. Mazouza has one employee who helps her manage the grocery shop. 

Mazouza received more than ten loans from FATEN, all of which were fully repaid on time.  She has requested a new loan to buy goods for the store.

(The picture is of Mazouza in her store.)

loans.use: Buy goods for the Store

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea U. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Andrea owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily preparing and selling food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Andrea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Diomema

texts.en:
Diomema G. is 50 years old, married with 5 adult children and lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She and her husband have a small fish pen that catches shrimp and other freshwater fishes, and a small oyster farm. She and her husband started this small business 29 years ago, and it has been the main source of income for their family. Her husband augments their family income by hiring out their family owned tricycle, a motorcycle with a sidecar attachment, to shuttle passengers around the town especially when demand for Oysters is low. At present their gross family income is around PHP12,800 or approximately $275/month. 

The fish pen and the oyster farm has sustained her family over the years. Now one of her daughters is a teacher in a private high school, which helps, but she needs the loan of PHP 17,000 or $375 to repair and expand their oyster beds and fish pen so that it could gain enough income to also support her adult son whom she has invited to help in the business.

This is Diomema's 11th consecutive loan with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation's Project Dungganon. She has been a member of good standing since 2004.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Carlos Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos Rodolfo, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, el vive en el barrio de San Cristóbal, ubicado a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad misma.

Nuestro socio tiene 45 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, nuestro socio es de profesión profesor en un colegió en la comunidad rural de Pucyura, nuestro socio viaja cada día a las 6 de la mañana y regresa a casa todas las tardes a las 4 p.m.; el socio solicita el préstamo para poder cubrir unas pequeñas deudas,  de este modo le es más fácil al socio pagar mensualmente al banquito comunal de a pocos y completar sus otras deudas.

El socio agradece y valora mucho el apoyo establecido así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Rudolfo is a native of the city of Cusco, and lives in the San Cristóbal neighborhood, just 10 minutes from the city. Our member is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. He is a professor in a high school in the rural community of Pucyura, and leaves every day at 6 a.m. and returns every afternoon at 4 p.m. . Mr. Rudolfo is applying for the loan to be able to cover a few small debts. In this way it would be easier for him to pay monthly to the community bank little by little and redeem his other debts. He very much appreciates and values the support that has been established in this way and commits to repaying the money in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of debts

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María Del Rosario  M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad, en la costa del país. María maneja por sí misma una pequeña tienda de productos de belleza y ropa. El manejo de la venta lo hace siempre acompañada de su hijita menor de edad. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y comprar nuevos productos para vender, pues busca firmemente salir adelante y ser cada día una mejor persona.
texts.en:
María Del Rosario M. lives in province of La Libertad, on the country’s coast. María runs a small beauty product and clothing store all by herself. The way she works has allowed her to always be with her younger sister. Now she is soliciting a loan to reinvest in her business and buy new products to sell. She is always looking to advance and strives daily to be a better person.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: restock her business

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie C. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 31 years old, and is married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish, locally known as "bulad", in the local community. Ronie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand range of products.

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
Mr. Kimleng K., 40 (picture with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Ten, 42, live in a small village in suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for almost 21 years and have seven children. Two of them are garment factory worker, three are in school and other two are still young. 

Kimleng has been a truck driver for five years, while his wife has been faring for over 10 years. By the way, Kimleng’s two daughters, who are garment factory workers, have hairdressing skill and they want to launch their own business-operating beauty salon. 

Hence Kimleng is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to build a beauty salon and buy some materials for his daughters.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon for his daughters.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 33 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, who are all in school. Rebecca lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. 

She is a trader of onions. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Rebecca buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of onions in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
A sad part of the life of the family of Lorena C. is that their head of the family has to work faraway so as to provide for them. Lorena's husband Junarlim C., 35 years old (one year older than her), works as an overseas Filipino worker (OFW) on the other side of the world. To provide for the needs of their children, now 10 and 5 years old, Junarlim decided to work overseas because people think that there are a lot of work opportunities there. Aside from the salary of her husband, one source of their income is Loren's sewing business. She decided to run this kind of business because she knows how to sew various clothes and also, she wants to help her husband in earning income for their family.

She joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in 2003 and every loan that she received has been used in improving every business that she has. Now, her 9th loan will be used in improving her sewing business; she will buy necessary things for her business such as cloth, another sewing machine, thread, needles and many more, plus transportation fares. She is hoping that after buying all of these, her business will be more productive.

The dream of Lorena for their children is to have them finish their studies until college, so that the sacrifice of their father in working abroad will not be wasted and so that they will have a better life in the future. Lorena's dream for their family is also to make their house a bigger and stronger one. Her dream for her business is to continue to grow and in time they can buy their own van that can be used in delivering finished products.

loans.use: To finance her sewing business

loans.name: Addo

texts.en: Addo is twenty-eight. He is married and has no children. He lives with his wife in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for the family. Addo is a carpenter by profession. He has his shop by the roadside in his community. He makes all kinds of furniture – wardrobes, beds, chairs, etc. According to him, he has one apprentice currently under training. Addo buys the wood from sawmill firms and timber markets in nearby towns. He has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy working materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is from the village of Bungad San Pablo, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. Elizabeth owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Diana Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Diana es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 meses atrás(reingresante), del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió superior completo y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Diana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar ovejas y chanchos.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa y vivir con todas las comodidades.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Diana rejoined the "Gran Poder" community bank in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno as a member 3 months ago. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She finished high school, and she buys and sells livestock. Diana says that her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles with which she can buy sheep and hogs. Her future wish is to have her own home and to live with all the amenities. What she likes the best about her community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and hogs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim O. (pictured with her grandson), age 55, is a widow with seven children: four sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home; one is a garment factory worker. She lives in a small village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kim sells food in front of the garment factory. She doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for transportation. So she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to use for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang L. is 40 years old and lives in Prey Pnhi village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children who are all students in the local school. Her husband, Mr Khom Yors, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is shown on the left in the photo.

Mrs. Eang L. is a silk weaver who is able to earn a small income to support the family. Since her business is going well, she would like to increase it and continue to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy silk. The rest of the loan she would use to buy supplies and equipment to support her silk weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk plus supplies and equipment to support her silk weaving

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo solidaria. Tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo Walter de 28 años en su casa propia ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.  

Todas las mañanas y de lunes a viernes es la encargada de cobrar el pasaje y llamar pasajeros para la combi (camioneta) de trasporte público, donde su esposo es el chofer. Se levanta muy temprano, porque a las 5.30 debe estar desayunando, ya que la gente se desplaza con más frecuencia desde las 6.00  a 10.00 de la mañana
A Nelida le gusta realizar está actividad en apoyo a su esposo, porque los otros ayudantes que tenía no le deban todo lo cobrado y otros se fugaron con el dinero. En vista de lo ocurrido, ella se convirtió en su ayudante permanente, esta labor ya la realiza hace 10 años y también lleva la administración de las ganancias de la camioneta.
Ella manifiesta que le gusta lo que hace, aunque tiene problemas en la garganta debido a los gritos que suele hacer para llamar a los pasajeros y marcar las rutas, lo hace con cariño.
Para el futuro se ha proyectado en terminar la construcción de su casa y vivir del alquiler de las habitaciones que planea construir, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando en el transporte para alcanzar sus sueños.

Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y ratifica su compromiso, como la primera vez de ser responsable con sus pagos. Además tiene mucha gratitud a los integrantes de su grupo, ya que gracias a ellos pudo acceder al préstamo que le permite seguir trabajando hasta el momento. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de 4 llantas para su camioneta, para dar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Nelida is a hardworking woman who is responsible above all. She is 54 years old and lives with her husband and her son Walter (age 28) in their own home located south of the city of Lima.

Every morning from Monday through Friday, she is in charge of selling passenger tickets and attracting customers for her public transport minibus, which is driven by her husband.
