She wakes up very early and has breakfast by 5:30am since people travel more frequently between the hours of 6am to 10am. Nelida enjoys helping her husband in this activity because other assistants they have hired have either undercharged on the travel fare or ran off with all of the money. In light of these occurrences, she decided to become her husband’s permanent assistant. She has worked in this position for ten years and also manages the expenses related to the vehicle. Nelida enjoys what she does, but she has had problems with her voice because of the constant shouting necessary to attract customers and identify travel routes. However, she continues to perform her job with great affection. In the future, she hopes to finish building her house. Her family lives in a rental home while the construction takes place. In the meantime, she continues to work in transportation so that she can achieve her dreams.

This is Nelida’s second loan with MFP. She renews her commitment to be responsible with her payments, just as she did with her first loan. Nelida is also grateful to the members of her group because they helped her with accessing the loan needed for her business to continue. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase four tires for her minibus so that she can provide better service to her passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for her minibus

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: V. Irène est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mais Irène s’est installée à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis son jeune âge. Irène est célibataire et n’a pas encore des enfants.  Elle vit seule.  Irène n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Irène vend des chaussures et des sacs de façon ambulante.  Irène exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays à côté du Bénin. Irène a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Irène désire élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, mais elle manque suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver.  C’est la raison pour laquelle Irène sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Irène V. was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. At an early age she settled in Agblangandan, in the Sèmè-Podji area. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives alone and has never attended school. To meet her needs, Irene sells shoes and handbags as an itinerant vendor. She has been doing this for the past five years and gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also from Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. Irene has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she has fully repaid. She would like to increase the level of her activity, but lacks the financial means to do so. That is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Olajide Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 41 years old, married with three children. He hopes to give his children quality education. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He has a poultry farm where he rears poultry birds to sell at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. Micheal is requesting a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more poultry birds and feed. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds and feed

loans.name: Diki

texts.en:
Diki M. is currently in the business of selling sugar, salts, etc., in a retail shop. She is requesting a loan to stock boxes of soap, biscuits, etc., to sell. Diki is 39 years old and married to a nurse. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock boxes of soap, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana  Koné est un homme marié de 53 ans et père de 22 enfants qui vit  avec ses trois femmes et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans le village de Soromana, sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba  (troisième région administrative de la  république  Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école depuis le premier cycle fondamental (système éducatif Malien), Zoumana  Koné  a tenté plusieurs activités économiques notamment la vente d’habits, de chaussures et de tasses, mais sans succès, alors il décida de s’intéresser à l’achat vente de céréales. Cette activité (qu’il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand-frère) lui réussi et il dispose d’un magasin de vente. 
Avec une dixième année d’expérience dans cette activité, il est très connu et sollicité.
Zoumana Koné est à son cinquième prêt après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.
Il veut acheter avec son prêt, 1000kg de maïs, 500kg d’arachide et 500kg de mil auprès des producteurs pour les revendre au comptant et en détail aux revendeurs et consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Zoumana Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 .000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son magasin,  assurer les dépenses de la famille (santé, scolarité, nourriture) et acheter des animaux.
texts.en:
Mr Zoumana Koné is a married man who is 53 years old and father to 22 children. He lives with his three wives and their children in a large traditional family in the village of Soromana, in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After leaving school after the first basic cycle (according to the Malian education system), Zoumana Koné tried his hand at several economic activities, notably the sale of clothes, shoes and cups, but he did not have any success so he decided to turn to buying cereals. This activity (which he learnt with his older brother) has been a success and he has a shop to sell his goods. With ten years experience in this activity he is well known and sought after. Zoumana Koné is on his fifth loan, having repaid the four previous loans without problem. With this loan he wants to buy from producers 1000kg of rice, 500kg of peanuts and 500kg of millet in order to resell them for cash and on a retail basis to retailers and consumers. With this loan, Mr. Zoumana Koné is counting on making a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA which will be used to extend his shop, to cover the family expenses (health, schooling, food) and to buy some animals.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Melfie

texts.en:
Melfie E. is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Melfie owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily ice and ice candies, to local businesses and community members. Melfie has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Melfie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melfie is requesting her first loan, 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with six children who are all at school. She also looks after other family members. 


She has been running her business for ten years.  She plans to use the loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She operates her business as a wholeseller and her customers are local people and owners of bars. Annet buys jerrycans of local gin from the Kyenjojo and Kasese districts in Southwestern Uganda . She earns additional income from house rentals. She works six days a week.  

She depends on this job to make a living. Her main business challenges include transportation and  seasonality. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 


Annet lives in her own four roomed house. The family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 34 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 15 years.  All of her children are in school and she is doing well with her family.  

Marie Jeanne sells used clothes, including men's shirts, and bedsheets. She has been in this business for 14 years.  She is requesting for a loan to buy more clothes.  Her dream is to make enough profit that she can buy a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Hace 35 años nuestra socia Susana  trabaja con su esposo en una carpintería, ella trae madera del norte del país para poder hacer los trabajos que le solicitan. Con sus ganancias pueD. cubrir algunos gastos en casa. Susana es una socia optimista ya que además se desenvuelve vendiendo ropa y zapatos a pedidos. Su objetivo es terminar la educación Secundaria y estudiar Educacion que fue lo que siempre quiso. Susana está muy agradecida a Edaprospo y Kiva por los créditos otorgados.
texts.en:
For 35 years, our member Susana has worked together with her husband in their carpentry shop. Susana brings wood from the north of the country so they are able to meet their customers requests. With their income they are able to cover their household expenses. Susana has also developed a business selling clothing and shoes by request. Her goal is to finish her secondary education, something she has always wanted to do. Susana feels very grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the credits they have provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business selling clothing and shoes

loans.name: Mrs. Thear Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has sixteen people who live in Chrouy village, Takeo province. Mrs. Thear P., 36 years old, is a village bank president as selected by the other members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. P. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows crops to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Khorn Nget, is a vice village chief. He is also gem mining. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, and she did not have enough money to support the crops. So to improve her production, Mrs. Thear P. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a mother of four children who are all enrolled in a local public school and they are helping their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan belongs to a famous city called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. She lives in the area named Yadgar, which is situated in Lahore. Her house consists of three rooms. 

She is an old lady aged more than 50 who makes artificial flowers to financially support her family. She purchases raw materials from a wholesale market and makes beautiful artificial flowers to order. Her husband sells candies and toffees and her only son also has this same business.
 
Sharifan couldn’t provide an education to her son and he had started doing work for his family’s financial survival. 

Sharifan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son, who wants to improve his business by supplying a larger quantity of toffees and candies. With the loan amount, he will buy the candies and toffees in a larger quantity, which enables him to fulfill larger orders and increase his income.
 
Sharifan is in her fourth loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Aasah. She always attended all the meetings and has maintained a good credit record.

loans.use: Purchase candies and toffees on a wholesale basis for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of pants and shirts

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is married. He owns a small business offering advertisement services. He prints posters for light boxes located downtown along main streets. Petro started this business about two years ago. His income is about 6,000 Grivnas per month.

Petro is a very entrepreneurial person. His goal is to develop his business further. Petro is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Luisa Alberto

texts.pt:
Luísa Alberto G. nasceu na cidade da Beira, província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique solteira mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 21 e 23 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez a 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras para ingressar a faculdade. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta seu sogro que vive com ela.

Saiu da Beira para Maputo através da transferência dos serviços. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 30 anos é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Também possui um negocio de venda de frangos onde faz um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimo no Millenium Bim, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e raçoes para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para aumentar ainda mais a quantidade da sua criação.
texts.en:
Luísa Alberto G.  was born in the city of Beira in the province of Sofala in the center of Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 3 children, who are 14, 21, and 23.  They youngest one goes to school.  She finished through 12th grade and didn't continue because of the lack of financial resources for college.  She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her father-in-law, who lives with her.

She left Beira for for Maputo due to a job transfer.  She has worked as a teacher for more than 30 years for the Ministry of Education.  She also owns a business where she sells chickens.  She makes a monthly income of around 15,000 meticais, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

She has already had a loan with Millennium Bim.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her work colleagues who are also clients of this organization.  This is her first loan in the amount of 20,000 meticais, which she will use to buy chicks and feed so she can increase her amount of stock.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines so she can ask for another credit and continue to increase the number of chickens she raises.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Henry Cristobal

texts.es:
HENRY CRISTOBAL Q. M., Trabaja como Contador Analista en la Universidad Nacional Automona de Nicaragua.

es padre de familia de tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, el prestamos solicitado es para la compra de materialesd de construccion como: ladrillos, cemento y mano de obra para la su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: HENRY CRISTOBAL Q. M. works as an accountant at the Autonomous National University of Nicaragua.  He is the father in a family of three children, all of whom are of school age.  The loan applied for is for the purchase of construction materials for his house such as bricks and cement and to pay workers.

loans.use: He is going to use it for improvements to his dwelling and for some family expenses.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou T. habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Elle est mariée et âgée de 49 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de lait frais et de lait caillé. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle est membre du guichet de Bambilor depuis novembre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000frs dans le but de développer son commerce de vente de lait. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’améliorer  ses revenus , de renforcer sa capacité d’épargne et aussi de mieux prendre en charge les besoins  de sa famille en nourriture, et autres.
texts.en: Madam Fatou T. lives in the community of Bambilor. She is a 49-year-old married woman. She works in the fresh and curdled milk business where she has over 10 years of experience. She has been a member of the Bambilor microloan association since November 2009 and she already paid back a previous loan within the association. She is seeking a loan of 100 000F in order to develop her business which consists of selling milk. This funding will allow her to improve her income, to strengthen her ability to save money, and to take better care of her family’s food and other needs.

loans.use: For additional funding

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01hijo, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, Livia se dedica a la venta de frazadas, colchas y mantas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de mercadería, como por ejemplo frazadas y colchas al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias que generan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the "Bellavista 1" Communal Bank located in the province and department of Puno. She is 30 years old, has a live-in-partner and one child. She has completed high school studies.
She started working with the Manuela Ramos Movement 2 years ago. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to increase her working capital. Livia sells blankets and bedspreads. She is requesting a new 1000 PEN loan to buy merchandise, like blankets and bedspreads, wholesale.
Her dream for the future is to own a home.
What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the profits she generates from her savings.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of blankets and bedspreads

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate.

Encontramos a la señora Ana, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos, 5 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y tiene dos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en la escuela, en la actualidad cuatro de sus hijos viven con ella. Su marido hace fletes en un carro de su propiedad. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones aprende mucho.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa  todo tipo, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00. Además de esto también fabrica chifles los mismos que los vende a personas que le piden estos productos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde  pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Virgen De Monserrate community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of regal tamarind trees.

Ana, 60, is married and has seven children.  Five of these are grown up, but she has two who are 7 and 5 years old respectively and who are studying in school.  Four of her children currently live with her.  Her husband earns his living by carrying freight in his own vehicle. She has been a member of the community bank from the start and enjoys its meetings, since she learns so much from them. 

She has a small clothing workshop, where for many years she has made different kinds of clothes to order, as well as uniforms for local institutions, schools, and colleges.  She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm.  She also makes chips to order.

Ana will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing materials.  She would like to have a bigger workshop and a store in the center of town to sell her work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Wangoi Naiteyeyo

texts.en:
Wangoi Naiteyeyo is 54 years old and married to Raphael, 60, who is a livestock farmer. Together, they have three grown-up children – Joel, a businessman (aged 32); Naisula, a teacher (aged 30); Jackson, in college (aged 26).
Wangoi trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. She has been in the livestock business for a period of one year and her monthly profit is 4,000 KES. She has applied for her first loan of 15,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to purchase goats for resale. If her loan boosts her business, Wangoi will start a big dairy farm. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 28 years old, married and has two children who are six and eight years old. For the last year she has made a living by selling eggs, working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day. She has applied for this loan from Kiva and the Vision Finance Company to expand her business and acquire more customers. She plans to keep reinvesting in her business to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Violeta T., 57, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. She finished her high school studies and is married to Esteban T., 58, a jeepney driver. They have been blessed with one child,  who is currently in the third year level of her high school education.  Together, they live in  Paroloa, Tondo, Manila.

Violeta helps her husband earn a living by managing a banana-que stand where she also sells packed meals which she cooks herself. Banana-que stands are popular in many different corners of Manila. Banana-que is a delicious saba banana, deep fried and coated with caramelized brown sugar.  This is one of the best Filipino comfort foods.  

Violeta earns income by buying a variety of ripe bananas and selling them piece by piece with a minimum mark up.  Early in the morning, she also cooks the viands which are commonly used in Filipino breakfasts, packs them into Php 15-20 packets, and sells them to her neighbors and patrons in the community.  With these businesses, she is able to earn a minimum of Php 700.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she would like to request a loan for Php 8,000. She will use this fund to buy more goods and raw materials needed for her banana-que stand and packed meals business. With the help of this loan, she will be able to continue her business and increase her earning capacity as a micro entrepreneur.

Violeta learns the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate hers. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters, but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met simply by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One of the most important goal she has in mind is to support her child until college graduation, at which point she will feel most fulfilled.

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish to cook

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling vegetables. She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,600. Corazon is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.  This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Corazon aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fonk Sa Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FONK SA LIGUEYE est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de onze femmes qui sont du même quartier. Elles ont des liens d'amitié très solides. Le groupe fait partie du banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD.
Madame MARETOU S. (debout à droite sur la photo avec une écharpe jaune) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des légumes. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et de soutenir financièrement son mari
texts.en:
The solidarity group FONK SA LIGUEYE was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of eleven women from the same district. Very solid friendships tie them together. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA SUD.

Ms. Maretou S. (standing at the right in the photo and wearing a yellow scarf) is the group's leader. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three children. 

Maretou has a small-scale business selling vegetables. She has been in this business for over ten years. 

Her goal is to help cover day-to-day family expenses and to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for small-scale businesses

loans.name: Flerida Lucia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flerida, tiene 35 años, es casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es militar. Ella es Ing. Comercial.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local con vitrinas, también vende a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta las 18h00, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería compra en Guayaquil y también viaja hasta Ipiales (Colombia) y Huaquillas (Perú), nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio  15 años.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 13 años  y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus sueños es tener un almacén grande donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Flerida in this place. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 4). The older child is in school. Her husband is in the military. Flerida has a business degree.

She sells all types of clothing door-to-door, but most of her sales are conducted from her home where she has a small shop with display cabinets. Flerida also generates sales from orders submitted from her customers. She works every day from 9am to 6pm. Flerida offers her goods on credit and collects payment every fifteen days. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil, but she also travels as far as Ipiales (Colombia) and Huaquillas (Peru). She says that she has been in this business for 15 years.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She joined the Communal Bank when it first started 13 years ago and enjoys being part of the group. Her dreams include having a larger store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melanie is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Melanie has a  Ready-To-Wear clothing business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional  Ready-To-Wear clothing to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Melanie would like to make some business improvements and renovate her home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional Ready-To-Wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tuon's Group

texts.en:
To earn a living, Tuon P. sells groceries in the province. She is a widowed mother who is blessed with two children. Mrs. Tuon P., age 42, has been selected as the leader of the five people from her group. Tuon P. will be using her loan in order to purchase additional grocery items to sell. 

There are four other people who belong to this group:
Mrs. S., a clothes vender, who is asking for a loan to buy additional clothes to sell.
Mrs. S., a taxi driver, who is requesting a loan to repair her old house.
Mr. S., a fish seller, who is seeking his loan to buy more fish to sell.
Mrs. C. will be using her loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is from the village of Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. He is 47 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gil runs a business specializing in piggery, in the local community.

Gil has been engaged in his business for just this year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. He joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. 

Gil is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, with which he will purchase materials needed for his piggery business. This will be the second loan taken out by Gil from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his piggery.

loans.name: Fifa De Hlazounto Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFA DE HLAZOUNTO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amélée Brigitte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Amélée Brigitte est mariée à Donatien, un entrepreneur. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Amélée Brigitte et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Amélée Brigitte vend du maïs et des chaussures dans son quartier. Amélée Brigitte s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur  clientèle, Amélée Brigitte et les autres membres du groupe FIFA DE HLAZOUNTO sollicitent pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Fifa de Hlazounto Group is composed of three women living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Amélée Brigitte, who raises her hand on the photo.

Amélée Brigitte is married to Donatien, an entrepreneur. They have four children, all attending school. Three of the children are in their care. The family lives together in the same house. Amélée Brigitte and her husband share household expenses. To be able to do so, Amélée Brigitte sells corn and shoes in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in a city in Benin. 

In order to raise their activity level and better meet their customers' demand, Amélée Brigitte and her fellow members from Fifa de Hlazounto Group came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for the second time for financial assistance. The loan will enable them to strengthen their activity and better serve their customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and corn.

loans.name: Kuarahy Rese Group

texts.es:
Kuarahy Rese se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá.
La Sra Diana pudo acceder a ala información acerce del comite de mujeres emprendoras por medio de la reunion de la asesora en la zona en que ellas viven.
Ella define a las integrantes del comite como un grupo de mujeres a quienes el trabajo no atemoriza, es decir, les gusta lo que hacen y gracias a eso cada dia van creciendo más y más, como prueba de ello, este comite se encuentra actualmente en el sexto ciclo.
Ellas solicitan este credito para poder comprar frutas y verduras, y luego realizar la venta de los mismos. Desean poder tener una gran variedad de productos para poder asi atraer a sus clientes y demas futuros compradores.
texts.en:
Kuarahy Rese is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Ita.  Diana gathered information about the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program from a meeting that a loan officer was giving in the area where she lives.

Diana describes the members of her committee as a group of women who are not afraid of hard work.  That is to say, they enjoy what they do and, thanks to this, they are growing every day.  As proof of this, this committee is currently in its sixth loan cycle.

The members of this committee are requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables which they will then sell.  They would like to be able to have a large variety of products so that they can attract their customers and other future buyers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in the area

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: La señora Pilar, de 61 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de 7 hijos, es originaria de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa la cual atiende ella misma. A la edad de 14 años inicio en el mundo del comercio con su madre, ella vendía frutas y verduras en el mercado central y doña Pilar ayudaba a su madre vender con el paso del tiempo se independizo y puso su propio negocio de pulpería, el cual tiene 10 años de tener la venta y de esas manera fue que preparo a sus hijos y además sus otros hijos le mandan remesas que ella recibe e invierte en el negocio. Requiere el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos frijoles, maíz, trigo y sodas. Su es objetivo es mantener su pulpería surtida para atraer mas clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, pues uno de sus planes es ampliar su negocio y hacerles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. Pilar is 61 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.  She is from the city of León and works as a saleswoman.  She has a grocery store in her home where she works.  At the age of 14 she began working in sales with her mother.  She sold fruits and vegetables in the central market and helped her mother sell.  As time went on, she became independent and started her own grocery store business.  This business has been around for 10 years.  It has helped support her children and her other children send her money that she invests in the business.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, oil, eggs, beans, corn, wheat, and soft drinks.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked store to attract more customers, increase sales, and improve earnings in order to expand her business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: buy merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, eggs, beans, corn, wheat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Nuru has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Nuru sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Nuru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Nuru include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to sell on a wholesale basis.   

Nuru lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: To against with the chance and living in good living standard as others, so lots of couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to develop economy in family. In the many choices of works, Mrs. Kong and her husband always negotiation with each other for finding solution to progress more revenues in family. Currently, Mrs. Kong is a farmer. Take time from doing farming business, she words as a fish seller around the market and village. She could be made approximately $3 per day. Talk to her husband is a local factory worker in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.Mrs.Kong wishes to loan in amount of $400 in order to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas.

Artemia has been in this business for five years. Artemia earns more income from the general store.

Artemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Balikyewunya United Group

texts.en:
35-year-old Pascal is meticulous and painstaking in making his wooden furniture, be it tables, windows, sideboards or chairs. Some of the items he made recently were bought by one of the biggest showroom furniture exhibition sales entrepreneurs in the nearby metropolis of Kampala. His assiduousness, tenaciousness and sense of determination have been pivotal as he goes about his daily furniture-making trivial round. Carpentry is a profession often glossed over. By all accounts, many people carry the conviction that making ends meet out of it is not a viable prospect. It’s often regarded as a business for the less educated. There has been a turn in the tide however, as many school curriculums now lay emphasis on teaching and training in vocational subjects geared at inculcating in young people practical skills and knowledge. The change in the status quo has brought forth better fortunes for most carpenters. The stereotype is slowly and gradually being dispensed with.

Pascal is happily married with six kids. He obtained a footing in this business with savings from his farming business five years ago. For Pascal’s group, this is the first loan. Weekly, this business's gross sales are to the tune of 80,000 Uganda shillings. Pascal says this loan will enable him to procure more timber to make more furniture.

loans.use: To procure more timber

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a single parent who takes care of four children. She has no formal education and hopes to increase her sales of kenkey to be able to take care of her family. In the photograph above, Ama is showing fante kenkey and the maize she uses to prepare it. Her loan, when received, will be used to buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey. Her future plan for her business is to add the sale of other food items, such as vegetables.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien was born in 1990. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, in the Duc Tu commune. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in Da Hoi. Hien grows rice and also produces and polishes wood furniture. She works in her workshop, and has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has been involved with SEDA since 2009, and always repays her loans punctually. In this loan cycle she is borrowing 8,066,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly, 39 years old, is a tailor earning $10 per day, while her husband, a soldier, has an income of $5 per day. They have two children who are studying and one who earns $5 per day selling soy beans in the market. Every month, she has to spend $120 on food, $30 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

Somaly is requesting a loan of $700 to buy fabric to sell to other tailors who need it. She wants to extend her career so she can make better income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell to other tailors.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos es sastre. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de telas, hilos, broches, botones, etc.; con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa en alquiler misma queda ubicada en la zona de 14 de septiembre en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos pero ya están casados. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente pues hizo crecer su negocio y ahora tiene más trabajo, por lo cual necesita el préstamo. Esta será la cuarta vez que toma la decisión de su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is a tailor. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, thread, clasps, buttons, and other items. This business helps to cover his family’s expenses. Carlos lives in a rented house in the September 14th District of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children who are also married.

Carlos is very satisfied with the loans he obtained previously because they have helped him to grow his business. Now that he has more work, he needs another loan. This is the fourth time his loan will be referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, clasps, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants. Il vit en location avec son épouse et exerce le métier de chauffeur de taxi dans sa localité.Avec les revenus générés par son véhicule, il parvient à entretenir son épouse, à se prendre en charge et à envoyer un peu d'argent à ses deux parents restés au village.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter un nouvel moteur et remplacer le vieux moteur de son taxi qui tombe souvent en panne. son ambition est d'achetr un second véhiocule.
texts.en:
The borrower is newlywed, and does not have children. He rents a place with his wife and works as a taxi driver in his town. With the revenues generated by his vehicle, he manages to provide for his wife and himself and to send some money to his parents who stayed in their village.
He is requesting a loan for 300,000 XOF to purchase a new engine and replace his taxi’s old engine, which often breaks down. His ambition is to buy a second vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a hardworking entrepreneur, has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past two years. She also earns income from E-loading.

Evelyn, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans NWTF, is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sidh

texts.en: Sidh is 38 years old and lives with his wife in the Kampong Cham province. Since 1997, he has been a construction worker building houses. His wife is also a construction worker. In addition, she raises pigs. This couple has no children yet. They would like to request a loan of 300 USD to raise more pigs and to purchase food for the pigs.

loans.use: to raise pigs and to purchase food for the pigs

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié .Il est père de cinq enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce l'activité de commerce de bétail.Il parcourt les différents marchés hebdomadaires du pays à la recherche de vaches et de moutons à bon prix qu'il achète et revend sur les marchés environnants de sa localité.Cette activité lui procure des revenus consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge l'essentiel des  besoins de sa famille.Pour renforcer son activité , il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter 10 moutons.Son ambition est de construire une ferme pour faire de l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man. He is the father of five children of whom two attend primary school.

He is in the business of livestock trading. He travels to various weekly markets throughout the country in search of cows and sheep he buys at a low price. He then resells them in the markets of his surrounding area.

This activity provides him with significant income allowing him to meet most of his family's needs.

To strengthen his business, he is requesting a 400,000 francs loan to buy ten sheep. His ambition is to build a farm where he will fatten sheep.

loans.use: buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат активная и весёлая женщина 49 лет, со средним образованием, замужем и мать двоих детей (дочь и сын). Дочь выдала замуж, но сына ещё не женила. Занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов на рынке. У неё торговая точка на многолюдном месте и её товар не имеет сезонности. В  бизнесе она более 8 лет и ей помогает сын. Он сам работает на металлозаводе, но в выходные дни или в свободное время он развозит овощи и фрукты своим постоянным клиентам из районов. На свои накопления и на наш кредит он купил грузовик. У него есть грузотакси, на котором развозит товар. Рафоат собирается расширить ассортимент и количество товара под новогодний праздник.
texts.en: Rafoat is an active and happy 49 year-old woman, who has a secondary education, is married and is a mother of two children (daughter and son).  She married off her daughter, but not the son just yet.  Rafoat is involved in selling vegetables and fruits at a market.  Her retail outlet is located in a crowded place, and her products are not seasonal in nature.  She has been in this business for eight years, and her son helps her with it.  He works at a metal plant, but delivers fruits and vegetables to their regular customers in the districts during weekends and days off.  He used his savings and our credit to purchase a truck, which he uses to deliver the products.  Rafoat plans to expand her product selection and product quantities prior to the New Year's holiday.

loans.use: to expand her product assortment and increase product quantities prior to the New Year's holiday

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Vuth, 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. His wife runs a food store at Ta Moa mountain resort. Vuth requests a loan of USD 1000 to invest with his aunt to run a junk shop. In the future, he would like to own the junk shop himself, build a new wooden house, and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to invest in a junk shop

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Marina a sus 57 años de edad se dedica en sus ratos libres a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida a sus familiares, amigos y conocidos, esto debido a que trabaja como auxiliar de limpieza y aseo en una empresa del aeropuerto del municipio de Rionegro ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. La actividad de la confección la realiza desde hace más de 30 años, con la cual a podido mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su esposo y tres hijos. Con el ánimo confeccionar nuevas prendas de vestir femeninas para ofrecer a sus clientes y que le permitan mejorar su negocio el cual ha tenido dificultades económicas en los últimos meses, la señora Luz Marina necesita de la compra de insumos de tela e hilos con los cuales pueda sacar adelante su sueño y continuar apoyando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en: Luz Marina, 57 years old, makes a living tailoring over-measured clothing of family, friends, and other people she knows in her spare time. This is due to her working as a cleaning and tidiness assistant for a company of the airport of the municipality of Rionegro located to the east of Antioquia. She has been tailoring clothing for more than 30 years, due to which she has been able to increase her earnings and the quality of life of her husband and three children. With the aim of tailoring new female clothing to offer to her customers which allows her to better her business which has gone through economic difficulties in the last months, Luz Marina needs to buy cloth and thread supplies with which she can get her dream off the ground and continue financially supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread supplies.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still has his transportation business and provides taxi service in the different streets of the city of Cusco.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and through his work has been able to provide for his children.  He is requesting a loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo is 39 years old, is a mother of 4 children, and lives in the Prey Chor district. Keo and her husband are in the same business, cultivating rice crops for a living. Agriculture is their sole source of income. Keo has worked in the business since 2000. She presently owns only a few pieces of farmland for growing her rice crops, and the output she produced is barely enough to meet the needs of the family. As a result, she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner HKL to buy a store of rice for daily eating during the year. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to expand her farmland and produce sufficient output for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a store of rice for daily eating during the year.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pauline Bayivi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Pauline Bayivi  est âgée de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Pauline Bayivi  est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Patrice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pauline Bayivi vend depuis treize ans du haricot et de la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce de façon ambulante. Paul Bayivi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pauline Bayivi ensemble avec les membres du  groupe la PAIX, sollicite un premier  crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du haricot, du maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is 47 years old and has always been a dedicated farmer. She has ducks, chickens and geese on her land. One day per week she travels to the local market by her horse drawn carriage to sell her birds. She usually takes them alive in case no one buys them that day. She is a little bit nervous about taking out a loan due to the time frame of returning the loan within one year, but she understands the risks and is eager to succeed. Maria will work hard and travel to
the market more often to sell more birds. She is asking for a loan to purchase some more ducks and the supplies she needs to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en:
Talaitupu is an enthusiastic and lively person that believes that no matter how old you are, you are never too old to start something for the good of your children and family.

She has applied to the SPBDF for a loan of $875 to purchase materials that will allow her to start a small business that will allow her to put her talents to good use in order to earn enough to improve her family's standard of living.

Talaitupu focuses primarily on the production of muumuus and puletasis,  Samoa’s traditional wear.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials such as fabric, needles & thread

loans.name: Sno Bar

texts.en: Sno Bar lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman. She lives with one of her sons who has a shop of Afghani dash. Because he needs money, his mother wants to take a group loan for her son so that he can work and expand his business to make a good monthly income and make a good life for their family. He and his mother are very happy they would like to thank AFSG for supporting them.

loans.use: To buy kits of Afghani dash

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwa A.,a 35-year-old woman, and her husband are farmers. They have had four (04) children together. Thanks to the income from their pineapple farm, they manage to provide for the needs of their family. With this small income, Mrs. A. also takes care of her very old parents. Hard working and honest, she refunded without difficulty the first loan from which she benefited. To help her with her living situation, she is asking for a loan of $700 to grow her pineapple field. This opportunity would enable her to more effectively provide for the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Kossiwa, 35 ans et son mari sont tous cultivateurs. Ils ont eu ensemble quatre (04) enfants. C’est grâce au revenu de la culture d’ananas qu’ils arrivent à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Et aussi Madame A. doit s’occuper de ses parents très âgés avec ce maigre revenu. Travailleuse et honnête, elle a remboursé sans difficulté le premier crédit dont elle avait bénéficié. Pour alléger cette situation très précaire, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour agrandir son champ d’ananas. Cette possibilité lui permettra de faire face efficacement aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Grow her pineapple field

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
"I have a blacksmith business that I run from my house. I would like to invest in material and tools which will make my work easier and faster, and allow me to provide better service to my customers. I am asking for $900 to invest in this business."

“Tengo un negocio de herrería en mi casa pero me gustaría invertir en algo de material y herramientas, que hagan más fácil y rápido mi trabajo para poder dar un buen servicio y así tener más clientes” Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Consuelo J. and I have been a maker and seller of totrtillas for the last ten years. I need this loan to purchase milk, corn and plastic bags to package the tortillas. With the profits of my tortila sales I cover the cost of my children's education and medical expenses. I also help my husband with the monthly household expenses, as his salary is very low. I would greatly appreciate your help with this loan so I can purchase what I need.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy Wise, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Consuelo J., yo me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas hace 10 años. el dinero lo necesito para comprar; lecha, quintales de maiz, mantas y pailas plasticas para colocar las tortillas. Con los ingresos del que genera el negocio cubro los gastos de mis hijo de us estudios, medicinas y tambien ayudo ami esposo con los gastos mensuales ya que el sueldo de el es muy bajo. Les agradecere que me ayuden para poder comprar lo que necesito.

loans.use: Purchase corn, salt, milk and plastic bags for the tortillas

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.en:
H. Xayyam is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Jebrayil region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. He settled with his family in Sumgayit city. He is 40 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Xayyam is the only breadwinner in his family.

After borrowing $500 in 2004 from Normicro, he rented a shop. He borrowed a second loan of $800 and built the grocery store. The loans were paid back on time. With his third loan of $900, he expanded the area of the shop and increased the food assortments.

Now, he needs $1,400 to expand his business, open a vegetable section, and buy digital scales. He will borrow $200 of this loan from Normicro and the other $1,200 from KIVA. He hopes eventually to expand his business. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To expand his business, open a vegetable section, and buy digital scales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kyaliwajala B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace M.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to purchase more vegetables for sale. Grace is 48 years old and married to a trader. She has 5 children ranging from age 15 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her childrens' education. Grace received a previous loan for UGX 100,000 from BRAC Uganda in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Irene Nalusiba, Rose N., Rebecca G., and Stella Nalule. Irene Nalusiba is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to invest in her brick business. Rose N. sells snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to expand business. Rebecca G. runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy a hair dryer. Stella Nalule also runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to invest in the salon business.

loans.use: To invest in her vegetable business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old. He has three children, and one of them is studying in college. He has a small shop to sell clothes in the market. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new and modern clothes. He wants to expand the area of the shop, paint it, and make some advertising to increase his income and improve his business. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new and modern clothes

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena T. has always been a very enterprising woman, she is married and her husband works as a security guard at Pemex (Mexican Oil Company). Together they have 2 children, who are 5 and 2 years old.

Maria started her business 2 years ago, she was with her mother and sisters and they were going through a shoes catalogue. They planned to buy 5 pairs of shoes as the prices of the normal shops seemed very high in comparison to those in the catalogue. Instead, they decided to buy catalogues and start selling shoes to their family and neighbors.

She liked the idea of selling shoes during her free time as she could keep taking good care of her children. This business has also allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses and to improve their house.

Maria asks for a 300 USD loan that she will pay within 3 months. With this loan she will buy more merchandise as she has an order of 22 pairs of shoes. Maria is very happy because her sales have been going very well and with your support, her business will keep on flourishing.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

María Magdalena T. siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora, es casada su esposo trabaja como transito en Pemex, son padres de dos niños de 5 y 2 años.

Su negocio empezó cuando la invitaron a vender zapatos, en sus ratos libres y le agrado la idea ya que no descuidaría a sus hijos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 2 años, la idea surgió un día platicando con sus hermanas y su mama, todas ellas estaban escogiendo zapatos de un catalogo y le pareció que los precios estaban muy altos, entre todas iban a comprar cinco pares de calzado, y después de pensarlo decidieron mejor adquirir los catálogos e iniciaron así vendiendo a sus familiares y vecinas.

Gracias a esto ha podido ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar así como acondicionar mejor su casa.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses par comprar mercancía ya que tiene pendiente por surtir 22 pares de zapatos ella esta muy contenta la ha ido bien con sus ventas. Con tu apoyo magdalena seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: To buy shoes in order to fulfill a current order of 22 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Porfia's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as members of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

Raquel, a woman who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring women invited her friends to form a new one. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There Raquel shared with these women their previous experience in the Committee and explained to them how the Committee changed her life. Raquel’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

Porficia M. sells coal, Raquel I. sells jewelry, Diana G. and Patricia M. own a hair salon, Limpia Nunez sells cleaning products, Justa R. is a cook, Agustina G. makes and sells chipas, Sonia M., Rossana B. and Agueda S. sell cosmetics, Francisca Caniza owns a grocery store, Blanca R. and Dora A. sell food, Graciela L. sells silver products, and Angela M. sells natural remedies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of sugar, drinks, milk, cheese, cleaning products, flour, eggs, hair accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, drinks, milk, cheese, cleaning products, flour, eggs, hair accessories, cosmetics and others

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz) with his wife and five children, ages 14, 13, 11, 8 and 6. His work is the breeding of cattle, whose production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant).

He will use this loan to acquire livestock of a better breed. This is his first loan from Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo vive en la Comunidad de Igachi, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz) junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 14, 13, 11, 8 y 6 años respectivamente. Su actividad comercial es la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a la Planta Industrializadota de leche PIL Andina.

El crédito lo usara para adquirir ganado de raza mejorada. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. .

loans.use: Purchase livestock of a better breed.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi (his brother is pictured) is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region, the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is settled in the Absheron region. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Now this 51-year-old man needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for making cisterns. He is married and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making cisterns

loans.name: Caleb Isai

texts.es:
Since he was very young, Caleb learned the skills of farming; as an adolescent he supported his parents, now an adult he is renting land to farm it. With time and perseverance he has been able to purchase his own land where he grows potatoes. At 25 years old his dream is to become an important farmer, increase his production and buy cattle. Two years ago he went away from his land to work for a poultry business, and at his return, with his savings, he improved the quality of his land, he lives with his parents and is their main support. To keep investing in his land he requests a loan hoping to receive a positive response.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Caleb desde pequeño aprendió las tareas de campo, en su adolescencia fue un importante apoyo para sus padres, ya adulto, se inició arrendando terrenos para cultivarlos, con el tiempo y su perseverante, pudo adquirir su propio terreno donde cultiva exclusivamente la papa. A sus 25 años sueña con ser un gran agricultor, incrementar cada vez su producción y adquirir ganado. Hace 2 años se alejó de su tierra para trabajar en una empresa avícola, al regresar, con sus ahorros mejoró la calidad de sus tierras, vive con sus padres y es el mayor apoyo para ellos. Para seguir invirtiendo en sus tierras, solicita el presente préstamo, esperanzado con recibir una respuesta positiva.

loans.use: Increase capital to invest in farm land.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina is 54 years old. She's a widow and lives with her daughter named Flor who is 19 years old and goes to the local university. She's originally from the city of Juliaca.

She's always worked for her family, but since her husband passed away, her responsability has doubled since now she has to provide an education for her daughter. This is why she sells honey and pastries around the town in different areas in Juliaca. She sells to her neighbors who ordered her delicious honey and pastries. The most difficult part of her job is that she has to walk all over the town since she's of age and therefore not strong enough to walk for long periods. Nonetheless, she loves her job since it gives her a purpose in life and it makes her forget the loneliness her husband has left behind. Her only reason for working is to help her daughter Flor Ofelia pay for school.

With this loan, she will be able to purchase more honey and hopefully sell more so that she can make more money to help her daughter with college expenses.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Orfelina tiene 54 años, es viuda, vive con su hija Flor Ofelia de 19 años, quien estudia en la universidad local. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, siempre ha trabajado en bien de su familia, pero desde que murió su esposo la carga se le ha incrementado, ahora tiene que ser ella sola, quien vele por los estudios de su hija.Es así, que se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y queques, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulatoria por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca y por pedidos de sus vecinas, quienes la apoyan comprando su rica miel y sus deliciosos postres.Lo difícil para Orfelina es tener que caminar por las calles ofreciendo su mercadería, ya que la edad ya no le permite contar con muchas fuerzas, a pesar de eso, le gusta su trabajo, ya que le permite sentirse útil y olvidar la pena que dejó la ausencia de su esposo. A la única razón de su esfuerzo, es velar por el bienestar de su hija Flor Ofelia. Con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá más miel para comercializarla y apoyar a su hija con sus gastos universitarios.

loans.use: To buy more honey to sell around town

loans.name: Zaka

texts.en: Zaka is married and has 2 children. He is 48 years old and lives in Baku. For the past 17 years Zaka has been earning money as a shoe-maker. He now needs a loan of US$875 to buy the necessary materials for improving his shoe-making business.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for improving a shoe-making business

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana N. se dedica con gran esfuerzo al negocio de venta de ropa el cual comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio ya que gracias a la institución ha logrado surtirlo de ropa el cual los clientes le compran por tener precios favorables y de buenas marcas. La razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de la ropa ya que sus estantes se han venido agotando. Es importante destacar que ella es una fiel cliente de la institución ya que tiene un record de 25 créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana N. works hard selling clothing in the central market of Chinandega. Ceprodel has been a pillar of her business since thanks to this institution, she has been able to supply her business with good-priced, brand-name clothing for her customers. She is requesting this loan since her shelves are virtually empty due to good sales. It is important to highlight that she is a faithful customer of Ceprodel having already repaid 25 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena M., married and gifted with two children, her youngest only three months old, has operated a sari-sari store (a community based variety store) for almost five years.  Since the income of her husband as a driver is not enough to sustain their basic needs, Elena started this small enterprise as a way of earning extra income. 
	
Elena is a member of a micro finance group with a 100 percent repayment rate, but because of the current economic crisis in the Philippines, she lacks financial support to make her business grow.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soaps and other commodities which are in demand in their village.  The loan will be of great help in achieving her business goal: to increase her income for better livelihood opportunities in the future. 

“Don’t lose your hope and keep believing in God’s power as you fulfill your dreams in life,” Elena added.

loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells groceries. The demand for her groceries is high. She started this business in 2003. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Tuhtasun

texts.en:
Tuhtasun K. lives in the Asht region and he is engaged in the flour business. He is married and has one child. Tuhtasun has been a MicroInvest client since 2008. Thanks to previous loans he was able to improve their existing business of flour-selling and to increase the flour volume so that it improved their business turnover.

Tuhtasun also works as a bus driver. He sells flour together with his father. He works with direct suppliers so he can sell at lower prices than the bazaar prices. His wife is a school teacher.

Tuthasun is applying for a KIVA business support loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months for opening an outlet in the specialized flour-selling trade.

loans.use: opening a flour-selling outlet

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en: Alexei is a young person, he is 28 years old and lives in Leova district, Cupcui village. He is on track to start a family so his plan is to gain more profits by expanding his business. His business consists of growing grapes, something he has done for more than 5 years. He plans to produce wine in the future, but now he wants to increase the amount of grapes he grows. Alexei wants to buy a device to strip the grapevines and fuel for irrigating the land. MicroInvest is helping Alex with a loan to give him the opportunity in the future to become a very qualified specialist in wine production.

loans.use: To buy a device to strip the grapevines.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Olga es casada, tiene 22 años, una hija de 2 años  
La familia de Olga  confecciona, ella aprendió por que trabajaba en el taller de sus padres, hace   dos años se caso y con su esposo tiene un taller de confecciones, y un puesto de ropa con su cuñada.   
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser  solidaria, a tener amigas, aprendió a valorar lo que tiene, le gustan las charlas de negocio que se da en las reuniones del Bancomunal.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de tela Taslan sintético para hacer playeros.  
El sueño de Olga es  tener mas maquinas, mas personal y  comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank Jesús de Praga. Olga is married and she is 22 years old. She has a two year old daughter. Olga's family works in the tailoring business. She learned this craft in her parents' workshop. Two years ago Olga got married to her husband and they started a tailor shop together and a stand where they sell clothing with her sister-in-law. Since Olga has become a member of Finca she has learned to be supportive and loyal to her fellow members, to have friends, and to appreciate what she has. She like to go to the lectures on business that are held at the communal bank. Olga needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to buy nylon to make bathing suits. Olga's dream is to have more sewing machines and to purchase her own house one day. (Translated by Vitorio of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to buy nylon to make bathing suits.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. La casa donde vive es de los padres de su esposo, los mismos que se encuentra radicando en otro lugar. Ella y su esposo se dedican a fabricar y vender accesorios útiles para las carpinterías, como cancamos, que son ganchos de fierro que se usan para atrapar la madera, también elaboran cables, combas y otros objetos del mismo rubro. Llevan 25 años en esta actividad, su esposo es su compañero de trabajo porque es él quien fabrica estos materiales y Nelly los ofrece y vende. Posteriormente quieren alquilar un local donde puedan tener bien distribuido sus materiales y productos terminados. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todas sus integrantes son mujeres y son responsables y unidas. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de fierros para que su esposo siga fabricando los materiales a vender y con un monto menor invertirá en el arreglo de algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The house where she lives belongs to her husband's parents, who currently live elsewhere. She and her husband make and sell carpentry items, such as "cancamos", which are iron fastenings that are used to join pieces of wood, and they also make cables, ropes, and other such items. They have been doing this for 25 years, and her husband is her business partner because he makes these things, which she then sells.
