In the future they would like to rent a stall in the market where they can distribute these materials and finished products successfully.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her communal bank because all the members are women and they are responsible and united. The amount she is asking for is to buy iron for her husband to continue making their products to sell, and with a smaller part of it she will invest in some home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of metal to use in their shop

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en:
Batzaya S. lives with his wife and two daughters, both students in a local high school, in Arhanghay Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces.  Batzaya learned how to drive and fix cars at an early age and now owns a small car repair shop. Throughout the day, Batzaya repairs and changes the oil in cars and motorcycles while his wife washes their clients’ vehicles.  He also sells various car accessories and parts, and in the evening drives a cab to earn extra income. 

Batzaya is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is now requesting a loan to purchase more car accessories and a larger stock of car oil.

loans.use: To purchase more car accessories and a larger stock of car oil.

loans.name: Nargisa

texts.ru: Наргиса продает детскую одежду и обувь на центральном рынке города Исфары. Ей 29 лет, 2 детей. Муж тоже работает, а по выходным дням помогает Наргисе в ее торговле. Для закупа товара Наргиса раз в неделю ездит на оптовый рынок, а затем в течении недели продает. Наргиса собирается добавить в ассортимент товаров новые модели одежды и поэтому подала заявку на займ в КИВА.
texts.en:
Nargisa sells children’s clothing and shoes at the central market in Isfara. She is 29 years old and has 2 children. Her husband also works and on the weekends helps Nargisa with her sales. In order to purchase products Nargisa travels twice a week to the wholesale market and then sells them throughout the week. Nargisa plans to add new clothing designs to her product assortment and this is why she has applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Horoldamba

texts.en: Horoldamba A. is 34, married, and the father of three sons. All of his sons are attending an elementary school. His family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Horoldamba runs a grocery store at the center province. In 2002, together with his spouse, Azzaya, Horoldamba started to run a food stall at the local market. He began his business with 1 million tugrugs ($1 USD=1400 MNT), which has now increased to 4 million tugrugs (~US$2800.00). A couple of years ago, Horoldamba decided to expand his business and open a grocery store, that is running today. With the profit he bought a pick up truck for his business needs. He requests a loan to buy food products for his business. Horoldamba is a friendly and helpful person.

loans.use: To buy food products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl A. grew up here in Kisumu and runs a juice and yogurt business. She has her own recipe that she describes in this video. She has two employees who help her distribute the juice by going door to door in town. Beryl is a 28-year-old single mother of two children, aged 6 and 4, who, she says, adore her. The challenges she faces are paying her employees when business is slow.

In addition, Beryl says the weather has cooled down here in Kisumu, where the temperature on the day we interviewed her hovered around 80 degrees Fahrenheit. Beryl hopes to use the loan to open up her own canteen where she can serve her juices. This will allow her to stay closer to home while at the same time not having to run her business out of where she lives. She also hopes to employ more people. When asked if men or women make better entrepreneurs, she says women, a common refrain amongst our borrowers.

In this video, you can hear me greet Beryl saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Beryl responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Building Materials, Land, Ingredients

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS”, viveen la Av. Víctor Andrés Belaunde Nº 226, Distrito de Campoverde, tiene 61 años y 7 hijos mayores.

Ella vendía comida en el parque central del distrito de Campoverde, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de algunos víveres para preparar sus platillos ya que vendía comida. Actualmente se dedica a su bodega, el cual está creciendo poco a poco

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en comprar diversos abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da y la contribución con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of “ Las Nazarenas” Community Bank. She is 61 years old, lives in Campoverde District and has 7 adult children. She sold food in the Campoverde District Park. Her first loan received from Manuela Ramos was for $300 Nuevos Soles that she invested in the purchase of some ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

She is currently selling groceries at her small shop, which is growing little by little. She is requesting a loan for $600 that will invest in buying products to restock her grocery shop. She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and makes contribution to the women of that area.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva B. is from the village of Katipa. She is 32 years old. Eva is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Eva is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia A. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 39, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia owns & operates a general store. Her main source of income  comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Eufemia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 48 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa  heredada D. sus suegros. Hace 3 años decidieron, como familia, generar sus propios ingresos económicos D. manera independiente, es así que incursionan en el transporte D. pasajeros con el auto propio que adquirieron. Todos los días trabajan ofreciendo el servicio D. taxi, siendo su esposo el conductor y Elsa quien administra los ingresos y egresos del negocio. Adicionalmente, ha empezado a vender prendas D. vestir, las cuales ofrece a los pasajeros y a otros conductores D. taxi, D. esta manera esta pareja ha visto que sus ingresos han ido mejorando. Esto anima mucho a Elsa para continuar con sus planes a futuro D.  adquirir otra movilidad y ofrecer con mayor eficacia este servicio. Esta es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, desD. que ingresó a su banco comunal no ha dejado D. ser responsable en los pagos, por lo que se ha ganado la admiración D. los demás integrantes D. su grupo, es por ello que nuevamente renueva su compromiso D. seguir siendo puntual. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra D. repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento D. su  herramienta básica D. trabajo, que es su auto.
texts.en:
Elsa is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 48 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in the house they inherited from her in-laws. Three years ago, they decided as a family to earn their own income independently. So, they began to transport passengers in the car that they bought. Every day they work, offering taxi services. Her husband is the driver and Elsa takes care of the income and expenses of the business.

In addition, she has started to sell clothing, which she offers to the passengers and to other taxi drivers. In this way, the couple has seen that their income is improving. This encourages Elsa to continue with her future plans to acquire another vehicle and offer their services more efficiently.

This is the second opportunity she has had to take out a loan with MFP. Ever since she joined her communal bank, she has not ceased to be responsible in her payments, and so she has earned the admiration of the other group members. That is why she has renewed her commitment to continue being punctual.

The money that is requested will be invested in buying spare parts and paying for maintenance on her basic tool for work, which is her car.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania P. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old. Epifania is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Epifania owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Epifania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Epifania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina G. is from the village of Kabaksahan. She is 59 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop in her local community. Melodina has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Melodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Melodina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the profit to improve and expand her business.

------------------------ About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase new items to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Samphos Soen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who are all living in Preak Ta Ong Ti 1 village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Samphos S. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is alS. a weaver. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving. Her husband, Mr. Sun Soeun, is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Samphos S. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is employed in Casino Club and the others are attending the local schoO..

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving.

loans.name: Memsu Group

texts.en:
This is Matina B. B., Isatu J. and Mariatu T.. They named their group Memsu, a Temne phrase meaning “Try Us.” They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make better sales and consequently, improve their living standards. With the profit they make, they can better look after themselves and their children. They will use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They will also use it to feed and clothe themselves and their children. To achieve these goals, they are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Matina B. B. (right) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years of age. She was born in Makeni. Matina is married with two children, who are attending secondary and primary schools. Matina is a teacher who supplements her teaching profession with some petty trading. She sells market food, sugar, cigarettes and “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes). She has been doing business for five years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Baryalay

texts.en:
Baryalay is an old man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in the sales and buying of rickshaws. He has been involved in this business for more than 12 years, but he would love to have more autos. To buy more autos, he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani. 
He is a professional man and, from when he started this business, he has always wanted to improve his business. 

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for other small businessmen. He wants to continue his partnership and to encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: To buying more rickshaws for his buisness.
